story:
July 27, 2015

Hello to Everyone!

Every year just after the fall season arrives, the Black Hills Powwow & Games committee, headed by President Stephen Yellowhawk and supported by the rest of the committee and staff, organizes a great gathering for the indigenous people of North America (and all over the world!) with dance and games which are entirely supported by local and regional donations.  It is truly a beautiful sight to behold and an experience like no other. I am honored to have been given the opportunity to come again this year and be a part of this powerful event October 9-11, 2015. In the Lakota language, the Black Hills Powwow & Games is the "He Sapa Wacipi Na Oskate".

In years past of 2012 and 2014 I donated my time and talents to this event and captured many great images. I was able to gift these images to the Black Hills Powwow committee free of charge. These images are used for future years' campaigning, donation raising, web site, historical preservation and media representation.  I have freely given copies of my images via email to anyone of the attendees who wish for copies of the images. I also have a few of my own favorite dancers and of course I always try to get awesome images of them and for them.

I have been touched in so many ways by the Lakota people of the Black Hills of South Dakota. Being married into the culture for a time, I learned and experienced things that I will never forget nor will I ever take for granted.  Even though the marriage is no more, I will always be, in my heart, married to the Lakota people. It is extremely important to me and countless others that all indigenous cultures and their languages are kept alive and even more they should thrive. One way to keep traditions and even current trends alive and to send them down through history is via photographic images

My goal here is to pass down my images to the people. In the coming years I am very interested in the possibility of compiling a book of images for the Black Hills Powwow Association, and this may be a funding campaign of mine for the future; the proceeds of which would be in part donated to the Black Hills Powwow Association. THANK YOU in advance for helping achieve my goal this year to complete the annual trip to Rapid City, South Dakota and the Black Hills Powwow & Games. 

Blessings,

Clarice Lakota

story:
La nostra storia

Abbiamo iniziato il tutto con un corso di robotica, per imparare le basi dell'elettronica e della programmazione informatica.

Dopo il corso, della durata di 5 mesi, siamo andati a Milano per partecipare alla "RoboCupJR Italia", una competizione a livello nazionale dove lo scopo è costruire un piccolo robot in grado di riconoscere e localizzare le "vittime". Le nostre categorie sono "Rescue Maze" e "Rescue Line" e i nostri Team si chiamano "RescueLine Galilei" e "RescueMaze Galilei"(molto originali).

Nel "RescueMaze" il robot è posizionato in un labirinto dove le vittime sono delle zone calde a 37°C. L'obiettivo è evitare gli ostacoli e localizzare tutte le vittime, posizionando un kit di salvataggio costituito da un piccolo cubetto di legno o plastica.

Nel "Rescue Line" il robot deve procedere lungo una linea nera su di una superficie bianca, superando ostacoli, interruzioni della linea, scegliendo la giusta via agli incroci per raggiungere la stanza finale di "salvataggio". Nella stanza finale l'obiettivo è localizzare le "vittime", che sono delle piccole sfere, e salvarle. 

Dopo 3 giorni di competizioni abbiamo vinto in entrambe le categorie e siamo passati alla fase successiva, guadagnandoci un posto alle competizioni internazionali, che si svolgono quest'anno in Cina.

È la prima volta in Italia che un robot costruito con OpenHardware (Arduino) vince questa competizione. Negli anni scorsi i Team vincitori hanno usato dei costosi e non-open Lego Mindstorms, la piattaforma robotica sviluppata e venduta in kit dalla Lego.

Eccoci qua!! Noi siamo 8 di questi studenti, dopo le competizioni a Milano.

Di cosa abbiamo bisogno

Sfortunatamente la scuola non possiede tutto il denaro necessario per mandarci in Cina, soprattutto in questo periodo di Crisi.

Per favore, aiutaci a raccogliere abbastanza denaro per volare ad Hefei, in Cina, a rappresentare l' Italia alle competizioni internazionali.

Anche un singolo Euro ci porterebbe più vicini alla meta! Grazie mille!

Altri modi per aiutare

Puoi aiutarci anche diffondendo questa pagina e questo progetto. Non dimenticarti di condividerlo sui Social Networks!


Our Story

We started everything with our school a robotic course, to learn the basics of electronic and IT technology.

After the 5-months course we participated to "RoboCupJR Italia", a national competition where the target is to build a small robot that can recognize, locate and save "victims". Our categories were "Rescue Maze" and "Rescue Line", and our teams name were "RescueMaze Galilei" and "RescueLine Galilei" (very original).

In "Rescue Maze" the robot is placed in a labyrinth where the victims are warm zones at 37°C. The target is to avoid obstacles and locate all the victims, placing a rescue kit made of a small cube of wood.

In "Rescue Line" the robot has to proceed along a black line on a white surface, avoiding obstacles, interruptions of the line and choosing the right way on intersections to reach the final room. In the final room the target is to locate the "victims", which are little spheres, and save them.



After 3 days of competitions we won in both the categories and we have passed the qualification to go to the international competition, that this year is in China.

It is the first time in Italy that a robot made with Open Hardware (Arduino) wins this competition. In the last years the teams who won used the expensive and not open Lego Mindstorms Kit.

Here we are!! We are 8 of these students, after the competition in Milan.

What We Need

Unfortunately the school has not enough money to send  us to China.

Please, help us to raise enough money to fly to Hefei, in China, and represent our country in the international competitions.

Also a single Euro would help us! Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us also telling this project to other people, don't forget to share it on social networks!

story:
Participate in the #Ribboning Relay

  1. Have a picture taken of yourself in a #Ribboning pose with your body in the shape of a cancer ribbon

  2. Upload your photo to Facebook or Instagram and share who you are Ribboning for
  3. Tag three friends to keep the Ribboning Relay going and challenge them to participate in the Ribboning Relay.

Not Your Average Love Story

"Britton and I both lost spouses to cancer prior to meeting one another. Britton's wife, Jax, and my husband, Ruben, both relied on MyLifeLine.org to relay information to loved ones who anxiously awaited updates. It was actually the founder of MyLifeLine.org, Marcia Donziger, who introduced us at a time when we both needed to talk with someone who understood."

- Jen Garza Thomas

Jen & Britton are getting married on July 16, 2015.   They inspired MyLifeLine.org to raise awareness for the family caregivers taking care of their loved ones with cancer. 

By funding this campaign, you're becoming part of a bigger community that provides critical resources to support the millions of others hurting from the effects of seeing a loved one go through a cancer diagnosis. 

With your support, we can keep love going.

Why Are We #Ribboning?

When you lose someone you love, your whole world changes and just finding the courage to get out of bed in the morning becomes a weight only those who've experienced tragedy would know.  What started as two grieving souls supporting one another, blossomed into a second chance at love after loss.  All because of MyLifeLine.org.

The Impact

MyLifeLine.org's vision is to create the most innovative social network in the world dedicated to the unique needs of families affected by cancer. 

Since inception in 2007, 130,000 people have registered on MyLifeLine.org to give or receive support.  Research proves a strong support community is vital to positive healing outcomes.

MyLifeLine.org is a FREE resource which provides:

  • Ease of communication and connection with loved ones
  • Ongoing encouragement and inspiration, anytime, anywhere
  • Comprehensive cancer-specific resources, education, and personalized online support community
  • Vital and unique tools on one integrated social network
Learn more about MyLifeLine.org and our impact on families affected by cancer.

Where Your Money Goes

We provide patients and caregivers with personalized, private online communities where they can post updates for friends and family, coordinate volunteers, discover the best cancer resources, and request donations for medical expenses and other vital needs. 

MyLifeLine.org needs funding to:
  • Add pediatric oncology features for families of children facing cancer
  • Raise awareness to spread the message of "caring for the caregivers" 
  • Develop a MyLifeLine.org mobile app
  • Redesign website to provide a better user experience

"As a cancer survivor, my vision in founding MyLifeLine.org was to ensure no one faces cancer alone by creating a platform that focuses 100% on the unique needs of families impacted by cancer. 

Over the years, we've learned that the needs of family caregivers have been overlooked for so long.  We are #Ribboning to shed light on the issues faced by caregivers.  Some of the issues include fear, isolation, emotional and financial stress.  We provide solutions to overcome these barriers to recovery. 

MyLifeLine.org is about the people....connecting communities, because the community around each patient plays a critical role throughout the treatment and healing process."

~ Marcia Donziger, Founder and Chief Mission Officer

Ribbon, Give, and Share!

Jen and Britton are asking wedding guests and friends to back this campaign to support the organization's free services they provide to thousands of families affected by cancer. 

What Is #Ribboning?

There was Planking. Then Tebowing. Now, there's #Ribboning. 

#Ribboning is drawing attention to the people behind a cause and a cancer, rather than the condition itself.  We do this in support of people affected by cancer and to be a celebration for having made a donation to MyLifeLine.org.


     

    

Who will you be #Ribboning for?

Challenge your friends to a contest. Grab a friend and ribbon together, set a goal and ribbon at the end of a climb, or dress in the color of the ribbon for the cancer you support. 

Ribbon from the highest mountain, or from your own backyard.  All that matters is you ribbon, give, and share on social media to show your support. 

Share to Keep Love Going

  • Share the link to this campaign to Facebook and tag someone you love affected by cancer.
  • Tweet "link" to this campaign with #ribboning pic of yourself
  • Post your #Ribboning photo on Instagram to join the movement.
  • Take the baton and pass it on - Ribbon & Give

Who Are You #Ribboning For?

story:
We Can Stop Veteran Suicides!
...BUT it takes an innovative approach to solve this problem.

WE ARE THE VETERANS SUICIDE PREVENTION CHANNEL

The Veterans Suicide Prevention Channel's (VSPChannel) goal is to create a Veterans National Broadcast Television Channel in America that produces and broadcasts programming specifically designed to meet the emotional, therapeutic and informational needs of our nation’s veterans. By doing so, we hope to reduce and eventually eliminate  veteran suicides in America. The VSPChannel will broadcast shows that will promote wellness, guidance, referral and information to veterans and their family members dealing with PTSD, depression and anxiety. A great number of veterans will not go to the VA to seek help. We believe that the VSPChannel will help many veterans with health and mental health issues in the comfort of their own homes. This is a powerful idea whose time has come, but we cannot make it happen without your support. PLEASE DONATE TODAY!


The VSPChannel is an organization comprised of veterans and concerned volunteers working together to try and stop veteran suicides in America. We are a nonprofit organization that was founded on January 16, 2015 and we have been granted  501 (c) (3) status by the IRS.

WHO ARE WE?

Our Board of Directors:

Glenn Towery, Founder and Chairman, Juanita Cole Towery, Secretary, Michael White, Operations Manager, Jay Johnson,  Marketing Manager, Andrew O’Brien, Board of Directors Member

WHY ARE WE HERE?

There are many good causes in America that may ask for your time, support and donations, but none quite as moving as stopping veteran suicides and protecting and supporting veteran's immediate family members from the threat of losing a cherished member of their family. When a veteran commits suicide in America, there are so many people affected by the inexplicable loss. It is our intent to end veteran suicides in America through our innovative approach to this terrible lingering problem.

WHAT WILL YOU BE SUPPORTING WITH YOUR DOLLARS?

The VSPChannel is creating programming designed to address the causes of veteran suicides and bring much needed support to thousands of veterans nationwide in the comfort of their homes. Programs that are informational, educational and entertaining. Our programs and shows will always be designed to promote wellness and good mental and emotional health to America’s veterans. They will also provide support for their family members, including those who have already lost a veteran to suicide. Now that you know about our reason for being, let us give you a little more background on who we are. Below are links to a few of the shows that we have already managed to create for our channel.

WHERE CAN YOU FIND US?


The Veterans Suicide Prevention Channel can be found on our website: http://www.veteranssuicidepreventionchannel.vet/pages/videos/#/?playlistId=0&videoId=0

The VSPChannel will continue to maintain our web presence even after we reach our goal of becoming a National Broadcast Television Channel for America's veterans. A  channel that can be accessed by veterans 24 hours, 7 days per week in the comfort of their own homes. Once we achieve this goal, we envision our channel being carried by every cable company in America.

OUR COMPLETED SHOWS

We have managed to film some of our shows due to the benevolence of people who have volunteered time, talent and energy. The shows that we have completed are listed below. These shows were completed without any monetary donations. Imagine what we can accomplish once funded.

(Go To The GALLERY Section of this site to "SEE" more of our shows.)

"COOKING WITH CHEF DAD" (2 shows and an interview)

"TAI CHI WITH SIFU DAVE PICKENS" (2 shows and an interview)

"THE VETERANS LUSTER SHOW" (1 pilot show)

"The VSPC NEWS SHOW" (1 episode)

"MINDFULNESS WITH DR. ELIJAH GOLDSTEIN" (2 episodes)

"THE V.E.T. SHOW" (2 episodes)

"Assorted veteran interviews" (12)


WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT THE VSPCHANNEL?

There is no other channel today that is offering  these services to veterans via broadcasts. Veterans are our nation’s most valuable resource. Without veterans, there would be no America! America has a national broadcast channel for pets but not for our nation’s veterans. We must do something about it! We love pets as much as the next person but veterans deserve a channel of their own. A channel that will work towards creating a better life for them by providing wellness, informational, resource and entertainment shows. The VSPChannel takes into account the many veterans that are stuck at home and will not go to the Veterans Administration for treatment. The VSPChannel will reach them in their homes and supply them and their family members with positive messages of support. There is also a news broadcast with the latest news about veterans, for veterans and their family members and supporters.  We Can Stop Veteran Suicides!

HOW YOU CAN HELP?

Spread the word about the VSPChannel. Ask your relatives, friends and organizations to support us in this endeavor. Tweet our message to all of your friends and ask them to follow us on https://twitter.com/vspchannel

Tweet our message: #We Can Stop Veteran Suicides Now! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qke0GEhvBCA


WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE FOR YOUR DONATION:

*All donations are tax deductible.

*An iTunes purchase of the VSPChannel’s “22 a Day, Code Red” (Donation Song) for $2.99

*$25.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation)

*$50 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster)

*$75.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster & T-shirt)

*$100.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster, T-Shirt & free copy of “22 A Day Code Red!”)

*$500.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, Limited Edition Print by Artist, Juanita Cole Towery)

*$500.00 - $1,000.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, VSPChannel poster, Limited Edition Print by Artist Juanita Cole Towery, Mention on VSPC Channel)

*$2,000 - $5000.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, VSPChannel poster, Limited Edition Print by Artist Juanita Cole Towery, Credit on VSPC Channel)

*$5,000.00 and above donations will be credited as VSPChannel show sponsors and will receive a VSPChannel Donor Plaque, permanent plaque on the wall of the VSPChannel facility).

OUR "SONG FUNDER" on CDBaby.com

We also have a song fundraiser. Anyone can purchase the song file “22 A Day, Code
Red!” at CD Baby.com and via iTunes and 94 other online sites. Your purchase is tax deductible and 100% of your purchase price will go to the Veterans Suicide Prevention Channel. The song is performed by two brothers who are both Vietnam Combat veterans that go by the names -HADU- and STONEMAN. The song file may be purchased at:
http://cdbaby.com/cd/glenntowery2

or at the online music retail outlets listed above.

Thank you for supporting America’s veterans. Donate by purchasing this song and spread the word. *ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE

WE CAN STOP VETERAN SUICIDES!.

“22 A Day Code Red! (Music Video)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKoG2E7-oAk

WHERE CAN YOU FIND US?

The Veterans Suicide Prevention Channel can be found on our website:
http://www.veteranssuicidepreventionchannel.vet/pages/videos/#/?playlistId=0&videoId=0
The VSPChannel will continue to maintain our web presence even after we reach our goal of becoming a National Broadcast Television Channel for America's veterans. A  channel that can be accessed by veterans 24 hours, 7 days
per week in the comfort of their own homes. Once we achieve this goal, we envision our
channel being carried by every cable company in America.

OUR COMPLETED SHOWS
We have managed to film some of our shows due to the benevolence of 
people who have volunteered time, talent and energy. The shows that we 
have completed are listed below. These shows were completed without any monetary donations. Imagine what we can accomplish once funded.
(Go To The GALLERY Section of this site to "SEE" more of our shows.)
"COOKING WITH CHEF DAD" (2 shows and an interview)
"TAI CHI WITH SIFU DAVE PICKENS" (2 shows and an interview)
"THE VETERANS LUSTER SHOW" (1 pilot show)
"The VSPC NEWS SHOW" (1 episode)
"MINDFULNESS WITH DR. ELIJAH GOLDSTEIN" (2 episodes)
"THE V.E.T. SHOW" (2 episodes)
"Assorted veteran interviews" (12)

WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT THE VSPCHANNEL?









There is no other channel today that is offering  these services to veterans via broadcasts. Veterans are our nation’s most valuable resource. Without veterans, there would be no America! America has a national broadcast channel
for pets but not for our nation’s veterans. We must do something about it! We love pets as much as the next person but veterans
deserve a channel of their own. A channel that will work towards creating a better life for
them by providing wellness, informational, resource and entertainment shows. The
VSPChannel takes into account the many veterans that are stuck at home and will not
go to the Veterans Administration for treatment. The VSPChannel will reach them in their homes and supply them and their family members with positive messages of
support. There is also a news broadcast with the latest news about veterans, for veterans and
their family members and supporters.  We Can Stop
Veteran Suicides!

						

HOW YOU CAN HELP?
Spread the word about the VSPChannel. Ask your relatives, friends and
organizations to support us in this endeavor. Tweet our message to all of your friends and ask
them to follow us on https://twitter.com/vspchannel

Tweet our message: #We Can Stop Veteran Suicides Now!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qke0GEhvBCA

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE FOR YOUR DONATION: 
*All donations are tax deductible.

						
*An iTunes purchase of the VSPChannel’s “22 a Day, Code Red” (Donation Song) for $2.99 
*$25.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation)

*$50 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster)

*$75.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster & T-shirt) 
*$100.00 donation (Certificate of Appreciation, VSPChannel poster, T-Shirt & free copy of “22
A Day Code Red!”)

						
*$500.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, Limited Edition Print by Artist, Juanita Cole
Towery)

*$500.00 - $1,000.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, VSPChannel poster, Limited Edition
Print by Artist Juanita Cole Towery, Mention on VSPC Channel)









*$2,000 - $5000.00 donation (VSPChannel Donor Plaque, VSPChannel poster, Limited Edition
Print by Artist Juanita Cole Towery, Credit on VSPC Channel)

*$5,000.00 and above donations will be credited as VSPChannel show sponsors and will receive
a VSPChannel Donor Plaque, permanent plaque on the wall of the
VSPChannel facility).

OUR "SONG FUNDER" on CDBaby.com
We also have a song fundraiser. Anyone can purchase the song file “22 A Day, Code
Red!” at CD Baby.com and via iTunes and 94 other online sites. Your purchase is tax deductible
and 100% of your purchase price will go to the Veterans Suicide Prevention Channel. The song is performed by two brothers who are both Vietnam Combat veterans that go by the names -HADU- and STONEMAN. The
song file may be purchased at: 
http://cdbaby.com/cd/glenntowery2 
or at the online music retail
outlets listed above.

Thank you for supporting America’s veterans.
Donate by purchasing this song and spread the word.
*ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE

WE CAN STOP VETERAN SUICIDES!.

“22 A Day Code Red! (Music Video)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKoG2E7-oAk

story:
Tea with Mali will reach 12.5 million households this year. You helped transform the web series into a nationally distributed television show.

That’s because you understand the need for a new type of business conversation. We have dedicated 3 years of sweat to highlighting legacy based businesses and community advocates. From baby boomers to young professionals, we reach out and inspire viewers to uncover their passions and live a vibrant life that benefits others.

But now, your source for real insights and tangible guidance may be in jeopardy. Unless we are able to raise funds by the end of October we are in danger of losing the televised version of Tea with Mali. We need your help today. With your contribution, we’ll continue to share positive role models and change makers with you; true visionaries who are making our world better.

That’s why we're relying on you to renew your support for Tea with Mali today. Tea with Mali is about much more than sharing business advice. We're a reminder to those struggling through change or seeking direction that they are capable, they are worthy and they can excel. That's what we're seeking to fund through this campaign and we can’t do this without your financial contributions and social media shares.


Please click on the donation of your choice in the right hand column to support a better experience, including:

  • Improved Picture Quality. We are focused on upgrading our episodes with best quality picture possible -- bringing you an enhanced experience while helping us maintain a competitive edge.
  • Wider Digital Access. Tea with Mali is working toward reaching a broader selection of online and digital platforms -- doubling... possibly tripling our reach into homes across the country, and increasing our positive influence.
  • Paid Team of Production Experts. We plan to promote the team of extraordinary technicians and marketers who have helped us to grow and bring in other professionals to build an unstoppable team.

Why this Matters

We want to inspire, motivate and encourage future leaders to share their gifts, talents and life experiences with others. We want them to know that their stories, visions and aspirations matter and that they too can change the world, starting with theirlocal communities. Our interviews are intended to share real stories, real hope and real possibilities for everyone, regardless of economic status, race, culture or religious views.

After escaping from her war-torn country of Laos, overcoming poverty and racism in her new home and experiencing the abrupt losses of loved ones, Mali has a deep understanding of how to overcome life's most painful challenges. With our host’s definitive voice, Tea with Mali seeks to provide aspark of inspiration and hope.

What We Need

In order for us to produce one season of Tea with Mali, (13 episodes) we must raise $83,200. This spark will increase viewership, enhance our production value and allow us to continue our creation and become a self-sustaining program.

What You Get

Whether you donate $10 or $1000, we appreciate every cent! You will be thanked on our facebook page and in a personal email. If you prefer, you can also choose to stay anonymous. Select what level you’re able to come on board. We’ve got packages for individuals, small businesses, anyone who wants to contribute to this movement.

One of our biggest prizes is our ad book. 1,000 copies will be distributed throughout the DMV and at the OWN Belief Event sponsored by SOAR Community Network in October.


How to Contribute

If you can donate even a small amount, we are truly grateful. But don't stop there! Help us spread the word! Have a local business you think will fit with our message? Introduce us. Share this page on your Facebook page, tweet it, Instagram it. We only have 50 days to raise $80,000!  - use whatever social media strategies you like to help this campaign succeed. We can't thank you enough!

Special Thanks to Those Who Have Helped Us with Production Up to This Point.

Israel Nieves, Victor Cora Nazario, Malia Murray, Ian Couch, Amber Lee, Fresia Blanco, Cassie Calvert, Maya Rose Lederer, Margarita Narvaez and Kevin Narvaez.

Thank you to ALL our original supporters, donors and sponsors who have contributed with monetary funds or by sharing your gifts and talents.

and Thank YOU to our newest contributors and social media champions! Your support is INVALUABLE!

story:
Lilly & James is a short Ballet Drama based on the first chapter of James Frey's bestselling novel My Friend Leonard, his sequel to A Million Little Pieces. In both books, Lilly is James’ love. They are two young lovers with a past of drug addiction and hopes of redemption.

As for Your Role in Lilly & James, through this first fundraiser you are contributing to the filming of the Dance Sequence of our movie (choreographed by our wonderful Antonio Lopez). Once we film the Dance Sequence, to complete our project we will look for a Sponsor - most likely a Dancewear Company -, an Executive Producer and other Producing Titles which are listed in our Perks. Please choose the one that fits you best and jump in now in advance!  If you are interested in a closer look at our Budget, please feel free to scroll down.

 

And now, time to learn more about part of our Team....

 

 

CREATIVE TEAM

 

MATIA KARRELL, Director

Matia Karrell 

directed and co-wrote the 1989 Academy Award Nominated short film, CADILLAC DREAMS.

 In 2001, she directed and co-wrote her first feature length film, BEHIND THE RED DOOR, starring Kiefer Sutherland and Kyra Sedgwick.

Her second feature film, ONCE UPON A WEDDING (2005), starring Esai Morales and A Martinez, also had its television premiere on Showtime. In television, Karrell has directed episodes of THE WEST WING (2006) and ARMY WIVES (2010), as well as the mini-series AMERICAN HEIRESS (2007). Other television directing credits include multiple episodes of THE WONDER YEARS, DOOGIE HOWSER, M.D., PARENTHOOD and GREAT SCOTT! She recently directed the award-winning short film THE TUB, starring Melora Hardin and Spencer Garrett. Karrell was a recipient of a Fulbright Fellowship to research a project on master music teacher Nadia Bollinger in Paris.  She has been awarded the prestigious John Wells Directing Fellowshipand the ABC/DGA Television Directing Fellowship. She studied Modern Dance and Choreography at Harvard University and with Martha Graham in NYC, where she also performed at the Brooklyn Academy of Music for avant-garde artist Robert Wilson.

 

ANTONIO LOPEZ, Choreographer

Antonio Lopez began studying ballet at the age of fifteen in his native Albuquerque, New Mexico. After less than a year, he was offered a scholarship to attend the San Francisco Ballet School.  Lopez won an Emmy for his performance in the television special Dance in America – A Song For Dead Warriors. As a principal dancer he danced lead roles in most of the Lew Christensen repertoire including The Nutcracker, Beauty and The Beast, Cinderella, Airs de Ballet and Don Juan.  Other lead roles in Lopez’s repertoire include In The Night by Jerome Robbins, Forgotten Land by Jirii Kylian, Arthur Mitchell’s Manifestations, and John Clifford’s Bolero and Spartacus.  He also created lead roles in many of the works by Michael Smuin. Lopez has choreographed many ballets including Firebird for the New Mexico Ballet and North Coast Ballet, Huapango Clasico for the National Ballet de Mexico, Dancing Between Time for San Antonio Ballet, Haunting Heads for Pasadena Dance Theatre, Love in Blind  for University of New Mexico, and Rhapsody Blue for Loyola Marymount University.  He also choreographed Party Like for the Discovery Channel, the film Orange County, and trained Neve Campbell for the film The Company.

 

ANYA VERONIQUE FITZPATRICK, Lead Actress (Lilly)

Anya is a seventeen year old California native who trained in Los Angeles at the Yuri Grigoriev School of Ballet and Marat Daukayev Ballet Theater;  from 2013 to 2015 she trained at the Harid Conservatory in Florida on a pre-professional dance scholarship. She has just come back from two summer workshops in Europe, at the Royal Danish Ballet and at the Académie Princesse Grace in Monte-Carlo. She competed at YAGP, Spotlight and Dance Masters of America. She performed in ABT's Le Corsaire, Joffrey Ballet's Cinderella and The Nutcracker. She's currently training at the Burbank Academy of Ballet and pursuing an acting career. Lilly is the first movie role she's working on and the third ballet choreography she generates.

 

LILIANA ISELLA, Creator and Writer

Liliana Isella is a former artistic gymnast from the Italian Societa` Varesina Ginnastica e Scherma where she trained until age sixteen. While studying Philosophy and English Literature at the University of Milan, she became part of the theatrical company TeatrObliquo where she played mostly characters from Tennessee Williams’ plays. In Milan she worked also in fashion, commercials and music videos. In 2006 she moved to Los Angeles and discovered Russian Vaganova Ballet through former Bolshoi dancer Edouard Kouzmitch, with whom she has been studying ever since. Since 2012 she teaches ballet at Born To Play in Santa Monica. She writes poems and short fiction for her blog, LilaMagazine. She recently co-wrote Coffee & Couture, a Mini TV-Series about modeling.

 

IRIS SVIS, Producer

Iris Svis is a Russian-born actress based in Los Angeles. Originally from Tomsk, one of the oldest cities in Siberia, she moved to Moscow when she was three; shortly after, her parents introduced her to ballet and piano. At age fourteen, Iris began modeling. Her career took her to Beijing, Hong Kong, Shanghai and New York. At eighteen, she started studying Linguistics at Ulyanovsk State University. Following her graduation, she returned to modeling and eventually made of Los Angeles her new home. She’s currently studying acting, and is a member of the Jocelyn Jones Acting Studio. She recently created and produced Coffee & Couture, a Mini TV-Series about modeling. 

 

 

GOALS

  1. Create a beautiful short ballet movie and share it with you.
  2. Send Lilly & James to film festivals.
  3. Sell Lilly & James to a network.
  4. Create opportunities for the Creative Team to work together on two other movie projects:  a full length Ballet Dramedy and a Thriller. 
BUDGET PLAN 
 

 EXTRAS & CROWD  $200  

PRODUCTION STAFF  $2,600

ART DIRECTION  $600  

SET DRESSING  $1,200

WARDROBE  $870  

MAKE UP & HAIR  $850  

GRIP EQUIPMENT  $1,600

CAMERA PACKAGE  $3,000

PRODUCTION SOUND  $940  

TRANSPORTATION  $1,060

LOCATIONS  $4,000

DIGITAL  $400  

VFX  $600  

(TOTAL PRODUCTION  $17,920)

EDITORIAL  $1,200

MUSIC   $200  

POST PRODUCTION SOUND MIX  $300  

POST FILM & FINISHING   $460

TITLES & LICENSE  $200  

TOTAL POST PRODUCTION  $2,360

CATERING  $2,000

TOTAL OTHERS  $2,000

INSURANCE  $2,500

CONTINGENCY 10%  $2,758  

GRAND TOTAL  $30,338    
 
Thank you for your business.

 

It’s a pleasure to work with you on our project.

Sincerely Yours,

'Lilly & James' Creative Team

story:
Entertainment technology, i.e. cell phone companies, computer companies, social media sites, etc., is over a Trillion-Dollar industry and that number keeps rising. Technology has become the norm in today’s society. Over 90% of adults own cell phones, and children are getting started on the trend earlier and earlier, but what effect does technology have on us?

This documentary is a social experiment on society’s addiction to technology. This informative feature will follow subjects from different age groups. The age groups will range from 13-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49 and 50-59. There will be two subjects from each age group one male and one female. The documentary plans to answer the question “Are we addicted to technology?” by taking their portable devices away for one week; cell phones, laptops and tablets will be forbidden, home electronics will however, be permitted. A camera crew will follow the subjects for the week to document their reactions.

The other questions this documentary wants to answer are: Is this actually an addiction (relative to other known addictions like drugs or alcohol)? Of course less dangerous, but are the symptoms the same? Do they need a technology fix? Will the subjects experience any symptoms of withdrawal? It would be highly improbably that any of the subjects would experience symptoms like body shakes or vomiting, however, will they experience the irritability, depression or anxiety? This film would also like to delve into how our brains have evolved with technology. Have we gotten faster and more intelligent, or do we rely too much on our devices to do the work for us? Lastly, what does the future hold for already tech savvy society?

This documentary will also show the differences among the age groups when it comes to technology and the reactions to dealing without it. Along with the ten subjects that will documented, there will hopefully also be interviews with a professional psychiatrist, a behavioral scientist, a high school principal, business productivity specialist, and a technology professional.

  The money we are asking to raise will help to fund the equipment we need to rent. We need a camera, sound equipment, and minimal lighting for interviews. It will pay for travel, lodging, and meals for the crew for the approximate 12 weeks of filming. It will go towards post-production and distribution, along with insurance and other must have legal fees for a movie to take place. The more money that is donated the more crew members we can hire, we can afford to get more perspective from different professionals, and we can make a more elaborate movie.

Thank you for your support,

The #Addicted Crew

story:
Beyond a metal grille

Inside a cloistered monastery

Nuns follow an 800-year-old religious rule.


In this film, the nuns hold the video camera

Documenting their lives

Allowing you a glimpse of monastic life.



Set within the insular realm of the Corpus Christi Monastery, Chosen (Custody of the Eyes) is a feature-length film-in-progress. Chosen will form a portrait of a young woman joining the 800-year-old Poor Clare Colettine order. “Heather”/”Sister Amata” inhabits a threshold – a space between worlds. Heather made the exodus from the Chicago suburbs. Sister Amata is in the process of becoming, evolving into a new identity. 

This film is unique: It features life within one of the strictest religious orders, and it was filmed by the cloistered nuns. 

Cloistered contemplative nuns remove themselves from the world in order to mediate on behalf of the rest of humanity. The nuns believe that their prayers, penances, and sacrifices can change the course of history. 

Abbie Reese was allowed by the nuns to film within the enclosure, but she wanted to see from the nuns' perspective, from their own vantage. This film follows publication last year of Abbie's book, Dedicated to God: An Oral History of Cloistered Nuns, by Oxford University Press.

Chosen will offer a glimpse of monastic life as well as the internal journey, through video diaries, of a young woman becoming a cloistered nun. Abbie met Heather in 2005. The college student was discerning if she had been called to religious life. Over the next six years, Abbie and Heather met for oral history interviews about the discernment process. 

In 2011, Heather joined the Corpus Christi Monastery in Rockford. A year later, she became "Sister Amata." (Both names are aliases she selected to reflect the Poor Clare Colettine value of anonymity.)

Because of Sister Amata's proficiency as a visual artist and Abbie's philosophy of co-authorship and shared authority, Abbie sought and obtained permission to lend her a video camera. Sister Amata filmed video diaries, sharing her experiences and motivations. Other nuns became interested in documenting monastic life, so Abbie lent a second camera.

All of the footage is recorded. The video is sincere, playful, and self-reflexive; it reveals a glimpse into this radical life of those who have set apart – chosen.

Editing is underway.

The soundtrack

Original songs, written and performed by the nuns in Rockford, have just been recorded digitally to be included in the soundtrack for Chosen. (The nuns first shared their work by tape cassette, seen below.)

* The asterisk next to some of the perks (at right) denotes titles of "practices of virtues" penned by Mother Mary Veronica, founder of two communities of Poor Clare Colettine nuns (in Cleveland, Ohio and Chicago). The “Poor Soul Cards" were published in 1908 and are still observed by the nuns in Rockford today.

story:
This Matters!

Rarely do you find young  people who will do whatever it takes to go after what they feel in their heart. We have 30 students who need to get to camp.  Camp Vineyard is a week where students  get inspired and equipped for their what they feel called do in their life. These students are coming from all different backgrounds. Most of them are fighting family, emotional, academic and economic hardship. 

Donating whatever you can for the best week of a students' life will change their world forever.

 What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 to help some students get to camp. 

Student will be going on a 5 day camp in Temple, Georgia.

There will be games, learning , relationship building and life changing moments that are immeasurable. 

Your donation goes directly to a kids' balance for camp. 

IF YOU WANT TO DONATE TO A SPECIFIC KID YOU KNOW PLEASE PUT THAT IN THE COMMENT SECTION OF THE FISRT NAME AND LAST NAME OF THE KIDS YOU WANT TO GIVE TO. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1.Share this page on your wall on Facebook.  

2.Hope and keep our students in your thoughts and prayers

story:
I Found You is an endearing animated short, created using traditional animation (in which every frame is hand-drawn). It tells a story of a small fox, living in a deserted forest all by himself. His greatest dream is to find a special someone, who could become his friend.

Our goal is to make the two first minutes of what is planned to be a seven minutes-long animation happen.


I’d like you to take a second to recall all these old animated movies you’ve seen as a child. Their beauty and that certain charm, and the magic that remains in your heart for a long time. Traditional animation is a dying art, shrouded in the aura of beauty that can be found in today’s productions very seldom.

We’re all set to begin animating, the only thing we need now are funds. Animation has always been all about teamwork. Please help us gather the sum necessary to reward the other artists’ hard work - together we can make I Found You a truly magical piece. Every big journey starts with a first step. This is where ours begins.




Life is so much more beautiful when one can live it with their loved ones. But what about those who were never shown any affection? Can friendship still be born without knowing any real love?


There are two things that constantly fill our little fox’s burrow - his treasures and his loneliness. In the vast, deserted forest there are little to no creatures willing to play with this tiny potential predator. Which is why, while chasing a butterfly, he decides to venture deeper into the woods, onto the paths he had never walked before. What awaits him is… another fox!



The main theme of I Found You is loneliness and coping with it, and how sometimes what we’re looking for is closer than we think. I wanted to create a story that’s both bright and real, with the characters that anyone can identify with. The fox is lively, creative, and curious of the world the way small children are. With all of his ups and downs, this story will make you cry both out of laughter and sadness.



My first animation from 2013 

MY WEBSITE


Nirali helps "I Found You" in: storyboard, animatic and animation

Animation Demo Reel

NIRALI'S WEBSITE

As I said, animation is all about team play. I can and am going to do everything I can with my own strength, but without any help delivering the animation may take years. Even now instead of working on the project I am working on saving up to pay for it. Our beautiful animatic, which is the base or a “rough sketch” of animation was done entirely on my own cost, as grants are rarely given to 2D animation projects in Poland. The beautiful art that traditional animation is has been left to die, together with all the artists who still want to create it. Without the funds I am in no way able to produce it - which is what brings me here.



Without the funds I can't gather a team in which every artist would be responsible for what's their forte (or what they feel suits them best for that matter) in order to create something absolutely brilliant together!

This is how, in a simplified version, the classic animation process looks like:


  • So what exactly is your goal?

Creating fully rendered 2 minutes of animation, out of planned 7.

  • Okay, but why only 2 minutes and not all of it?

There are a few reasons for that:

First of all, the cost is quite BIG, so I decided it would be more sensible to divide the fundraising process into 3 parts :) It's also beneficial to our lovely funders who may see our progress with every campaign.

Secondly, holding 2 minutes of fully done animation in my hand is of a great asset when searching for sponsors who would like to help me fund the rest of the project.

  • Why won't you just do everything yourself instead of getting others involved?

Because I have already made a 6 minutes long animation all by myself (including the background ie a wooden model). It took me over 3 years, but I did it. I proved to myself that it is very much doable, so now when I'm asking you for help I can guarantee that the project will come to frutition, because I am, after all, an experienced animator. But now I want to create something much bigger! Animation isn't a team work for no reason - have you ever wondered why animated features, games and movies are so well-done? Because they're a work of many people, cooperating and taking care of what each of them is best at. I might be a graphic designer and do some programming but what does it matter? The outcome will be mediocre at best and it will still take a lot of time. This time I want to make it all really high-quality.

  • Why won't you reach out to various institutions to get help?

You have no idea how long I've spent doing just that. The entirety of 2014 was just me knocking to every door available and writing hundreds of requests and applications. But there are close to no supporters of traditional animation in my country, and there are no projects or grants for young artists. Well, there are a few, but it will take a long time for me to gather enough money to qualify for their programs.

  • Are you aware of how much money that is?

All too well. What I'm asking for is support, not financing the entire project, as I pay on my own for what I can. Thanks to your support the production would start anytime now, and not next year (which is an optimistic prediction).

  • Alright, you'll make the animation and what then?

Firstly, the animation will travel across the world to various animation festivals, so that you and your family/friends can see it for yourself on the silver screen in your homeland. Plus I'd like it to be aired on TV, as having a sample of it I'll be able to try to make it a series or a feature film.



If you contribute, what will your money be used for?

  • My aim is to create the first two minutes of the animation - which is why I need to gather $4500 to be able to shrink the amount of work per person by engaging other artists.

  • Most of it I’m planning to do myself, but I would like to enlist the help of other artists. A half of our current goal will be animated by me, while the other half be a work of an amazingly talented artists whom I've had the pleasure of working with. The other artists' work is estimated to cost about $3000-$3500 per 1 minute. For this part I hope to spend $2000 from the funds gathered via crowdfunding, and $1000-$1500 would come from my own savings.

  • Similarly, the first minute have about 40 backgrounds. I want them to be just as breathtaking as the animation itself, abundant in details and colours, absolutely perfect. 20 of them I am able to draw alone, and the remaining ones will be a collaboration with various artists from all over the world (the people we need are the ones with similar a art style to mine, to keep the continuity). The cost of their commissions is estimated to be about $4000 ($200 per background) - just like with the animation, about $2000 would come from crowdfunding, and the rest is on me.

  • The $500 that remains will be used for perks. Should there be any additional funds left or if the project gets more than its initial goal, all will be evenly divided between the animation and backgrounds, with the next few minutes in sight.


What you get - PERKS


$5 - A Thank-You-Note



$10 - More Thank-You-Notes (this time on our website and social media sites)



$15 - Sneak Peeks! Lots of Them.



$20 - A Note You Get To Receive From Your Postman's Hands



$25 - Tiny Stickers!


$40 - One Pretty Poster


$50 - A Background Print



$75 - A Custom-made Wallpaper For Your Computer



$100 - Hand-drawn Fox



$150 - A Booklet With "I Found You" Sketches



$200 - A Foxy T-Shirt



$500 - Your Name Appears In The Credits



$750 - You Get To See The Thing Before Anyone Else



$1000 - You Get A Box Of Wonders


******
Can't contribute but still want to help? Worry not - sharing our campaign info and keeping a tab on our updates is plenty. Tell your friends, family, a friendly neighbour, your dog, tell everyone. We appreciate any and every kind of help. Thanks.

story:
The Right to Kill

  The Right to Kill follows the lives of six boys growing up on the north side of Syracuse, NY during the 1960s. They make a commitment one Saturday morning while watching Zorro, that like Zorro, they too will join together to protect their little patch of turf that surrounds Schiller Park. They proceed to, as they call it, "clean up the neighborhood." Their escapades begin with the calculated killing and intricate dissection of the lovelorn alley cats crying in the night, and the dismantling of the hippie community's annoying wind chimes incessantly ringing as the summer winds blow. While doing their best to take care of business and keep the backstreets clear of the unwanted, they soon find themselves in the clutches of a local serial killer.

   As they mature into young men, and as a sure way to make money, they find themselves doing odd jobs for the local mafia. Their role playing and self-taught discipline allows them to commit to a few more untraceable executions along the way…of course, it's all for the betterment of the community.

   Wanting to stay true to their original cause of cleaning up the neighborhood, they set their sights not on governing the world, but managing the world's governing bodies. In the 1980's the United Sates' Republican Guard (the former GOP) decides to close the country's borders and immediately implement, The Great Rebuild/Everything American. Welfare is discontinued. Everyone has to work. No one is allowed in or out of America. All of the food and everything we Americans crave as a country is produced within our borders by Americans for Americans. No imports and no exports. The corrupt prison system is destroyed and so are the criminals housed inside. The majority of the world is astonished and in disbelief. Texas then implements The Right to Kill Act. Thanks to our main character, you can now petition for the legal right to kill someone. This changes everything.

   In closing, this is an exciting adventure that begins innocently enough, but as is my forte, one never knows what to expect on the following page.

My Request...

   I'm looking for $2,000 to support the printing of two-hundred 6" x 9" soft-cover copies of The Right to Kill. This will include a full color, professionally designed cover (not the cover you see in this post - although I am getting used to it and might use it). An ISBN or ID number specifically for the hard copy book and a separate ISBN number for ebook sales.

Publishing History...

   This will be my fourth book. My first, El Paso: 1850-1950, was published by Arcadia Publishing. It is a pictorial history of the growth that took place in El Paso, TX in its developmental years. My second, My Life Before I Decided To Commit Suicide, is published by BLBM Publishing. My Life is an embellished memoir that twists and turns through life's trials and tribulations while growing up in Central NY. It's comprised of many humorous stories that lead to a rather sudden and tragic ending. My third book, Legendary El Pasoans: Past, Present and Future, also through BLBM Publishing should be available by the end of this campaign. It too is a pictorial history of well-known and little-known citizens who have had, and many who still are still having, an impact on El Paso's history. For instance, F. Murray Abraham, Gene Roddenberry, Debbie Reynolds, "Granny" from the Beverly Hillbillies, were all born or raised in El Paso. Who knew?
A bit about me...
   I have received a few awards over the years for several different projects. I am the founding member of some really worthy cultural organizations in New York and in El Paso, and I serve or have served on a few, select nonprofit boards.
  • 2015, President/Festival Director, El Paso Music Society, Inc.
  • 2013-2014, President/Festival Director, New York State Blues Festival
  • 2014, 1st Place, Worthy of Being Called Excellent, from the Book Publishers of El Paso for my embellished memoir, My Life Before I Decided To Commit Suicide, BLBM Publishing
  • 2014, 1st Place, Most Promising, from the Book Publishers of El Paso for, El Paso: 1850 -1950, Arcadia Publishing - Images of America
  • 2013, SAMMY (Syracuse Area Music Award), Best Blues CD, A History of Blues
  • 2010, Co-edited El Hilo de la Memoria, Fresco Fine Arts Publications
  • 2009, Released, El Paso: 1850 -1950, Arcadia Publishing - Images of America
  • 2009, Founding member, El Paso Blues Society
  • 2009-2010, President, Los Paisanos de El Chamizal
  • 2004, Selfless Service to Music and the Arts, NYS Blues Festival
  • 2003, Keeping the Blues Alive – Best Promoter/Festival, the Blues Foundation, Memphis, TN 
  • 2001, 1999, 1997, People’s Choice Award, Best Festival, Syracuse New Times
  • 1998-2003, Founding member/Festival Director, Guinness Irish Festival, Syracuse, NY
  • 1996, SAMMY – Syracuse Area Music Award for Best Concert Event or Series, NYS Blues Festival
  • 1995, Service to the Arts, Cultural Resources Council of Syracuse and Onondaga County
  • 1992-2003, Principal founding member/Festival Director, New York State Blues Festival, Syracuse, NY

2009, Released, El Paso: 1850 -1950, Arcadia Publishing - Images of America
2009, Founding member, El Paso Blues Society
2009-2010, President, Los Paisanos de El Chamizal
2004, Selfless Service to Music and the Arts, NYS Blues Festival
2003, Keeping the Blues Alive – Best Promoter/Festival, the Blues Foundation, Memphis, TN 
2001, 1999, 1997, People’s Choice Award, Best Festival, Syracuse New Times
1998-2003, Founding member/Festival Director, Guinness Irish Festival, Syracuse, NY
1996, SAMMY – Syracuse Area Music Award for Best Concert Event or Series, NYS Blues Festival
1995, Service to the Arts, Cultural Resources Council of Syracuse and Onondaga County
1992-2003, Principal founding member/Festival Director, New York State Blues Festival, Syracuse, NY

story:
Short Summary

My Name is Anthony Rodriguez, & I am a Independent Filmmaker. I travel the world with a Botanist/Food Plant Expert  known as the Botanical Explorer Joseph Simcox. We are on a mission to educate the world about the true diversity of the Food Plant world. From the Jungles of The Amazon to the mountains of Papua New Guinea, we look for & document amazing & obscure fruits & vegetables.

What We Need & What You Get

At the moment all the funds for travels are coming straight from out of pocket & I am in need of a new video camera that can produce great quality film as well as endure the rough terrain that we venture into. In turn I am able to produce high Quality & informative documentaries about out changing planet & its food plant Diversity.

The Impact

There are a number of reasons I’m Running a fundraiser, besides be not having the funds for a new camera. One of the reasons is to make High Quality films, but not just any films. These films will be on Food Plant Diversity & there relationship with Humans and how we can utilize them, an example is we should not be growing non-desert plants in the Deserts. But!, there are plants adapted for those conditions. With these films I hope will inspire Humanity to move forward in a directions of Healing the Planet.

Risks & Challenges

The Risk & Challenges to get the quality footage to inspire people will be a tough task. But thanks to the knowledge & experience of Joe Simcox we are able to explore & overcome all obstacles that may hinder our mission.

story:
Thank you all for donating! You have restored faith in me that WE can make a difference in the Mental Health realm! With 56% raised, we can shoot almost 3 more scenes, so I am very grateful for that! Look out for your rewards in the next couple of months.

Sincerely, Scarlet & The Bipolar & Cheese Cast & Crew!


BIPOLAR & CHEESE 

provides a quirky look into the initial diagnosis triggered by love & cheese.


BIPOLAR & CHEESE

based on a true story, is a short film about a Therapist that discovers she has Bipolar Disorder after she publicly has a breakdown over a new co-worker whom she bonds with over

cheese.

2015 QUARTER-FINALIST IN "SCREENCRAFT"

SHORT FILM SCRIPT

Raves:

“Bipolar & Cheese is a fun and quirky offbeat comedy, tonally reminiscent of the humor found in 30 Rock and Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt. The writer has a unique and original voice, a strong command of the screenplay format, and has a well-structured story with a very clear beginning, middle, and end. And the final reveal … was especially fun.”

“Perhaps most impressive was the fact that the author didn’t have to resort to “bathroom” humor in order to be funny. It’s nice to see someone who can generate laughs in a script through the use of situational, character-driven humor.”


2010 QUARTER-FINALIST in “FRESH VOICES”

Screenplay Competition

Raves:

“This script is about a woman with bipolar disorder and brings a lot of much-needed attention to the underrepresented population of people with mood disorders.  She is presented in a very real and honest way, she is not the caricature “crazy person” we so often see in films.  I think this film promotes inclusion and understanding of people with conditions like these who are so often alienated in society.”

“Bipolar & Cheese” highlights the issues of how society treats people with severe mood disorders (and mental illness in general).  “This writer does a great job of getting us to empathize with the character.  I think this film could help to make a positive difference in the way that the mentally ill are perceived and treated.”


***The first $250 funder gets TWO tickets to a Live Taping of THE BIG BANG THEORY in LA!***

 


Do you know anyone with Bipolar Disorder?  Do you like Cheese?

Bipolar & Cheese is a short film that touches on both.  It’s centered around romance and cheese ... and for some people, their romance with cheese.

The Film

Bipolar & Cheese is a realistic journey of a person afflicted with mental illness, a topic that is rarely touched upon in American mainstream cinema.  This story will affect many people with and without Bipolar Disorder.

Scarlet Perez's‪ first feature screenplay “BIPOLAR & CHEESE” has gained an exciting buzz, good reviews, and nominations from screenplay competitions. Bipolar & Cheese was a quarter finalist in the Screenplay Competition "Fresh Voices" & in the Short Film Competition, "ScreenCraft"  as well as an award nominee for "Diversity & Inclusion." This award promotes diversity and inclusion on screen. We spotlight screenplays where the main character or a majority of characters are under represented in cinema.

  

Writer/Director - Scarlet Perez

Writer/Director, Scarlet Perez, Co-Directed and Edited two award winning Public Service Announcements dealing with the issue of Oral Sex amongst teenagers "Sex in the High School" and "Gender Bender." Both KAISER SAFE SEX PSA spots won GOLD CREATIVITY BDA awards at PROMAX in 2004. ‪Scarlet works at BRAVO ON-AIR PROMOTIONS as a Writer/Producer/Editor, creating Promos and Trailers for shows such as “The Real Housewives" and “Top Chef” franchises. Prior to Bravo Scarlet has worked for FX On-Air Promos, NBC, Warner Bros. Promotions, Lifetime On-Air Promos, VH1 Productions, Hells Kitchen Nickelodeon On-Air Promos, The Sci-Fi Channel, Spike TV, Liquid Theory, Dakota Pictures, American Apparel, Match Frame, Belief, Hotel Fountain, Pyro-Creative, Stun Creative and Playground. From 2000-2006, Scarlet worked full-time as an in-house Producer/Editor for MTV ON-AIR PROMOTIONS in New York City.  Her clients include MTV, MTV2, MTVU, MTV Español, mtv.com, MTV Home Entertainment, MTV Networks International, Simon & Schuster, VHUno, Logo, The Kaiser foundation, MTV Films, Paramount Pictures, VH1 Productions, Nickelodeon, and Spike TV.  One of her groundbreaking and noteworthy spots was MTV2's highly sought-after Integrated Marketing campaign with SPRITE. Originally from Miami, Florida, Scarlet attended film school at the UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI, graduating with a Bachelor of Science degree in Video-Film.  After graduation, she spent the next year hosting and editing approximately 100 episodes of Kenneth's Freakquency, a late-night alternative talk show which aired nightly on USA Broadcasting's WAMI in Miami.

Meet The Cast!


VIVIAN BANG as "VIOLET"

Vivian's TV credits include: NBC’s – AtoZ, MTV’s- Status Updates, ABC’s-  Better of Ted, Numb3rs, House M.D., Kath & Kim, How I Met Your Mother, Monk, Sex & The City, The Corner, Becker.

Theater credits include: World Premiere of Velina Hasu Houston’s Calling Aphrodite, the Premiere of Michael Golomco’s Please Stand By, Off-Broadway & Big Art Group’s Shelf-Life, Flicker, and the Obie-nominated Benton Kozo. She is a transplant from New York, and a graduate of NYU – Tisch.

Fun fact- She auditioned for NYU playing the dramatic role of Blanche Du Bois from Streetcar Named Desire with a full southern dialect. She had the teenager naivete that she could be anyone and act any age. She was awarded a scholarship admission.

ALASTAIR JAMES MURDEN as “BRAD”

Originally from England, where he earned his Master's degree in Acting and Musical Theatre, Alastair can now be seen performing regularly in Southern California.

Alastair has been a member of the Improv troupe "Improv Shmimprov" since 2009, performing all across the globe, and has trained with the world famous; Upright Citizens Brigade. He also hosts the popular YouTube Channel "The Super Amazing Project", currently averaging 500,000 subscribers.

Alastair is a professional actor, comedian and singer/musician based in Southern California. He trained at the Central School of Speech and Drama in London, and has worked extensively on screen, stage, and in voice over. 

LOUIS B. JACK as “DOCTOR SMITH”

Louis has appeared in numerous independent films, including:

"Not 4 Sale," the Sidney Poitier biopic starring Isaiah Washington.  Jack co-starred on Nickelodeon’s Sam and Cat and has trained with Patrick Bristow at LA’s Improvatorium.  An actor with deep roots in live theatre, Jack will soon be appearing as the Major General in the Pirates of Penzance at Shakespeare Orange County in September 2015. 

Jack lives in the OC and is familiar to Orange County audiences for such roles as Dogberry in Much Ado, Proprietor in Assassins, Senex in A Funny Thing Happened, Hucklebee in The Fantasticks, Mr. Maraczek in She Loves Me, Herr Schultz in Cabaret, Dr. Scott in Rocky Horror and Rev. Crisparkle in the Mystery of Edwin Drood.

The Film's Mission:

To stop the stigma of Mental Illness, as well as educate people who do not necessarily understand Bipolar Disorder,
a sensitive topic that is misunderstood in the media.

What is Bipolar Disorder?

Bipolar disorder, formerly known as manic-depressive illness, is a brain disorder that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels, and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks.  Symptoms of Bipolar Disorder are severe.  They are different from the normal ups and downs that everyone goes through from time to time. People with Bipolar Disorder experience unusually intense emotional states that occur in distinct periods called "mood episodes." An overly joyful or overexcited state is called a Manic episode, and an extremely sad or hopeless state is called a Depressive episode.  Its symptoms can result in damaged relationships, poor job or school performance, and even suicide.  Bipolar Disorder is a life-long illness with no cure, but it can be treated, and people with this illness can lead full and productive lives.  Approximately 10 million people worldwide are diagnosed with Bipolar Disorder. 

Where Funds will be allocated:

You can also help by following us on Facebook / Twitter / Instagram - emailing friends & posting to social media.  Every bit of promotion goes a long way. 
Thank you for your support!

SOCIAL MEDIA LINKS:

FACEBOOK - http://www.facebook.com/Crazytown.tv
TWITTER - http://twitter.com/Bipolar_nCheese
INSTAGRAM - http://www.instagram.com/BipolarAndCheese
WEBSITE - www.bipolarandcheese.com

story:
The world needs more of this...

Happiness. Joy. Friendliness. Peace. Love. Acceptance.
This is a documentary about the people who have dedicated their lives to making our world a better place; The Greeters of Laguna Beach!

The Greeter Trailer


For anyone who has encountered one of the Greeters; it is something they will never forget! With your help, we can spread the Greeter's message of peace, love, joy and acceptance to people around the world! 

You can help us start a Greeting evolution; we can embrace each other's differences and celebrate our individual uniqueness! Just like the Greeter!

The Greeters have touched millions of lives and inspired thousands of people over the past 125 years. With your help, this movie will reach thousands more!

The Greeters of Laguna Beach over the past 125 years

1890-1908    Old Joe Lucas 

1939-1975    Eiler Larsen

1981-2009    No 1. Unnamed Archer 

2011- Present    Michael Minutoli


The Greeter Production Team

Executive Producers Martin & Tabatha Yewchuk                                                               with Current Greeter, Michael Minutoli
We wanted to make a movie about how special and unique it is to have someone in your community dedicating their life to make everyone's day brighter. What ended up being captured in the movie was so much more...
We found that they changed people's live's, one interaction at a time. They each had their own unique style of greeting...but they all had the same goal; to make the world a better place. We also found that even in the face of opposition and ridicule, The Greeters persevered out of their love for humanity and their commitment to doing something meaningful to them.

This is the first documentary feature for our production company, Elestial Productions. We are interested in stories that raise our awareness and increase our connection to each other, our world and to the collective consciousness. The Greeters are an example of how one person can remind us that we are all connected and that we all have a role in creating the world we wish to live in.

You will help us achieve in this campaign what we cannot do by ourselves. We need your support to show how people some of us can affect all of us, just by being themselves.

We are excited to have as part of our team...

DAVID ARKENSTONE- Composer

Celebrating the 25th year of his impressive career that includes more than 40 albums, 20 Billboard hits, film & TV soundtracks and game scores, three-time GRAMMY®-nominee David Arkenstone has established himself as one of the best contemporary instrumental musicians and composers of our time.  This visionary continues to create distinctive tracks that inspire the imagination. A musical storyteller, David is passionate about taking his listeners on a journey, creating sonic tapestries that evoke every emotion. David Arkenstone.com

VICTORIA PAIGE MEYERINK- Production Consultant

Award-winning film producer and former child star Victoria Paige Meyerink has spent nearly all of her life in show business. She has the distinction of being the youngest woman film producer in the motion picture industry with the international success Young Warriors at age 22. Victoria is a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences and serves on the Executive Committee of the Student Academy Awards. Victoria on IMDB


Steven Vlasak- Production Consultant

A Los Angeles native, Steven Vlasak has devoted his career to creating, and helping others create, compelling and emotional stories for film, television and stage, working for Academy Award nominated and Emmy Award winning production companies both here and abroad. Steven on IMDB

THE GREETER Production Team from Left to right...
David Arkenstone (Composer), Tabatha Yewchuk (Executive Producer, Editor), Steven Vlasak (Production Consultant), Martin Yewchuk (Director, Executive Producer), Victoria Paige Meyerink (Production Consultant)

What We Need... 

The movie is almost complete; a year's worth of interviews, research and editing has resulted in a 66 minute feature length documentary. 

We can't wait to show it to you! We just need to fund our post production!

Here is where your money is going...The more we raise the more we can achieve!

We have chosen the flexible funding option so whatever goal we reach, the funds will be put to good use!

Up to $15,000         A great start!

  • Final Edit of the film.
  • Post Production; sound editing.
  • Compose Musical Score; by David Arkenstone.
  • Clearing of publishing rights for us.
  • Enter Film Festivals.
  • Promotional Materials; needed for festival screenings.
  • Online Marketing, social media campaigns; creating a BUZZ around the movie.
  • Cover Perks, taking care of the people taking care of us!

Up to $25,000          Moving right along!

  • Enter Foreign Festivals.
  • Language Subtitles.
  • Animation.
  • Manufacture DVDs.
  • Local Screening.

Our Goal...$55,000  Now we're talking!

  • Self-Distribution.
  • Cross-country screenings.
  • Travel to support the film at festivals, marketing opportunities.

Over $55,000            To infinity and beyond...

  • Speaking Engagements, spreading the message!
  • International Greeter Day! 

We could really make a huge worldwide impact with this level of funding! Wow!


What You Get...
We have some cool perks to help you choose which level of funding to go with!
The "You're Perfect" T-Shirt


The Impact Of Your Contribution

Good documentaries affect us on many levels, making us feel something deeply and contemplate our existence.  They stir our emotions and can teach us something about the world and about ourselves. 

The Greeter is an inspiring and life-affirming film that hopefully will make you  feel better about the world that we live in, giving you hope for a future we will all be excited to embrace. You will experience people who are making a difference and love humanity enough to devote their lives to it simply by following their passion.  This movie will put you in a fantastic mood and raise your vibrations, just as if you were visiting Laguna Beach on a beautiful day, walking past The Greeter as he waves to you.

You will realize what a blessing it is that we have people in our world that think of others and have a genuine need to connect. And, you will wonder, "Why don't people do this more often? Why don't we have a Greeter in our town?"

Help Us Make a Difference

Our goal is to have an impact around the world by sharing The Greeter's message. The challenge is to raise enough funds to create the impact we wish to achieve. 
This is a great story that deserves a wide audience. The impact of what the Greeters are about will be felt around the world, in your own community and across the Universe!

Other Ways You Can Help The Greeter!

If you can't contribute monetarily...

You can help us by getting the word out through our Facebook page The Greeter Documentary and on Twitter @The GreeterDoc

It is easy to share using the Indiegogo share tools! Just click and share with your friends and family!

Thanks for your support! 

The Elestial Production Team

martin@elestialproductions.com
