helping others create, compelling and emotional stories for film, television
and stage, working for Academy Award nominated and Emmy Award winning
production companies both here and abroad. Steven on IMDB



THE GREETER Production Team from Left to right...David Arkenstone (Composer), Tabatha Yewchuk (Executive Producer, Editor), Steven Vlasak (Production Consultant), Martin Yewchuk (Director, Executive Producer), Victoria Paige Meyerink (Production Consultant)

What We Need...  The movie is almost complete; a year's worth of interviews, research and editing has resulted in a 66 minute feature length documentary. 
We can't wait to show it to you! We just need to fund our post production!
Here is where your money is going...The more we raise the more we can achieve!
We have chosen the flexible funding option so whatever goal we reach, the funds will be put to good use!
Up to $15,000         A great start!




Final Edit of the film.


Post Production; sound editing.


Compose Musical Score; by David Arkenstone.


Clearing of publishing rights for us.


Enter Film Festivals.


Promotional Materials; needed for festival screenings.


Online Marketing, social media campaigns; creating a BUZZ around the movie.


Cover Perks, taking care of the people taking care of us!




Up to $25,000          Moving right along!




Enter Foreign Festivals.


Language Subtitles.


Animation.


Manufacture DVDs.


Local Screening.



Our Goal...$55,000  Now we're talking!





Self-Distribution.

Cross-country
screenings.

Travel to support the film at festivals, marketing opportunities.

Over $55,000            To infinity and beyond...





Speaking Engagements, spreading the message!


International Greeter Day! 



We could really make a huge worldwide impact with this level of funding! Wow!

What You Get...
We have some cool perks to help you choose which level of funding to go with!
The "You're Perfect" T-Shirt





   The Impact Of Your Contribution Good documentaries affect us on many levels, making us feel something deeply and contemplate our existence.  They stir our emotions and can teach us something about the world and about ourselves. 
The Greeter is an inspiring and life-affirming film that hopefully will make you  feel better about the world that we live in, giving you hope for a future we will all be excited to embrace. You will experience people who are making a difference and love humanity enough to devote their lives to it simply by following their passion.  This movie will put you in a fantastic mood and raise your vibrations, just as if you were visiting Laguna Beach on a beautiful day, walking past The Greeter as he waves to you.
You will realize what a blessing it is that we have people in our world that think of others and have a genuine need to connect. And, you will wonder, "Why don't people do this more often? Why don't we have a Greeter in our town?"
Help Us Make a Difference

 
Our goal is to have an impact around the world by sharing The Greeter's message. The challenge is to raise enough funds to create the impact we wish to achieve. 
This is a great story that deserves a wide audience. The impact of what the Greeters are about will be felt around the world, in your own community and across the Universe!   Other Ways You Can Help The Greeter! If you can't contribute monetarily...
You can help us by getting the word out through our Facebook page The Greeter Documentary and on Twitter @The GreeterDocIt is easy to share using the Indiegogo share tools! Just click and share with your friends and family!Thanks for your support! The Elestial Production Teammartin@elestialproductions.com

story:
The Project

MINDEPENDENCE is a cross-media project on media independence and freedom of expression in countries where these values are at stake. MINDEPENDENCE spans different countries and combines a variety of online and offline outputs.

Outputs

Documentary series

MINDEPENDENCE core output is the production of a documentary series available via the project’s website. Each documentary takes place in a priority country, featuring an independent media organization which is selected on the basis of its uncompromising, socially engaged line of action.

Our protagonists are the people behind each organization.We follow them in their everyday routine, we learn about their methods, challenges and risks, we observe their interactions with other people, we capture their moments of enthusiasm and frustration. Through them, and through additional input provided by key experts and other related informants, we intend to outline the wider sociopolitical situation in each country.

Website

MINDEPENDENCE website will serve as the project's online diary, documenting the research process and filming in each country.

In addition it stands as a dynamic pool for knowledge, publishing original and existing material on the state of media independence with a bigger aim to establish a participatory tool, stimulating the active engagement of its community.

Live Events

MINDEPENDENCE wants to support real-time interaction and reflection in each priority country. We aim to achieve this through the documentaries' screenings and the organisation of open discussions and key note lectures on media independence and freedom of expression.

The Cause

Media is constitutionally declared as the guarantor of pluralism and democracy. Yet, this is not always the case in many countries, even in those that pride themselves on being democracies and respecting the UN Plan of Action on the Safety of Journalists and Impunity (2012). While social media and citizen journalism gain significant ground over the last years, the space for independent media has been shrinking rapidly as a result of pressure from political and/or economic interests.

Past and recent events in different countries indicate that the “wrongdoings” go beyond mere misinformation or governmental regulation. In the name of a distorted interpretation of national security needs, we witness severe cases of civic rights infringements and abuse against journalists.

MINDEPENDENCE seeks to raise awareness and stimulate debate on such phenomena, supporting the idea that media independence and freedom of expression are integral ingredients for pluralistic, politically engaged and democratic societies.

Objectives and Impact

MINDEPENDENCE intends to showcase the sociopolitical specificities of media independence in priority countries by introducing daring media organizations and their efforts towards transparent, uncompromising, socially engaged journalism. Through MINDEPENDENCE, we aspire to achieve the following impact:

1.raise awareness on the methods, challenges and risks of practicing media independence.

2.facilitate cross-border exchange of practices and challenges between media organizations.

3.empower young journalists, IT specialists and other independent experts with the values of pro-transparency and anti-corruption journalism.

4.establish a transnational community of engaged people who will actively contribute to MINDEPENDENCE upcoming activities.

Director's Intention

Violations of media independence and freedom of expression proliferate alarmingly, even in countries that define themselves as democracies. Such cases reach our door on a daily basis. They worry and repel and shock us.

But, have we ever thought what it actually takes to remain loyal to the values of independent, uncompromising, socially engaged journalism against all odds? Have we wondered who are the people that find this courage? What fuels them? How does their working reality look like? How are their lives affected by this commitment?

Following an anthropocentric approach, MINDEPENDENCE aspires to bring these people in the foreground.

Documentary series: Development plan

MINDEPENDENCE is currently in its development phase, with the aim to deliver its first three documentary episodes by June 2016.

Based on the occurrence of civic rights violations, state control, censorship and abuse against journalists, these episodes will take place in three different regions, featuring three diverse countries: Hungary, Turkey and Egypt.

We plan to shoot our first episode in Budapest, Hungary in September 2015 presenting independent, investigatory media organization Direkt36. The episode will premiere in Berlin, Budapest and Athens in December 2015 and shortly afterwards will be released online via the project’s website.

The next two episodes, currently in their research phase, are planned for January 2016 (Turkey, Istanbul) and March 2016 (Cairo, Egypt), while their release is respectively expected around April and June 2016.

Episode 1: Hungary / Direkt36

Hungary has undergone a significant erosion of civil liberties, above all freedom of information, since Viktor Orbán was elected prime minister in 2010.

The Orbán government used its two-thirds majority in parliament to get a highly restrictive media law adopted in 2011. It introduced fines for the creators of content that is not “balanced” – a concept deliberately left vague – and established a dangerous media regulatory authority with statutory links to Fidesz, the conservative ruling party. This “Media Council” guaranteed just one thing – political interference in news and information content. The European Union subsequently managed to get the government to rescind some of its provisions but not the most draconian ones.

Source: Reporters without Borders

Direkt36 is a new investigative journalism center in Hungary with the mission to expose wrongdoings and abuse of power by producing stories based on tough questions and hard facts.

They provide the Hungarian and international audience with in-depth – often data-driven – accountability reporting that most of the Hungarian media outlets cannot afford. Direkt36 is not part of the competition of news organizations covering daily events, which allows them to use their resources to focus exclusively on conducting systematic investigations. With this unique approach, which proved to be successful in Western countries but has not taken roots in Hungary, they can highlight previously hidden problems of the society.

This is a very exciting work, a big challenge, but also indispensable for making Hungary a stronger and healthier democracy. Many stories have international implications and are published in English as well. Their ambition is to become an active contributor to the work of the growing network of investigative centers in the region and around the world.

Direkt36

András spent much of his 12-year-long journalism career at Origo, with some longer stints abroad. He worked for 15 months for the BBC World Service and did two journalism fellowships in the United States. In 2013 he spent 8 months with the investigative unit of The Washington Post where he learned data-mining and reporting methods from some of the world’s best journalists. He is the only journalist who was given two times the Soma Award, the prestigious annual award dedicated to investigative journalism in Hungary. He also received the Quality Journalism Award three times.

As Direkt36’s editor and reporter, his focus is corruption and public spending. He is especially interested in the links between politics and business, the activities of influential people in this often grey zone.

He spent the 12 years of his entire career at Origo, a major news portal in Hungary. He started as a reporter and rose to the position of editor-in-chief, while trying himself in nearly every field of journalism. He was in the thick of many breaking news situations, and experimented a lot with storytelling and technical innovations. He also worked on several award-winning articles as an editor, and gave the initial thrust to many of his colleagues who later became well-known journalists.

His goal at Direkt36 is to be able to work as a journalist without any compromise, to deliver unbiased stories to the audience and to remind the powerful that they are being watched.

Balázs was the founder and longest-serving editor-in-chief of Origo. He led the team that made Origo the largest news-portal in Hungary. He was also a personal guarantee for the famously high professional and ethical standards at the news-portal. Since leaving Origo in 2011 he has been teaching at various universities and training programs in Hungary and abroad. He is also the chairman of the Editor-in-chiefs’ Forum, an organization aiming to improve the ethical standards in journalism in Hungary.

His focus in Direkt36 is that of the supervising editor, who reads the articles through with a strictly critical eye, looking for missing links and holes in the stories, measures risks, be them legal or ethical, and always calls out for more proof desperately.

Next Episodes

While developing MINDEPENDENCE, we came up with a shortlist of 12 priority countries for the first round of our documentary series. This shortlist was formed on a representative basis, including 4 regions: Eastern Europe, The Balkans, North Africa and Middle East.

The number next to each country indicates their ranking by the Reporters Without Borders for their status of media freedom and freedom of information in 2014 (you can find a global overview of 2014 World Press Freedom Index here).

In this context, we would like to encourage you to reflect on the next documentaries. Please, send us an email with the indication “MINDEPENDENCE – My Priority Country”, stating which country you feel should be featured in the upcoming episodes. Let us also know about encouraging cases of independent media organizations. And if you feel you can contribute to the project in any active way, write us a few lines about yourself!

Risks and Challenges

MINDEPENDENCE highlights positive examples of media independence and the challenges they encounter while committed to their values. Nevertheless, our project team is well aware it’s entering a complicated, demanding and possibly risky field. The risk factor is not equally present in all countries, varying from a restrictive environment of managed news propaganda and censorship to severe cases of harassment, imprisonment or even assassination of journalists.

We will therefore exhaust all means available in order to eliminate risks for the people involved in this endeavor, both as crew or journalists/experts exposing their opinions in public. In this respect, we will take the following steps:

1.examine the situation of media independence in each country with the facilitation of experts, and ask for legal advice if required

2.identify and recruit local coordinators with a strong background on the matter, in order to guide us safely through the local framework.

3.maintain a transparent and direct attitude towards our informants, advising them of the project’s objectives and outputs.

4.respect and safeguard informants’ wish for anonymity when requested.

5.preview each episode with the team and core members of the respective media organization, to secure that the documentary does not jeopardize their public image.

6.hold internal screenings in affiliated contexts to receive feedback and suggestions from engaged communities.

Who is behind MINDEPENDENCE?

The Team

Martha Bouziouri is a social anthropologist and a cross-media director. She holds a BA in Mass Media and Communication, a Diploma in Theatre Acting and a MA in Cultural Management and Human Communication.

She is currently completing her PhD in Social Anthropology at Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences, in collaboration with the Department of Cultural Technology and Communication, Aegean University.

As the co-founder and director of plays2place productions, she is involved in a series of transnational projects concerning applied models for civic transformation, raising awareness and social integration across the Mediterranean.

Her work combines elements of action research and artistic intervention and focuses on civic and human rights, grassroots initiatives of social solidarity and the cultural expressivity of hybrid identities.

She is a member of Cultural Innovators Network and Tandem / Shaml - Cultural Managers Exchange Program.

Vasilis Chrysanthopoulos is co-founder and head producer of plays2place productions and a member of EAVE (European Audiovisual Entrepreneurs) and EDN (European Documentary Network). He also works as a TV producer for Associated Press Television Network. He started his career as a film and cross-media producer for various companies in the Greek media industry, until he co-founded plays2place productions, for which he has produced all its projects. His recent credits include the film''Miss Violence" (Silver Lion for Best Director and Coppa Volpi for Best Actor in Venice IFF 2013).

Consultants

Christopher Resch works as a freelance journalist for various German media, focusing on culture, arts and media in Egypt and the Middle East. Before starting his career in journalism he worked as press and public relations coordinator at the Goethe-Institut in Cairo. He has been trained as a journalist and studied journalism and Arabic studies in Leipzig and Istanbul.

Ivana Jeremic was born on January 9, 1990 in Belgrade. She works as an investigative reporter and fact-checker at Center for Investigative Reporting of Serbia (CINS) since 2012. For the last three years she has worked on investigative stories concerning public procurement, privatization of important companies in Serbia, narcotics kingpin Darko Saric’s associates and companies that have been confiscated from them, money laundering and private security. Besides that, she has been working as a fact-checker for CINS and Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. She took part in a research project “Free access to information: Theory and Practice” in cooperation with the Belgrade Centre for Security Policy, a first ever overall research on free access to information of public importance in Serbia. She was among 13 journalists from the Balkans, Germany and France involved in the Voice of the Balkans project concerning Balkan Media Freedom.

She is a last year student of journalism at the University of Belgrade. During her studies she took active note in students’ activism through various debate activities. She is also an active member of Open Communication),an NGO which main goal is to advance the culture of public dialogue and promote freedom of speech. She speaks Serbian, English and Spanish.

Nedim Hadrovic is from Sarajevo, where he also currently resides. He has spent the majority of his life living and studying abroad, in countries such as Egypt, Iran, Malaysia and Singapore. He has studied digital media and film in Malaysia and journalism in Germany, with his visual work having been shown at galleries and festivals in Malaysia, Singapore and New York City, and his written work published in Deutsche Welle, OpenDemocracy and Muftah. He is currently preparing his debut documentary on Syrian refugees in Istanbul and is working on launching a citizen journalism platform in Bosnia. 

Nedim is one of the coordinators of Middle East and North Africa Committee of the European Youth Press, a network of young media makers with 26 member organizations, gathering over 60,000 young journalists.

Basma El Mahdy is an Egyptian journalist. She covers the political transition in the Arab world, focusing on in these fields in Egypt: democracy, human rights and civil society. She has worked for prominent daily newspapers in Egypt as Al-Masy Al-Youm and Al-Youm Al-Sabaa. She is a member in European and African youth organizations: Middle East and North Africa Committee of the European Youth Press and African Youth Movement. She is also a certified trainer from Munich University on civic education and on journalism from Deutsche Welle. She is working currently working for meedan project in Cairo.

Lorenzo Marsili is founding director of European Alternatives. He is the initiator and current spokesperson of European Media Initiative for Media Pluralism, an international campaign demanding better protection for media pluralism and freedom at European level. A long-time student of China, he initiated a multi-year arts exchange programme between cultural innovators in China, Brazil and Europe, Transnational Dialogues. He has previously worked in setting up Transeuropa Festival and was founding editor of Naked Punch magazine. He has degrees in philosophy, sociology, and Chinese studies, and is an active commentator and public speaker. He tweets @l_marsili.

Partners

   plays2place productions

   235 Inc.


Supporters

The project "MINDEPENDENCE" is winner of the competition kultur-im-dialog.eu+ 2015 - a program of the Ernst Schering Foundation and MitOst. In the framework of a matching fund the Ernst Schering Foundation will double the collected amount of this crowdfunding campaign to a maximum of 3,000 Euro.

   Ernst Schering Foundation

   MitOst

   European Youth Press

    Voice of the Balkans

    EU Initiative for Media Pluralism 

     European Alternatives

     Cultural Innovators Network


Campaign Goals and Distribution of Funds

We launch this campaign in order to support our kick-off documentary in Hungary. We have already secured 2000 € from own contributions and another 3000€ in the format of a matching fund, as MINDEPENDENCE won the Matching Fund of the competition kultur-im-dialog.eu+ 2015, supported by MitOst e.V and Ernst Schering Foundation! This means that they have committed 3000 euros to the production of MINDEPENDENCE and will match every euro raised during this campaign, up to this amount.

Each episode costs 15000 €. The amount of 10000 € will cover core team’s travel and accommodation expenses, the salaries of the Hungarian crew and the post production. In the super great case we exceed the needed amount, we will use it for the pre-production of our next case: Turkey!!

MINDEPENDENCE is a dynamic project and its kick-off documentary is really crucial, as it defines its character, approach and objectives. Please, help us make a vigorous start and we promise to continue with the same passion and unlimited energy!

Why support MINDEPENDENCE?

Because:

Freedom of expression and information is a fundamental right but not a right everyone enjoys.

Strong, uncompromising voices of independent media should be identified and heard.

Cross-border exchange of challenges, risks and methods between media organizations should be facilitated.

We know that media freedom is suppressed but we don’t really know what it takes to claim it against all odds.

Support Statements

"MINDEPENDENCE comes at a time where the freedom of the media in Hungary, Turkey and Egypt, and not only there, is at stake. Raising awareness of the topic is vital, as is the cross-border exchange of practices and methods. The countries might be different, but freedom of the media is - well, should be - universal."

Christopher Resch, journalist, editor of The Freedom of the Media in Egypt.

“For many years, number of countries in the Western Balkans exhibited a worrying pattern of press freedom violations;and it’s only getting worse. Editorial pressure from political leaders and private owners lead to self-censorship, attacks on journalists that went unpunished were just some of the products of the rotten political systems. Mindependence reminds us that freedom of media is not the given right, but the one we should always fight for”.

Hanja Marovic, journalist, Voice of the Balkans project

"We live in a time when media companies and their journalists are quickly losing ground: they face growing pressure, enormous financial and legal struggles and they have to redefine their work and role in the society. While the space for independent media is shrinking, people easily forget that the free flow of information is vital for a democracy, just like the oxygen for the human body. Mindependence is here to remind us this fact and to shed light on a possible future of cross-border in-depth journalism."

Direkt36

"The topic of media freedom becomes more and more important every day, as we can see an increase in the intimidation of journalists and other measures that lead to limited press freedom and threaten journalists because of their work in Europe and elsewhere. A free press forms the core of a democratic society that respects human rights and everyone's right of access to information. With her groundbreaking project Martha Bouziouri and MINDEPENDENCE are continuing a discussion that we hope will never be silenced."

Anna Saraste, Member of Executive Board, European Youth Press

"The independence and freedom of the media is at the basis of a lively democracy and a just society. Grassroots and new organisations are an increasingly important aspect of any open media landscape. In times of retrenching rights and authoritarian tendencies in many parts of Europe, this is very an essential and timely project."

Lorenzo Marsili, director of European Alternatives, spokesperson of European Media Initiative for Media Pluralism

"MINDEPENDENCE gives us a vivid idea of the difficult conditions under which independent media organizations also in Europe fight for uncensored news coverage. The Ernst Schering Foundation supports the project, since freedom of the press is something that needs to be defended every day. It is the essential condition for enabling us to freely form an opinion. Please join us in supporting the project!"

Heike Catherina Mertens, Director of Ernst Schering Foundation


Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not everything! There are many ways to support MINDEPENDENCE and help us make it happen!

Advice us on journalists and media experts in your country. Let us know their work and the causes they support.

Bring us in touch with an organization in your country, interested to host a public event on MINDEPENDENCE project.

Link us with in kind facilities – accommodation or equipment providers.

Facilitate MINDEPENDENCE screening in your city – propose a cultural venue, a theatre, an open space.

Tag articles, reports or journalists fighting for media independence and freedom of expression with the hashtag #iMindMediaIndependence

Download the “I MIND MEDIA INDEPENDENCE” banner; then add it as your cover photo on facebook and become a supporter to a common cause.

Or just spread the word and let other people and like-minded networks know what we are up to!

Thank you for supporting us!

Who is behind MINDEPENDENCE?
The Team

Martha Bouziouri is a social anthropologist and a cross-media director. She holds a BA in Mass Media and Communication, a Diploma in Theatre Acting and a MA in Cultural Management and Human Communication. 
She is currently completing her PhD in Social Anthropology at Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences, in collaboration with the Department of Cultural Technology and Communication, Aegean University.
As the co-founder and director of plays2place productions, she is involved in a series of transnational projects concerning applied models for civic transformation, raising awareness and social integration across the Mediterranean.
Her work combines elements of action research and artistic intervention and focuses on civic and human rights, grassroots initiatives of social solidarity and the cultural expressivity of hybrid identities.
She is a member of Cultural Innovators Network and Tandem / Shaml - Cultural Managers Exchange Program.


Vasilis Chrysanthopoulos is co-founder and head producer of plays2place productions and a member of EAVE (European Audiovisual Entrepreneurs) and EDN (European Documentary Network). He also works as a TV producer for Associated Press Television Network.
He started his career as a film and cross-media producer for various companies in the Greek media industry, until he co-founded plays2place productions, for which he has produced all its projects. His recent credits include the film''Miss Violence" (Silver Lion for Best Director and Coppa Volpi for Best Actor in Venice IFF 2013).

Consultants

Christopher Resch works as a freelance journalist for various German media, focusing on culture, arts and media in Egypt and the Middle East. Before starting his career in journalism he worked as press and public relations coordinator at the Goethe-Institut in Cairo. He has been trained as a journalist and studied journalism and Arabic studies in Leipzig and Istanbul.

Ivana Jeremic was born on January 9, 1990 in Belgrade. She works as an investigative reporter and fact-checker at Center for Investigative Reporting of Serbia (CINS) since 2012. For the last three years she has worked on investigative stories concerning public procurement, privatization of important companies in Serbia, narcotics kingpin Darko Saric’s associates and companies that have been confiscated from them, money laundering and private security. Besides that, she has been working as a fact-checker for CINS and Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project. She took part in a research project “Free access to information: Theory and Practice” in cooperation with the Belgrade Centre for Security Policy, a first ever overall research on free access to information of public importance in Serbia. She was among 13 journalists from the Balkans, Germany and France involved in the Voice of the Balkans project concerning Balkan Media Freedom.
She is a last year student of journalism at the University of Belgrade. During her studies she took active note in students’ activism through various debate activities. She is also an active member of Open Communication),an NGO which main goal is to advance the culture of public dialogue and promote freedom of speech. She speaks Serbian, English and Spanish.

Nedim Hadrovic is from Sarajevo, where he also currently resides. He has spent the majority of his life living and studying abroad, in countries such as Egypt, Iran, Malaysia and Singapore. He has studied digital media and film in Malaysia and journalism in Germany, with his visual work having been shown at galleries and festivals in Malaysia, Singapore and New York City, and his written work published in Deutsche Welle, OpenDemocracy and Muftah. He is currently preparing his debut documentary on Syrian refugees in Istanbul and is working on launching a citizen journalism platform in Bosnia. 
Nedim is one of the coordinators of Middle East and North Africa Committee of the European Youth Press, a network of young media makers with 26 member organizations, gathering over 60,000 young journalists.

Basma El Mahdy is an Egyptian journalist. She covers the political transition in the Arab world, focusing on in these fields in Egypt: democracy, human rights and civil society. She has worked for prominent daily newspapers in Egypt as Al-Masy Al-Youm and Al-Youm Al-Sabaa. She is a member in European and African youth organizations: Middle East and North Africa Committee of the European Youth Press and African Youth Movement. She is also a certified trainer from Munich University on civic education and on journalism from Deutsche Welle. She is working currently working for meedan project in Cairo.

Lorenzo Marsili is founding director of European Alternatives. He is the initiator and current spokesperson of  European Media Initiative for Media Pluralism, an international campaign demanding better protection for media pluralism and freedom at European level. A long-time student of China, he initiated a multi-year arts exchange programme between cultural innovators in China, Brazil and Europe, Transnational Dialogues. He has previously worked in setting up Transeuropa Festival and was founding editor of Naked Punch magazine. He has degrees in philosophy, sociology, and Chinese studies, and is an active commentator and public speaker. He tweets @l_marsili.
Partners
   plays2place productions
   235 Inc.
Supporters
 The project "MINDEPENDENCE" is winner of the competition kultur-im-dialog.eu+ 2015 - a program of the Ernst Schering Foundation and MitOst. In the framework of a matching fund the Ernst Schering Foundation will double the collected amount of this crowdfunding campaign to a maximum of 3,000 Euro.
   Ernst Schering Foundation
   MitOst
   European Youth Press
    Voice of the Balkans
    EU Initiative for Media Pluralism 
     European Alternatives
     Cultural Innovators Network

Campaign Goals and Distribution of Funds
We launch this campaign in order to support our kick-off documentary in Hungary. We have already secured 2000 € from own contributions and another 3000€ in the format of a matching fund, as MINDEPENDENCE won the Matching Fund of the competition kultur-im-dialog.eu+ 2015, supported by MitOst e.V and Ernst Schering Foundation! This means that they have committed 3000 euros to the production of MINDEPENDENCE and will match every euro raised during this campaign, up to this amount.
Each episode costs 15000 €. The amount of 10000 € will cover core team’s travel and accommodation expenses, the salaries of the Hungarian crew and the post production. In the super great case we exceed the needed amount, we will use it for the pre-production of our next case: Turkey!!
MINDEPENDENCE is a dynamic project and its kick-off documentary is really crucial, as it defines its character, approach and objectives. Please, help us make a vigorous start and we promise to continue with the same passion and unlimited energy!
Why support MINDEPENDENCE?
Because:
Freedom of expression and information is a fundamental right but not a right everyone enjoys.
Strong, uncompromising voices of independent media should be identified and heard.
Cross-border exchange of challenges, risks and methods between media organizations should be facilitated.
We know that media freedom is suppressed but we don’t really know what it takes to claim it against all odds.
Support Statements

"MINDEPENDENCE comes at a time where the freedom of the media in Hungary, Turkey and Egypt, and not only there, is at stake. Raising awareness of the topic is vital, as is the cross-border exchange of practices and methods. The countries might be different, but freedom of the media is - well, should be - universal."
Christopher Resch, journalist, editor of The Freedom of the Media in Egypt.

“For many years, number of countries in the Western Balkans exhibited a worrying pattern of press freedom violations;and it’s only getting worse. Editorial pressure from political leaders and private owners lead to self-censorship, attacks on journalists that went unpunished were just some of the products of the rotten political systems. Mindependence reminds us that freedom of media is not the given right, but the one we should always fight for”.
Hanja Marovic, journalist, Voice of the Balkans project

"We live in a time when media companies and their journalists are quickly losing ground: they face growing pressure, enormous financial and legal struggles and they have to redefine their work and role in the society. While the space for independent media is shrinking, people easily forget that the free flow of information is vital for a democracy, just like the oxygen for the human body. Mindependence is here to remind us this fact and to shed light on a possible future of cross-border in-depth journalism."
Direkt36

"The topic of media freedom becomes more and more important every day, as we can see an increase in the intimidation of journalists and other measures that lead to limited press freedom and threaten journalists because of their work in Europe and elsewhere. A free press forms the core of a democratic society that respects human rights and everyone's right of access to information. With her groundbreaking project Martha Bouziouri and MINDEPENDENCE are continuing a
discussion that we hope will never be silenced."
Anna Saraste, Member of Executive Board, European Youth Press

"The independence and freedom of the media is at the basis of a lively democracy and a just society. Grassroots and new organisations are an increasingly important aspect of any open media landscape. In times of retrenching rights and authoritarian tendencies in many parts of Europe, this is very an essential and timely project."
Lorenzo Marsili, director of European Alternatives, spokesperson of European Media Initiative for Media Pluralism

"MINDEPENDENCE gives us a vivid idea of the difficult conditions under which independent media organizations also in Europe fight for uncensored news coverage. The Ernst Schering Foundation supports the project, since freedom of the press is something that needs to be defended every day. It is the essential condition for enabling us to freely form an opinion. Please join us in supporting the project!"
Heike Catherina Mertens, Director of Ernst Schering Foundation

Other Ways You Can Help
Money is not everything! There are many ways to support MINDEPENDENCE and help us make it happen!
Advice us on journalists and media experts in your country. Let us know their work and the causes they support.
Bring us in touch with an organization in your country, interested to host a public event on MINDEPENDENCE project.
Link us with in kind facilities – accommodation or equipment providers.
Facilitate MINDEPENDENCE screening in your city – propose a cultural venue, a theatre, an open space.
Tag articles, reports or journalists fighting for media independence and freedom of expression with the hashtag #iMindMediaIndependence
Download the “I MIND MEDIA INDEPENDENCE” banner; then add it as your cover photo on facebook and become a supporter to a common cause.

Or just spread the word and let other people and like-minded networks know what we are up to!
Thank you for supporting us!

story:
What Do We Have?

We have one of, if not the, best cities in Britain today. Bristol is a place with a fantastic heritage and history; it is a place that has a wonderful mix of peoples; it is a place that has forward thinking, world renowned businesses.

Our citizens and residents are people who want and deserve excellent services in a safe, clean and well managed environment. In short, we have, in my opinion, a place where future generations can continue to build on the successes of the past bolstered by the people and infrastructure of the present.

What Can We Achieve?

With the right City management there is nothing that the people cannot achieve. With the right City management we can have an even greater City that is ready to embrace the future in a responsible and forward thinking way. With the right City management we can have a place that is fun to work in; enjoyable to live in; great to visit and fantastic for our children and grandchildren to develop and grow-up in.

How Can We Get There?

Help my campaign to become Mayor of Bristol. Help me because I am 100% committed to ensuring that Bristol and it's people are fully supported, listened to and understood.

Help me because I am 100% in favour of supporting positive change for the future whilst gaining support from the people of the present.

Help me and you will be helping the people of Bristol shape their city for the benefit of all and for a better future.

story:
Sinopsis/ Synopsis

Matías es un sicario retirado que llegó a trabajar para la yakuza. Ahora es taxista, vive con una exprostituta y un camello de tres al cuarto. Su obsesión es seguir los pasos del Bushido, como una religión.

Por las noches hace de justiciero, como forma de redención de sus múltiples pecados, trabaja codo con codo con Fausto, un policía corrupto, que se lleva una comisión de cada caso. Sin embargo las circunstancias harán que se tengan que replantear sus prácticas, removiendo viejas heridas del pasado.

La investigación tendrá en vilo a Fausto y Matías hasta llegar a desconfiar de todo y de todos, hasta llegar a un clímax final donde todo el pasado les golpeará.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Matías is a retired killer who came to work for the yakuza. Now he is a taxi driver, lives with a former prostitute and a young clocker. His obsession is to follow the footsteps of Bushido, as a religion.

In the evenings makes avanger, as a way of redemption of its many sins, works closely with Fausto, a corrupt cop, a commission of each case takes. But the circumstances that will have to rethink their practices, removing old wounds.

Research will in suspense until Matías Faust and suspicious of everything and everyone, until a final climax where all last hit them.

Me presento/ I am

Soy Hugo Cobo, tengo 34 años y soy de Barcelona, soy un enamorado del cine, este sería mi primer largo, la sinopsis os explica de que va la película, pero no solo es eso, somos un grupo de personas que nos juntamos para hacer lo que más nos gusta, por desgracia casi ninguno de nosotros puede vivir de lo que nos gusta, hay administrativos, mecánicos, teleoperadores,..

Y sabemos que con poco dinero y mucho esfuerzo, vamos a poder conseguir hacer un largo, con acción, buenos personajes, algo de humor y sobre todo mucho sudor y lágrimas de los que participamos.

Si colaboras con nosotros, será una forma de decir, que grandes películas se pueden hacer con bajo presupuesto.

¿estás listo para colaborar?
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I am Hugo Cobo, I have 34 years and I'm from Barcelona, I am a lover of film, this would be my first feature film, the synopsis explains you that's the movie, but not only that, we are a group of people got together to do what we like, unfortunately almost none of us can live as we like, there are administrative, mechanical, telemarketers, ..

And we know that with little money and much effort, we will be able to get a long with action, good characters, some humor and a lot of sweat and tears of those who participate.

If you collaborate with us, it will be a way of saying, that great films can be made with low budget.

Are you ready to work?

Lo que necesitamos/ We need

Os prometemos que nada de este dinero será destinado ni para putas ni farlopa, como pasa en otras películas.
  • La mayor parte del presupuesto se la lleva la división de maquillaje y SFX, ya queremos efectos a la vieja escuela, todo más artesanal, casi nada de efectos digitales.
  • Ni actores ni técnicos cobrarán en el proyecto, ellos también apuestan por el film y su trabajo es su aportación a Bushido Taxi.
  • Rodaremos en digital, nada de malgastar dinero en 35mm, por bonito que salga, hemos hecho un presupuesto muy apurado, para poder movernos, comer y poder acabar la película.
  • Si todo llega a buen puerto el siguiente punto será estrenar en cines y plataformas digitales.

DESGLOSE

-5000€ Maquillaje y FX

-1700€ Fotografía

-400€ Sonido

-1000 Dirección de Arte

-500€ Vestuario

-850 € Catering

-1000 € Gasolina y Transportes

-550 € Promoción

-1000€ Imprevistos

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We promise that any of this money will be used not for whores nor cocaine. As happens in other films.

-Most of the budget division carries makeup and SFX as we old-school effects, especially more traditional, almost no digital effects.
-Or actors or technicians charged in the project, they also bet on the film and his work is its contribution to Bushido Taxi.
-We will ride in digital, not 35mm wasting money by beautiful to leave, we did a     great hurry budget, to move, eat and be able to finish the film.
-If everything comes to fruition the next point will be release in cinemas and digital platforms.

APPORTIONMENT

-5000€ Makeup y FX

-1700€ Photography

-400€ Sound

-1000€ Atrezzo

-500€ Costume Design

-850 € Catering

-1000 € Fuel & Trips

-550 € Promotion
-1000€ Incidentals

El protagonista


El personaje principal de la trama, es sin duda un personaje muy complicado de interpretar, Matías es un hombre de unos 60 años, trabaja de taxista, está tuerto y es un borracho que intenta recuperar su honor, haciendo de justiciero nocturno.
Para un personaje así, era complicado encontrar un actor, pero hemos tenidos mucha suerte al contar con Josep M. Alejandre, este actor catalán, ha participado en más de 100 proyectos audiovisuales en los últimos tres años.
josepalejandre.jimdo.com

A parte de ser un buen actor, es una gran persona, actor que se implica y por más horas de trabajo siempre tiene una sonrisa y ganas de seguir trabajando. Es todo un profesional.
Ha trabajado muchos años para TV3, pero ahora su carrera está enfocada a la interpretación, actor de teatro, series de Tv, películas como Born (aclamada por la crítica), junto con otros proyectos por estrenar. Además de participar en decenas de cortos tanto de estudiantes, como producciones internacionales o cortos amateur, si le gusta la historia y el personaje. Josep M. Alejandre participa.

El proyecto/ Project

Un largo no es como un corto, que te juntas un par de días con tus colegas y lo haces, un largo es muy complicado, será una prueba digna de superar.

Con 16 años, trabajaba en un videoclub, el DVD aún no estaba implantado y casi todo eran cintas de VHS, Acabé viendo casi todas las películas del videoclub, me encantaba el cine, Pero hubo un día que me encontré con Clerks, una película de bajo presupuesto y no era la típica película de autor, era divertida y aunque visualmente era muy mejorable, llegó a mis manos, desde ese día quise que mi pasión fuera mi oficio, han pasado muchos años y muchas cosas, pero esta vez quiero hacerlo realidad, quiero hacer mi ópera prima.

Lo estoy dando todo en este proyecto, Solo necesito un poco de vuestro apoyo.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Film is not a shortfilm, ou a couple of days together with your friends and do, a long is very complicated, it will be a worthy test to overcome.
At 16 years, I worked at a video store, the DVD was still not implemented and almost all were VHS tapes, I ended up watching almost all movies from the video store, I loved the movie, but there was one day that I found Clerks, film budget and was not the typical art film, it was fun and although it was visually improved, came to me from that day I wanted my passion outside my office, many years have passed and many things, but this time I want to make it happen I want to make my debut.
I'm giving everything in this project, I just need a little of your support.

El desafio/ The Challenge

Soy una persona realista, no he escrito ningún guión que no pueda rodar, hay escenas más complejas que otras, pero me he rodeado de un grupo de inadaptados sociales, que son grandes profesionales, lo que nos falta a uno, otro lo compensa, entre nosotros nos ayudamos y apoyamos.

Nuestra actitud y forma de afrontar los problemas, nos harán llegar a la meta, pero no solo será terminar la película, luego tenemos que seguir corriendo a fondo, para presentarla a festivales, ofrecerla a Televisiones, buscar distribución y promocionarla hasta que nos quedemos sin dedos de tanto teclear.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I am a realist, I have not written a script that can not roll, there are more complex than other scenes, but I surrounded by a group of misfits who are great professionals, what we lack one another makes up between we help each other and support.
Our attitude and way of dealing with problems, we will reach the goal, but no one will finish the movie, then we have to keep running back, for submission to festivals, offer to Televisions, find distribution and promote it until we run out therefore typing fingers.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar/ Another way to help


Muchas personas, tal como esta el panorama actual, lo tendrán complicado para ayudar, cualquier ayuda es bien recibida, si tienes una tienda de ropa y quieres darnos ropa, tienes un bar y nos dejas rodar en él, o incluso tienes un piso que puedas ofrecer como decorado, adelante.

Otra forma de ayudar sin gastar un duro, es compartir este proyecto, Bushido Taxi te necesita, comparte por Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp, Tumblr, YouTube, Line, a tus amigos, familiares, mails, incluso google+,

Muchas gracias!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Many people, as is the current situation, it will be difficult to help, any help is welcome, if you have a clothing store and want to give us clothes, you have a bar and let us shoot at him, or even have an apartment you can offer as decorated on.

Another way to help without spending a penny, is to share this project, Taxi Bushido needs you, share via Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp, Tumblr, YouTube, Line, to your friends, family, mails, even google +

Thank you very much!

Muchas personas, tal como esta el panorama actual, lo tendrán complicado para ayudar, cualquier ayuda es bien recibida, si tienes una tienda de ropa y quieres darnos ropa, tienes un bar y nos dejas rodar en él, o incluso tienes un piso que puedas ofrecer como decorado, adelante.Otra forma de ayudar sin gastar un duro, es compartir este proyecto, Bushido Taxi te necesita, comparte por Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp, Tumblr, YouTube, Line, a tus amigos, familiares, mails, incluso google+, Muchas gracias!----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Many people, as is the current situation, it will be difficult to help, any help is welcome, if you have a clothing store and want to give us clothes, you have a bar and let us shoot at him, or even have an apartment you can offer as decorated on. Another way to help without spending a penny, is to share this project, Taxi Bushido needs you, share via Facebook, Twitter, Whatsapp, Tumblr, YouTube, Line, to your friends, family, mails, even google +Thank you very much!

story:
10 Days to a Home!


  • ANEW Community Institute helps people in the community to become self sufficient and to participate in helping others.We are renovating this house, which was abandoned for 15 years, and turning it into affordable housing for a homeless veteran, a community drop in center that will provide financial literacy and life skills training,  and a community coffeehouse. But the first ten days, we are concentrating on providing an affordable home for a homeless veteran and his spouse. Please Help!
  • This Homeless Vet and his Spouse need our help now! There is a four room apartment on the third floor of the Baker House that we are renovating so that they can move in! They are helping with the work, and they want to help others when they are settled.
  • If you help us, you will be providing a home for a veteran, and then we will work with him to help him build his future as a community leader over the long term.


We Need Your Help!

ANEW Community Institute has many projects going, such as hosting a huge Jazz and Arts Festival, providing arts programming to the community, helping community members start their own mall businesses, running a print shop and publishing house, and training low income young people for careers in home renovation- carpentry, plumbing, and electrical. 

  • Right now, we are in need of  $5000.00 for supplies for the renovation of our community help center,  meals for volunteers, and transportation to the site. 
  • Donors will be invited to the VIP Grand Opening Celebration! 
  • Some of our perks include: 
  • $1,000 or more: A Season Pass to All Our Arts and Music Events.
  • $500 to $999: Entry to the VIP Meet the Artists Dinner 
  • $100 to $500: Tickets to see one of our music performances
  • Under $100: a photograph in front of the Baker House, autographed by our Veteran, who will no longer be homeless BECAUSE of YOU! and free coffee for a month from our coffeehouse.
  • Every penny we raise will go to the renovation of the Baker House!

The Impact

You can feel proud of the difference your contribution will make:

  • There should not be any American Veterans who are HOMELESS! Your contribution will be a jumpstart to the civilian life of a soldier who deserves to be honored, not ignored!
  •  Our track record is amazing for a community nonprofit  that receives no government or big foundation money. All our contributors are people from the community who care about the work we do.  We have saved families' homes from tax sales and foreclosures, helped negotiate debt into affordable payment plans, raised money for fire victims in Homestead and Wilkinsburg, helped families find housing, and provided life skills and job training for many youth and hard to employ adults.
  • The Baker House will be the center of our day to day operations in the community and provide a place for people in transition to get the help they need. And the beauty of our program is that we turn those we help into volunteers who then help the next person in need! A dollar given to our organization can help many more because we keep passing the blessing forward!

Good News!

Our Homeless Veteran was just offered a JOB! He needs to be in his new home right away.
  • Imagine how hard it must be to get up on time and get ready for work as a homeless veteran. Bathing, getting breakfast, clean clothes, tooth-brushing, all the things we take for granted, things that should be easy, become challenges.
  • Please help today! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign- share it on Facebook, email it to your friends, ask people to help us!

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • You can help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign- share it on Facebook, email it to your friends, ask people to help us!
  • Come and Volunteer at the Baker House, Monday through Saturday, 11:00 AM-4:00 PM, whenever you are available!

story:
Join the Team!

Hey--guess what! Mint On Card is completely filmed, and the footage looks awesome!! That's great news, but better yet--it's not too late to JOIN the Mint On Card team! We're seeking help in funding the post-production costs of the movie.




What is Mint On Card?

Mint On Card is the quirky, family-friendly story of a socially awkward (but fun and interesting) bunch of friends who band together to rescue a rare sci-fi action figure (the Lavender-Dress Solar Princess) that has fallen into the hands of a dastardly and undeserving villain. The movie is a lot of fun, and it's filled with dynamic performances from incredible actors who were supported by an amazing (skeleton) crew. (Please be sure to check out the TRAILER to get a feel for the story and a taste of the production quality!)

By the way, Mint On Card was filmed entirely in Connecticut, USA, with talented actors and crew members from across New England!




What is Third Life Cinema?

Led by Aaron Vnuk and Mark Daniel Foley, Third Life Cinema is the small, new, Connecticut-based motion picture and video production company that produced Mint On Card. We succeed thanks to hard work and help from friends, family members, and occasional innocent bystanders.


Who are we?

   

Aaron Vnuk was diagnosed with Retinitis Pigmentosa in 2002, a disease that would eventually rob him of his vision. Today, he is legally blind and continues his work as a School Counselor for middle school children and is dedicated to his passion of bodybuilding and fitness. Aaron has produced independent films for over 15 years and holds the position of Executive Producer at Third Life Cinema.

Mark Daniel Foley served as a teacher and middle school administrator for over 15 years, earning several graduate degrees, including a doctorate in Educational Leadership. Mark has always loved movies and creative writing, and he has collaborated with Aaron for the past eight years in film making. He enjoys spending his free time with his wife and two young daughters.

Prior to Third Life Cinema, we (Aaron and Mark) produced horror/thriller movies under the name of Moongoyle Entertainment. But this past fall, our world was turned upside down, to say the least, when we became the focus of an intense scandal, generated and aggressively promoted by local print and television media.

Professional educators by trade, we always kept our careers completely separate from our movie productions; however, we were sharply criticized across the media for being professional educators who made horror movies in our free time.

The irony is that the biggest and most consistent criticism of our films by horror fans was that they were interesting but way too tame; we left out the extremely graphic scenes that are so common, and basically expected, in horror movies and TV these days. In fact, the violence in our films was almost entirely implied with quick cuts and so forth. We focused on interesting characters instead of graphic effects. There was some profanity and a small amount of nudity in the films, but no sex scenes or anything like that. Nevertheless, the media portrayed our movies--and us--as completely deviant and obscene.

This past fall was without question the darkest and most difficult time of our lives—for us and for our families and close friends, who have supported us through everything. Our movies were all low-budget, but we were proud of them, mostly because of what we were able to accomplish with extremely limited resources and help from a lot of great people. Any of you who have ever tried to produce any kind of feature film can certainly understand how challenging it is on a shoestring budget.

Although we have deep scars from the scandal, we’re really excited about our current project, Mint On Card. After the events of the fall, we made a decision to change movie genres. We had always incorporated humor into our films, and going forward, we decided to focus on comedy films that are fun for the whole family.




Why Indiegogo?

The reason we’re on Indiegogo is that our miniature (3/8 of a subatomic particle) budget has evaporated, and we still have finishing (sound mixing, music, color correction, color grading, and DCP) expenses to cover. We are EXTREMELY proud and excited about the film we’ve got, and we want to make sure that we are able to present it in the highest quality possible! Rest assured, the movie is coming out soon no matter what, but we really want to maximize its quality.

This is a TERRIFIC opportunity (at least we think so) for you to become part of an exciting project that is very close to completion. So please check out the rewards and recognitions that we’ve created for donations, and consider becoming part of the Mint On Card team!


Where does the money go?




Thank you for visiting and considering our project!

story:
Mohalla Films is an independent and international film collective based in San Francisco and Kolkata, founded in 2015 by Abhijeet Paul and Jack Whittington.

We are working on a series of short films dealing with life, work, and the ways we spend our days and interact in our communities.

The Films

Currently we are on location in Pondicherry, India shooting our first of three vignettes, Romain Rolland, focusing on a group of auto-rickshaw drivers who frequent a corner steps from the beach. Staleen, Salim, Selvam, Murugan, and their friends work ferrying tourists and locals to and from the popular promenade area. In this hot and humid off-season they spend much of their day hanging out, talking, drinking tea, and waiting for fares.

Other upcoming shoots include a segment on Kanmani, a novelist and mechanic, and other local authors, activists, and fishermen in the coastal region of Tamil Nadu battered in the 2004 tsunami.

Your Contribution

Working with local crews, and shooting on both 16mm film and digital video, your contributions will not only help us compensate our collaborators and offset the costs of production, but will also allow us to give back to the communities we are working in through donations to educational programs and sanitation projects.

Thank you for your support!

The Filmmakers

Jack Whittington is an artist, illustrator, designer, photographer, and now filmmaker. See more of his work at jackwhittington.com.

Abhijeet Paul is a literary critic and postdoctoral researcher in Vermont interested in the ethics of craft, repair-work, and analog machines.

Perks

  • $10 Thank you postcard print
  • $25 A3 size film poster (11.69 x 16.53in) designed by Jack Whittington
  • $50 Mohalla Films logo t-shirt screen printed ethically in India on a high quality cotton tee.
  • $100 Photo print from the film set, suitable for framing.
  • $1000 20% Donation in your name to a community organization and a thank you credit in the film.

All contributors will receive updates on screenings, and an invitation to stream the films online once they premiere.

story:
Dear Friend, 

I’m thrilled to serve as an ambassador for the SOSAJI! Legacy Campaign, a unique, sock-centric effort to promote a spirit of giving, gumption, and goodwill that will benefit various nonprofit organizations. As an ambassador, I have a wonderful opportunity to choose one of the nonprofit organizations that will benefit from this campaign, and I choose Gilda’s Club Louisville.

My Inspiration

I inherited an appreciation for fast cars from my father. My first car was an $850 Fiat Abarth that we had to tow home, where the real magic happened: me and my dad working on that car all day--rebuilding the engine, painting, transforming it into something special. Each moment we spent fixing it up, as with everything else we did together, we were  creating the best memories of my life. We were close back then, as we are now--but now my dad has cancer. 

My mom is an eighteen-year survivor of breast cancer. My older sister had and beat cancer. My younger sister has breast cancer, which has now spread into her lungs. My grandfather on my mom’s side had cancer.  

I am intimately aware of the devastating affects of cancer, and so is Gilda’s Club Louisville, which is an organization dedicated to serving cancer patients and their family and friends. 

Please join me and SOSAJI! in this worthwhile effort to build a legacy of giving, gumption, and goodwill. Make a contribution. Make a difference. 
Sincerely,

George Woodrow Hippler, III

The Process

1. Awesome people like you contribute to the campaign until it's fully funded. We need at least $5,000 to cover production, packaging/labeling, and shipping costs.  

2. SOSAJI! produces about 2,000 pairs of socks bearing one of the winning designs from the  SOSAJI! Design-A-Sock Contest.

3. SOSAJI! sells the socks and the designated nonprofits receives 10% to 18% of the proceeds until the socks sell out--a potential gift of over $10,000, collectively. The greater of the two percentages goes to nonprofits who choose to partner with SOSAJ!.

4. Once the initial collection of socks sells out, SOSAJI! produces four additional designs that continue to benefit the designated nonprofit organization.


The Perks

  • Contribute $25 or more: receive 1 PAIR of socks
  • Contribute $50 or more: receive 2 PAIRS of socks
  • Contribute $100 or more: receive 3 PAIRS of socks.
  • Contribute $200 or more: receive 4 PAIRS of SOSAJI! Legacy Socks, AND we'll record our groovy gratitude Happy Dance dance moves and post them online just for you
  • Contribute $500 or more: receive 10 PAIRS of SOSAJI! Legacy Socks, AND an opportunity to be on the SOSAJI! Design Team

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whether you can make a financial contribution or not, please help us to get the world out about the SOSAJI! Legacy Campaign.

story:
The Series

The episodes that will be featured on the show have a wide variety of topics, as it is an anthology series. Here are a few topics we'll observe in our first season:

  • Psychological thrillers, Science Fiction, Suspense, Horror, Time-travel, afterlife, irony, revenge, recurring dreams and nightmares, social commentary on current subject matter, killer twins, self-deprivation, the last man on earth, and a few comedic takes on life; facts, and fictions. Often, the stories conclude with a macabre or unexpected twist. 

We will feature several up-and-coming Writers, Directors and Actors as well as many established ones. 

The theme of the show will follow the likes of older classics such as:

  • The Twilight Zone, Tales From The Crypt, Alfred Hitchcock Presents, Goosebumps, Beyond Belief: Fact or Fiction, The Outer Limits, Are You Afraid of the Dark,  KaBlam! (Yes, that KaBlam!), and more.

Be the fuel to our Rocket!!

This is not about you giving us money! it’s about a community coming together to acquire the stuff we need, to bring these stories to life.

In a nut-shell...

  • My name is Jovan Thomas. I am a filmmaker born, and raised in Los Angeles, Ca, in 1990. I've been acting for about three years, and began writing and directing my own materials as of last year. 
  • This campaign is to help fund my dreams! kinda. It will help me get my feet off the ground and shoot a professional quality television show/pilot.
  • With your help we can fund a project that would take myself years to gather up, if ever. This will be the beginning of a beautiful journey and I would love your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown:

  • I'm only asking for a cup of coffee. That's right. $5! If each person I know can donate that small amount, then i can reach the goal in no time! (unless you want to be awesome and give more, I won't stop you)
  • The goal we are trying to reach would fund the first three episodes of the series, including the opening sequence. The funds go toward things like camera equipment, lighting, sound, location rentals, hair and make-up materials, a crew to use these things (I can't shoot it by myself), and provide food for the crew to eat. :)
  • If the funds are raised, we would use $1500 for each episode, $1000 for the opening sequence, and remaining $500 for other essential items.   
  • In comparison, big budget pilots are much more expensive than what i'm asking here. The average cost of a half-hour comedy pilot is $2 million, while a drama costs about $5.5 million, just to shoot. (I only need a few grand)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, like myself (we're all broke!!!), but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Like, share, tweet, re-tweet, subscribe, follow., all of that good stuff!

And that's all there is to it. 

(oh, and to all those would be supporters, this isn't a donation, it's an investment in our career! Thank you.)

   What We Need & What You Get Here's a breakdown:  I'm only asking for a cup of coffee. That's right. $5! If each person I know can donate that small amount, then i can reach the goal in no time! (unless you want to be awesome and give more, I won't stop you)
The goal we are trying to reach would fund the first three episodes of the series, including the opening sequence. The funds go toward things like camera equipment, lighting, sound, location rentals, hair and make-up materials, a crew to use these things (I can't shoot it by myself), and provide food for the crew to eat. :)
If the funds are raised, we would use $1500 for each episode, $1000 for the opening sequence, and remaining $500 for other essential items.   

In comparison, big budget pilots are much more expensive than what i'm asking here. The average cost of a half-hour comedy pilot is $2 million, while a drama costs about $5.5 million, just to shoot. (I only need a few grand)




Other Ways You Can Help

 Some people just can't contribute, like myself (we're all broke!!!), but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Like, share, tweet, re-tweet, subscribe, follow., all of that good stuff!   And that's all there is to it. (oh, and to all those would be supporters, this isn't a donation, it's an investment in our career! Thank you.)

story:
Preface

Hey, everyone, I am Sergey Lipskiy. If you are fan of game console emulation and N64 emulation in particular, you know about GLideN64 – new graphics plugin, which uses powerful features of modern graphics cards to bring you new level of quality and authenticity of hardware-based emulation. The project’s rapid development became possible after successful campaign here, on Indeigogo. Public release of GLideN64 for Personal Computers released recently. Android port is under development and will be finished this May.

New feature

GLideN64 has many advanced features. However, people always wants more. I have extensive feedback from GLideN64 users. Users proposed many new ideas how to improve the plugin. Unfortunately, plugin development took more time than planned and funds collected for development already ended. I promised to finish Android port, but that is all I can do. However, if you are interesting to support further plugin development, I would be happy to continue my work for some time. I analyzed users ideas and selected the one, which can be implemented within one month and bring new breath to old N64 titles. I am talking about collection of post-processing effects, known as DolphinFX.  DolphinFX is an independent freeware library of shaders, which contains large number of post processing filters, like Cel Shading, Bloom, Scanlines and many more. It supported by OpenGL backend of Dolphin emulator. Having support of this library in GLideN64 would be super great.

Prerequisites

DolphinFX written on GLSL language and works only in OpenGL context. GLideN64 also uses OpenGL. Check.

DolphinFX needs an image for post processing. GLideN64 frame buffer emulation subsystem always ready to provide that image. GLideN64 already has its own post-processor. It currently supports only Bloom effect, but it can be extended. Check.

DolphinFX is extendable library of effects. Each effects has its own set of options. It is hard to support with static User Interface. Proper user interface for DolphinFX must dynamically generate all tabs with controls for all currently available effects. Dolphin emulator already implemented it. However, Dolphin uses wxWidgets library, while GLideN64 User Interface powered by QT Widgets. Thus, this work must be done almost from scratch.

Plan for Project Completion

While DolphinFX is already written and Dolphin emulator has all necessary code to support it, porting of that code to GLideN64 will not be easy. I can separate that task on three large parts:

·  Port load shader functionality: read shader file, parse its configuration section

·  Port setup shader functionality: activate selected effects, provide values for their options.

·  Implement dynamic generation of User Interface for available effects.

I plan to finish Android port works this May. That campaign will finish in June. If campaign start will be successful, I will start to work on it right in June, so first results will be accessible somewhere in June and the release will be this July.

Risks & Challenges

One month is bare minimum for this task. However, it is interesting task and I am ready to risk if you will support me. If campaign will reach the goal, I will do my best to add DolphinFX support to GLideN64 as soon as possible. Note: this project is NOT Fixed Funding. If collected sum will be less than the goal, but not less than 50%, it will allow me to continue my work on the project for few weeks. There are plenty of tasks to do. May be collected sum will be enough to take another ambitious task to implement. Resident Evil 2 is waiting for support :) If the campaign will be super successful and exceed the goal,  all extra funds also will go on further project development. After the campaign end, I will continue to work on the project as on my favorite hobby. However, serious code modifications from my side hardly will be possible.
