story:
El Cortometraje / The Short

"Heroína" es el primer cortometraje de comedia de nuestra productora, producido en Argentina y con un equipo internacional (Ecuador, Argentina, Chile, Reino Unido, Perú y Bolivia). / “Heroin” is the first comedic, short from our agency. We produce in Argentina with an international team (Ecuador, Argentina, Chile, UK, Perú y Bolivia).

El guion fue escrito y corregido durante el Master de guion audiovisual en la Universidad de Navarra-España. / The screenplay was written and reviewed during the sripwriting Audiovisual Master in the Navarra University in Spain.

Sinopsis / Synopsis: 

Clara, una dulce abuelita luego de realizar sus compras habituales se cruza por coincidencia con 2 jóvenes traficantes que ocultan su producto entre las compras de Clara. / Clara, a sweet grandmother after making their usual purchases crosses paths with 2 young traffickers who hide their product in Clara’s purchases.

La policía confunde a Clara con una distribuidora de droga y la lleva a interrogatorio. Dándose cuenta de su error proponen a Clara que ayude a la captura de los traficantes. / The police confuse Clara with a distributor of drugs and it leads to her questioning. Realizing their mistake they propose to Clara to help catch the traffickers.

Ficha Técnica / Technical Information :

Año / Year: en producción - 2015 / work in progress 2015
Duración / Running Time: 10 min.
País / Country: Argentina

Directora / Director: Elena Vásconez (Ecuador)
Asist. de Dir / Director Asist: Martina Oviedo (Ar)
Fotografía / Cinematography: Joako Aránguiz (Ar), Celeste Herrera (Ar)
Sonido / Sound: David Palomino (Ar), Javier Fernandez (Ar)
Arte / Art: Renata Montalvano (Ar), Beatriz Barrantes (Cl)
Vestuario y Maquillaje / Costume and Makeup : Vania Bellido (Pe), Carla Catacora (Bo)
Guion / Screenwriter: Fernando Zaa (Ec)

Reparto / Cast: Irene Bianchi (Ar), Lee Wilson (UK), Jonatan Eche (Ar), Jorge Valiente (Ar), Ulises Maeso (Ar)

Productora / Production Co.: Útero Films
Género / Genre: Comedia / Comedy

Qué necesitamos y que obtienes? / What we need and what you will gain?

La filmación del cortometraje esta en producción, hemos iniciado el rodaje con el apoyo de todo el grupo y de nuestra productora pero nos hace falta recursos. Ayúdanos a terminar la filmación de este cortometraje para que pueda rodar por festivales internacionales. Nuestros deseos son que podamos ingresar a 3 festivales europeos a principios del próximo año. The shooting of the short is in progress, we started filming with the support of the whole group and our production company but we need more resources. Help us to finish shooting this film, so you can roll on international festivals. Our wish is that we can enter three European festivals early next year.
  • Sólo nos falta rodar 2 escenas, son las principales y las que más recursos necesitan. Además de la etapa de post producción. All we need to do to complete the film is to shoot two scenes, they are the most important scenes in the film. The resources will go to complete these two important scenes and  in addition to the post-production stage.
  • Puedes ayudarnos con lo que quieras y puedas, entre más somos más cerca de la meta estaremos! Tu ayuda significa mucho, por eso estarás en los créditos y también puedes convertirte en productor asociado.You can help with what you want and with what you can, The more people we have supporting us the quicker we will reach our goal. Your support means a lot, so you can be on the credits and you can also become associate producer.
  • Todos los recursos estarán destinados al desarrollo de esta producción, sí o sí la terminaremos para ustedes.All resources will be allocated to the development of this production, and to certainly finish it.

El cortometraje / The Short

Heroína es un corto de comedia cuyo guion nace durante un trabajo práctico del master de guion audiovisual en la universidad de Navarra. Heroin is a comedy short whose screenplay  was born during a practical work for the master of audiovisual script at the University of Navarra.

Siempre se dice que hacer comedia y terror son los géneros más difíciles y por eso nos encanta el reto. Contamos actualmente con elenco completo y personal técnico completo, uniendo a 7 países dentro de este equipo humano incluyendo la música original que nos ayuda una banda polaca. It is always said that to do comedy and horror genres are the most difficult and this is why we love the challenge. We currently have full cast and complete technical staff, uniting 7 countries in this team including the original music by a Polish band.

Riesgos y desafíos / Risks and Challenges

El verdadero desafío es encontrar los recursos para alquiler de equipos, utilería y locaciones. Todo esta previamente visto pero nos hace falta tu ayuda para terminar. El cortometraje ya esta filmado en un 60%, nos falta poco para terminar y con tu ayuda podemos lograrlo. The real challenge is finding the resources to hire equipment, props and locations. Everything is previewed but we need your help to finish. The film is already shot 60%, we need a little to finish it and with your help we can.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar / Other ways to help

Posiblemente sientas muchas ganas de ayudarnos pero en este momento no tienes dinero, pues te invitamos a que nos escribas y te conviertas en proveedor de las cosas que necesitamos para terminar, toda ayuda es bienvenida. Possibly you feel eager to help but at this point you have no money, then we invite you to write us and become a provider of the things we need to finish, any help is welcome.

Si estas en Ecuador puedes hacer tu contribución a la Cta. Cte. #02002022288 a nombre de nuestro Productor Luis Zamorano.

Recuerda que también puedes ayudarnos compartiendo esta campaña, utiliza las herramientas de Indigogo y haz que nuestro proyecto se posible. Remember that you can also help us by sharing this campaign used tools Indigogo and make our project possible.

Más información / More Information

Todo lo referente al corto "Heroína" lo puedes encontrar en su web oficial, dando click en : WEB HEROINA SHORT . Everything about the short "Heroine" you can find on the official website, by clicking: WEB HEROIN SHORT.

story:
Our shoot begins in the middle of August!  Help us raise extra funds to make this project a success.

We are oh so close to our shoot in late August and early September in Chicago, IL, and we're raising extra funds to fully realize our vision.  Help us make our complete vision a reality!



The Story

"Speaking in Tongues" follows Jake, a brand new Christian, as he joins his new church on an "evangelism internship" seeking to save anyone and everyone during one summer in Chicago.


A brief history of "Speaking in Tongues"...

In 2009, I spent my summer knocking on hundreds of doors, passing out thousands of pamphlets, and walking the streets of Chicago for hours a day talking to strangers about Christ. I was an unpaid intern working for an evangelical megachurch, preaching hardline conservative morality behind an approachable young mask. But talking to people and, eventually, seeing the tactics my church employed for what they were, I ended up starting to lose my own faith rather than converting anyone. 

"Speaking in Tongues" is not an anti-Christian polemic, nor Christian propaganda.  Their are miracles in the film, as well as doubts.  Just like real life.  Together with my co-writer Lawrie Doran, we want to make a film that will take the experiences and beliefs of people in these organizations seriously.

This is a film for anyone who’s ever had to question their fundamental beliefs, or found themselves too far down the wrong path. It is the story of a young man, Jake, who is unsure where he’s going and clings to a definite answer when what he needs to learn is to embrace the fact that he can’t control his future. It’s a character study of a young pastor and his enthusiastic twentysomething bro-sciples, crammed together in a small sweaty Chicago apartment for three months. Speaking In Tongues is a film we passionately want to make because writing it has forced us both to look more closely at why we believe what we believe – with or without religion.​

What we need the money for

These extra funds will go a long way for a project of our size.  Here's how we'd break $1500 down:
  • $200 will go to supporting more crew
  • $200 will help us rent a location we're excited about but is currently out of our budget
  • $400 will go directly to the Production Design
  • $700 will help us rent the camera and gear for one extra shooting day

The Short Film

In 2013 I made a short film at the London Film School called "Tongues" that went on to the London Short Film Festival, the Edinburgh International Film Festival, and British Shorts Berlin.

The film is a mix of my own experiences and an infamous story at the now-defunct Seattle megachurch Mars Hill, updated and sexed into one story about a foreign exchange student in London who's beginning to get uber religious.

You can watch the trailer here or watch the entire film below:


If that all sounds good to you, donate!  Many dedicated and talented people are devoting their skills for free...any extra funds will only help us better realize our vision.

A brief history of "Speaking in Tongues"...
In 2009, I spent my summer knocking on hundreds of doors, passing out thousands of pamphlets, and walking the streets of Chicago for hours a day talking to strangers about Christ. I was an unpaid intern working for an evangelical megachurch, preaching hardline conservative morality behind an approachable young mask. But talking to people and, eventually, seeing the tactics my church employed for what they were, I ended up starting to lose my own faith rather than converting anyone. "Speaking in Tongues" is not an anti-Christian polemic, nor Christian propaganda.  Their are miracles in the film, as well as doubts.  Just like real life.  Together with my co-writer Lawrie Doran, we want to make a film that will take the experiences and beliefs of people in these organizations seriously.This is a film for anyone who’s ever had to question their fundamental beliefs, or found themselves too far down the wrong path. It is the story of a young man, Jake, who is unsure where he’s going and clings to a definite answer when what he needs to learn is to embrace the fact that he can’t control his future. It’s a character study of a young pastor and his enthusiastic twentysomething bro-sciples, crammed together in a small sweaty Chicago apartment for three months. Speaking In Tongues is a film we passionately want to make because writing it has forced us both to look more closely at why we believe what we believe – with or without religion.​

What we need the money forThese extra funds will go a long way for a project of our size.  Here's how we'd break $1500 down:



$200 will go to supporting more crew

$200 will help us rent a location we're excited about but is currently out of our budget

$400 will go directly to the Production Design

$700 will help us rent the camera and gear for one extra shooting day

  
The Short Film
In 2013 I made a short film at the London Film School called "Tongues" that went on to the London Short Film Festival, the Edinburgh International Film Festival, and British Shorts Berlin.
The film is a mix of my own experiences and an infamous story at the now-defunct Seattle megachurch Mars Hill, updated and sexed into one story about a foreign exchange student in London who's beginning to get uber religious.
You can watch the trailer here or watch the entire film below:



If that all sounds good to you, donate!  Many dedicated and talented people are devoting their skills for free...any extra funds will only help us better realize our vision.

story:
“The New Business Brigade” and Ubaldi Reports Story

At no other time since WWII, have so many talented men and women been returning from foreign wars and reintegrating into the workforce. Will today's business owners and CEO's recognize and seize this valuable American asset?

Will America recognize the value of a Veteran?

After serving in the Marine Corps, with three combat tours in both Iraq and Afghanistan, I had the distinct pleasure of serving with the best men and women America has to offer. These individuals are the “Next Greatest Generation”, but unlike their World War II forebears, they served in a different cause then the nation has ever faced before in its history.

One unfortunate aspect is that America knows very little of their experience, and few of the American people, especially our political leaders, literally have no connection to those who wear the nations uniform.

Far too often veterans are alienated from the very country they have sworn to protect and serve? Why is that!

This is why I wrote “"The New Business Brigade: Veterans Dynamic Impact on US Business". I wanted businesses across America to know of the untapped resource veterans represent. I also wanted to let the leaders in Washington know of the valuable resource at their disposal, making them understand what veterans have brought to this country, and continue to bring to this country.

I did not want to just stop there, I wanted to challenge our political leaders in solving the nation’s most pressing concerns, but without a partisan spin. I want the fact’s, not fiction in news reporting. This why I started my own company called “Ubaldi Reports”. The vision for the company is to be the only news organization which provides credible, documented, political content, addressing domestic and global issues, written by U.S. military veterans and their dependents, on domestic and global issues.

I wrote “The New Business Brigade” to let America know of an untapped resource they are wasting, and this is also why I started Ubaldi Reports, to hire veterans and their dependents that provide expert analysis from individuals who have served their country.

What We Need

Ubaldi Reports has come a long way since its inception, and its president John Ubaldi, a retired 30 year veteran of the United States Marine Corps, with three tours of duty in Iraq and Afghanistan, author and Civil Affairs expert, and political commentator, gives the reader and business leader's much insight on how to utilized this overlooked resource. The book has already become a number one best seller at Amazon.com and gained the attention of notable military figures like General James Mattis USMC (Ret) Former Commander of U.S. Central Command, among others.

Ubaldi has never collected a salary, but to expand and hire veterans and their dependents more resources are needed.

Since “The New Business Brigade” was published it has already become, as mentioned previously, a best seller on Amazon. Our goal is for this book to reach the New York Times Best Sellers list, but to do so we need more resources.

To get “The New Business Brigade” on the New York Times best seller list, to reach businesses across America, and to expand “Ubaldi Reports” we need to raise a minimum of $30K in capital funding.

This amount will:

• Put together a robust marketing and public relations campaign.

• Advertise “The New Business Brigade” in national publications.

• Leverage a full court national video, digital media campaign.

• Expand social media presence by fully and continually optimizing the website.

• Market podcasts to a greater audience.

• Expand audio podcast to video podcast with high quality video feeds.

• Expand high-quality content you get to read, watch, and listen to.

• Acquire Industry professional equipment.

• Begin to hire a staff of former military veterans and dependents to expand the content and research capabilities.

Our real goal is $50K; and when we reach that mark it will enable us to:

• Provide a comprehensive expanded national video and digital media campaign.

• Expand comprehensive national social media campaign on various social media platforms.

• Launch expanded regular video podcast on national and international issues as it relates to the 2016 presidential election.

• Expand Advertisement of “The New Business Brigade” in major national publications.

• Bring in major national public and private guests onto video presentations.

• Hire a robust staff of veterans and dependents in advertising, marketing and content delivery.

• Acquire additional Industry professional equipment for video production.

• Rent studio for expanded video production.

The Impact

At the end of the day the mission of “Ubaldi Reports” is to provide credible, political content, addressing domestic and global issues, resulting in a well-informed and knowledgeable citizen that can take responsible action of their own choice.

Far too often the media is polarizing and partisan, I wanted to provide “Fact not Fiction” based reporting on domestic and global issues, with all staff comprised by veterans and dependents, who have an expertise on domestic and global issues.

Ubaldi Reports gives veterans and their dependents an opportunity to serve their country in a different capacity, by challenging Washington on domestic and global issues.

The whole purpose of "The New Business Brigade: Veterans Dynamic Impact on US Business", as mentioned previously, is letting the business community know of an untapped resource that veterans represent. As the veterans of World War II re-shaped the American landscape for decades, the veterans from the War on Terror will do the same; just get out of their way and watch them re-shape this country.

This is what Ubald Reports and “The New Business Brigade” is all about. With this funding campaign we also have exciting perks to offer you.

Contributions of:

$10.00--- An email thank you by the author of the “The New Business Brigade” for your support.

$50.00---A single shout out on Ubaldi Reports Twitter account.

$100.00—You and your company will be listed on contributor page on Ubaldi Reports, and a one-time shout out on Ubaldi Report’s podcast.

$500.00—You and your company will be mentioned on all Ubaldi Reports podcasts, listed on Ubaldi reports website, and receive a free signed copy of “The New Business Brigade”.

$1,000.00--- You and your company will be mentioned on all Ubaldi Reports podcasts for the next year, listed on Ubaldi Reports website, free signed copy of “The New Business Brigade” and one month advertisement on Ubaldi Reports webpage.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find it difficult to contribute, as I know with the state of the economy it may be hard to contribute, there are other ways that you can help out. Help us by spreading the word of Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms. Sign up for free on Ubaldi reports Podcast on I-tune and Stitcher, and leave a comment, this way both companies will provide free marketing. Tell your friends and everyone you know that Ubaldi Reports will be challenging Washington, all by a staff of military veterans and their dependents. Help us get Washington to answer your concerns!

We Can’t Do it Without You

We exist so that the American public can have a fact based site to gain information on global and international issues, to be able to make an informed decision of their own choosing. We never expected to be where we are, and the only way for Ubaldi Reports, and “The New Business Brigade” to grow to reach the business community is for your help in this funding campaign.

Veterans served in different capacities while in uniform, now America will watch what these men and woman can do for America back home; If you have not guessed by now our motto is “Just give them a chance and get out of their way!” They will transform this nation just like the returning veterans of World II.

Veterans are not looking for a handout, they just want a chance to succeed. Let’s give them that chance! With your help we can give them that chance!

story:
Short Summary

Left Out: Beyond the Two-Party Horse Race is a documentary that criticizes the media for its coverage of third-party political candidates. The film follows Luis J. Rodriguez, the best-selling author of "Always Running: La Vida Loca: Gang Days in LA", a memoir of his life as a Los Angeles gang member. It documents four months of his campaign trail in the 2014 primary election for Governor of California as a Green Party candidate. The documentary continues after the election, with interviews from experts such as Noam Chomsky, Amy Goodman and Ralph Nader. The story follows the filmmaker on a journey discovering American democracy.

The film is almost complete.  However, we need finishing funds to get this film to the public.  Our goal is to achieve theatrical release before airing on broadcast TV in time for the 2016 elections, followed by online and DVD release.  


What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $10,000 to get this film off the ground.  This will help pay for:  

Finishing Funds:
  • Editing - $700 (color correction, titles, audio mix)
  • Soundtrack - $2,000 (studio production of instruments)
  • Photo and Video Archive Copyrights - $5,000 (for borrowed footage)
  • Film Festivals - $900 (not including travel and accommodation costs.
  • Distribution and Advertising - $1,500 (building a buzz to grab the interest of buyers, agents, and distributors).
When you donate, you qualify for one of the many perks listed based on the amount of your pledge.  For example, Luis J. Rodriguez and Noam Chomsky both agreed to sign copies of their books to help raise funds. 

The Impact

Media coverage of third-party candidates serve to marginalize those seeking office outside of the two-party system.  In a free, open democracy it is vital that outside voices are given equal coverage.  By contributing to this film, you are helping to keep the debate fair so that important issues such as pollution, education costs, and mass incarceration don't get left out. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Producing a quality film on a shoestring budget is an almost impossible feat, fortunately the hard part is already done.  However, making the film is only half of the challenge.  Polishing and distributing the film require time and money.  If this film doesn't get properly released, all the hard work of over a year in production will be wasted.  To make this film a success, we need to find distribution by 2016.  All we need is enough money to make it happen. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about this important film. 

    • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing this campaign page on your social media.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
“A disgruntled 'ex-mobster wife' from New Jersey finds herself in the witness protection program. While cleaning up in Duluth, assisted by her sassy sidekick, she finds her 'nitch', which leads them back to the high life and to a new career... a little too close to home.”

                                                                   Killer Bees- the movie

                Greetings to our Family, Friends, and all who support Women Filmmakers.   We don’t have to tell you that there are not a lot of women making films out there, but with your donation there will be a few more female filmmakers. Yay!!!

Rebecca Busch and I are working on our second short film, “Killer Bees."  It’s a 15 minute short comedy and we are super-super excited.  We will be filming in mid-October 2015 at a donated beach house.  Rebecca and I wrote the screenplay.  We have an awesome group of talented women filmmakers (and a few fantastic men) on board to help us.  Our cast is so talented and funny!

But we need your help… Making movies is expensive, and we are frugal filmmakers.  We have begged, borrowed and bartered for this film but sometimes you just need cash.  We need monitors, batteries, hard drives, etc., not to mention food (Craft Services)-  Some folks are already donating pre-made dinners or groceries, and we thank you all from the bottom of our hearts!  We are feeding and accommodating hungry actors and filmmakers for four days.  Everyone is working for free so we want to make sure they are comfortable. We have costumes to buy and doo-dads to procure plus all the little bits and sundries.  You know, that all adds up!  Any donation will help and we would be so-so-so grateful. 

Our first short film, “Got No Fetish”, was a selection at the 2014 Cucalorus Film Festival and the 2015 Tupelo Film Festival.   Attending Cucalorus here in Wilmington was awesome but when it came to attending Tupelo well, money (because we didn’t budget  for festivals) was ummm, low.   “Killer Bees” will be entered in quite a few festivals and your donations will help us with fees (they can get pretty expensive) accommodations, and travel.  

So please help us and donate to support the CAST and CREW of “Killer Bees" the movie.

Support Female Filmmakers!!!!!

Thank you from the bottom of our female filmmakers' hearts. :)

Monika Winters-Sanchez

-----------------------------------------------------------

  • OUR TALENTED KILLER BEES-CAST...
  • Heather Shore as Trixie, 
  • Belisa Lea as Mona, 
  • Michael Cercone as Matt,
  • Anna French as Karen    
  • AND CREW! 
  • Rebecca Busch- Director/Screenwriter/Wardrobe
  • Monika Winters-Sanchez- Screenwriter/ Accommodations/ Set Design/ House    Mom/ Social Media
  • Becca Ederer- Producer/Assistant Director
  • Haley Rae– Producer/ Craft Services/ Accounting
  • Babette Siobhan- D.P./ Cinematographer
  • Robert Chase- B Camera
  • Jeff Sanchez- Sound/ Editor
  • Jamar Allen- Sound
  • Wesley (Smiles) Miles- Lighting
  • Riley O'Dell- Script Supervisor
  • Valerie Fann- Production Designer/ Set Decorator
  • Pamela Russell Hunt- MUA Hair/ Makeup
  • Chloe Tallman-MUA Assistant
  • Shiloh Turek- PA
  • Lucy Keller- PA
  • Elizabeth (Libby) Rakes- Assistant to Director
  • Rebecca Firth
  • Leah Rae Kmosko
  • Carli Lind

story:
Help us create a unique work of ballet

Become a founding member of Crystal Ballet and put your name on the credits of the ballet film you help to fund.  You can also choose from a money-can’t-buy selection of perks.

Crystal Ballet exists to provide an immersive digital and live experience for everyone who loves ballet and dance. We launched our pioneering website at the end of August 2015, to a very enthusiastic response from both ballet fans and the media. 

We’ve been described as ‘Netflix for ballet’, as subscribers are free to stream unique works of ballet from our site, no matter where they are in the world. These full-length works star top dancers such as Alina Cojocaru and Steven McRae, and have been filmed and choreographed to optimise the small screen viewing experience.

Be part of the next chapter in digital dance

Although we are extremely proud of everything we have already achieved, we don’t want to rest on our laurels. We also have a practical problem: because we only use the world’s best dancers, choreographers and filmmakers, we have a limited time window in which everyone is available to create our next work. 

As such, we need your help, and we’re creating an exclusive group of Crystal Ballet founding members for those who are generous enough to help us quickly make our next film. As well as putting your names on the credits, we’re also giving you the chance to access a range of unique perks that allow you to get closer than ever to the world of ballet. Want to have dinner with a professional ballerina, arrange a private performance for your friends, or think your coffee table looks empty without a pair of used ballet shoes? Simply select from the options to the right.

What you’ll be funding

Our next film will be choreographed by the charismatic and talented Will Tuckett, who is currently Guest Principal Character Artist of The Royal Ballet. He will be creating a mesmerising new work themed around poetry, fusing dance and words in a lyrical work that highlights the beauty and power of both worlds.

To ensure his creation can be brought to life, and brought to the world through our digital ballet portal, we need £30,000 to cover the following:

  • Studio hire for rehearsals
  • Studio hire for filming
  • Camera hire
  • Staffing costs
  • Dancer fees
  • Post production fees
  • Art and costume fees
  • Actor fees
  • Recording studio fees

Filming will commence as soon as we have funds, and we’ll keep all of our donors updated on our progress. Furthermore, if you choose 300 Club level or above, you’ll be invited to an exclusive thank you evening, as well as future 300 Club and Crystal Ballet founders events. To find out more about the 300 Club, visit crystalballet.com

You’ll also be helping us inspire a new generation

Did you know that ballet, like music, isn’t part of the UK curriculum?

As you might have guessed, we love ballet and want as many people as possible to share our passion. We know that schools don’t have the budget to teach ballet – either physical tuition or a critical framework for viewing the dance – and therefore want to help where we can. 

To ensure schoolchildren have the chance to watch ballet, we will be creating an outreach programme that gives all schools an opportunity to screen one of our films. To get started, we will be reserving 10% of your funding for contacting schools and subsidising the offer.
story_txt:
Help us create a unique work of balletBecome a founding member of Crystal Ballet and put your name on the credits of the ballet film you help to fund.  You can also choose from a money-can’t-buy selection of perks.Crystal Ballet exists to provide an immersive digital and live experience for everyone who loves ballet and dance. We launched our pioneering website at the end of August 2015, to a very enthusiastic response from both ballet fans and the media. We’ve been described as ‘Netflix for ballet’, as subscribers are free to stream unique works of ballet from our site, no matter where they are in the world. These full-length works star top dancers such as Alina Cojocaru and Steven McRae, and have been filmed and choreographed to optimise the small screen viewing experience. Be part of the next chapter in digital danceAlthough we are extremely proud of everything we have already achieved, we don’t want to rest on our laurels. We also have a practical problem: because we only use the world’s best dancers, choreographers and filmmakers, we have a limited time window in which everyone is available to create our next work.  As such, we need your help, and we’re creating an exclusive group of Crystal Ballet founding members for those who are generous enough to help us quickly make our next film. As well as putting your names on the credits, we’re also giving you the chance to access a range of unique perks that allow you to get closer than ever to the world of ballet. Want to have dinner with a professional ballerina, arrange a private performance for your friends, or think your coffee table looks empty without a pair of used ballet shoes? Simply select from the options to the right. What you’ll be fundingOur next film will be choreographed by the charismatic and talented Will Tuckett, who is currently Guest Principal Character Artist of The Royal Ballet. He will be creating a mesmerising new work themed around poetry, fusing dance and words in a lyrical work that highlights the beauty and power of both worlds.To ensure his creation can be brought to life, and brought to the world through our digital ballet portal, we need £30,000 to cover the following:

Studio hire for rehearsals


Studio hire for filming


Camera hire


Staffing costs


Dancer fees


Post production fees


Art and costume fees


Actor fees


Recording studio fees

Filming will commence as soon as we have funds, and we’ll keep all of our donors updated on our progress. Furthermore, if you choose 300 Club level or above, you’ll be invited to an exclusive thank you evening, as well as future 300 Club and Crystal Ballet founders events. To find out more about the 300 Club, visit crystalballet.comYou’ll also be helping us inspire a new generationDid you know that ballet, like music, isn’t part of the UK curriculum? To get started, we will be reserving 10% of your funding for contacting schools and subsidising the offer.

story:
Hello Wildlife lovers!

I'm Jungle Jane and I want to bring the wild to you! After years of volunteering on wildlife conservation projects and studying animal behavior, I began my career as a wildlife educator in Southern California. Traveling with animals to schools and events to educate, entertain and enlighten children and adults has been profoundly rewarding, but I'm ready to reach a bigger audience! Through exciting web videos I'm going to take viewers on wild adventures to meet amazing animals from around the world! I want to make education entertaining, conservation cool, and science sensational! While we have an awesome first video already in the works, and a small but growing crew of amazing individuals, we still need better equipment, a bigger crew, and food and shelter for the humans and other animals that are working so hard to make 'Wild World' happen. So help us make it happen! 

If we reach our modest goal of $20,000 we will be able to purchase the necessary camera, lighting and sound equipment, and compensate our crew so we can keep making magic! Even better, if we reach our goal, 5% of all contributions will go directly to wildlife conservation. If you contribute, not only will you be funding a project dedicated to educating the world about our amazing wildlife, but you will be donating to wildlife in need! 


As a special thank you, if you contribute $25 or more you will receive an art print or magnet featuring one of three unique wildlife themed designs, and if you contribute $100 or more you will also receive a t-shirt with the design of your choice! 


All contributors will be able to say that they are part of a project that makes education fun, science accessible, and conservation a common practice. Educational programming is waning, and children and adults NEED a show that amazes them and ignites curiosity about science and our natural world. Jungle Jane's 'Wild World' is the answer! Influenced by the likes of  Bill Nye, Jeff Corwin, Jane Goodall, and Neil deGrasse Tyson, I'm ready to follow in their massive footsteps and encourage the next great generation of scientists. Let's do this together!


If you are unable to contribute financially, you can still contribute immensely by sharing and spreading the word. For exciting animals, cool facts, and updates follow junglejane_official on instagram, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to bring more attention to the campaign. Thanks! Gracias! Danke! Arigato!

story:
Project 

As an Army veteran myself, this story is very near and dear to my heart. Many veterans, myself included, experience unique challenges and difficulties when making the transition back to civilian-life. This phase in a veteran's life can be very emotional and physically stressing - not only for the veteran but this transition may also have a significant impact on family and friends of the veteran. 

I believe that telling this story can assist veterans' and their families as it touches upon sensitive issues that many face and must deal with in order to make a successful transition back to being a civilian.  

It is my hopes that all audience members who see this short-film, despite their background, will enjoy this dramatic story and experience a genuine emotional response - laughter, sadness, anger, inspiration, hope... and for some to realize that you too have shared such experiences with the characters and you know personally what they are going through.    
                                                                                                -- David Melendez, Director              
                
Story

Wounded  centers on David, a recently retired veteran that is struggling with his transition back to civilian-life. After serving 20 years in the Army, David is having difficulty finding his place in society. Struggling to cope with a divorce, separation from the military and still haunted by a past experience David believes he is at the end of his rope. 

Clouded by depression and anxiety, David believes he is unable to function as a civilian and as a person. During his darkest time, life introduces Gwen, a fellow veteran who also has recently separated from the military. Gwen despite significant problems of her own attempts to befriend David. Gwen has genuine concerns that David is near his end but she also sees this as an opportunity to neglect her own  immediate troubling issues.

Will this unexpected friendship between these two wounded souls aid in the the healing process or will it ultimately add to each owns' suffering?


Filmmakers






Cast




What is Needed 

Like in any independent endeavor, a significant element is financial support. All financial backing we gain will go directly towards  the development, marketing and distribution of the film Wounded - no matter how much we raise 100% will go towards the film, so if you see that we've reached our goal and you still want to contribute, please do so. Every contribution counts!

  • Locations: Insurance, fees
  • Meals & Craft Services
  • Marketing
  • Film Festivals 
  • Set Design 
  • Transportation
  • Wardrobe
  • Make-up
  • Equipment rentals 
Please help us tell this story. 

Perks!

We have a passion for the filmmaking experience and we love sharing that experience! Most of the Perks are related to YOU being directly part of the project and sharing the filmmaking experience! Perks from your name being in the film credits, visiting us on location, all the way to becoming an Executive Producer of the film!

Have you ever wanted to be in a film and play a soldier, war veteran, college professor, college student, a stoner or even a prostitute!? Well now is your chance! A couple of Perks will grant you either non-speaking or speaking roles in Wounded!              

Help and Support 

Now we understand not everyone can contribute financially, so if you can share the campaign on your Facebook, or Twitter, or shout it from an open window, that would be amazing! You can also help by Liking Wounded's Facebook Page! Thank you.

story:
Sponsor the supernatural  thriller feature film “The Lake”, featuring Jonathan Lipnicki (you may know him from Jerry MaGuire) and YOU will be supporting local Denver writers, actors, director, and crew.  The cast and crew of over 75 get to make you an awesome movie and you get thrilling rewards!

What will we use your hard earned bucks for?  Special effects to appease your senses and get your heart pumping , a surprise cameo actor, to pay the actors in the film, sound, a creepy 16th century Romanian scene to introduce the film,  and to recover some of the cost that has already been spent on production.

What is the future of "The Lake"? With your support and the completion of the film , world wide distribution is the end goal!

story:
Short Summary

100 Litres isn’t just a movie, it’s a movement. This PBS documentary is a story about how we all depend on water and how people can unite to protect this human right -- worldwide -- and ensure reliable, affordable drinking water.  Ireland is a recent example of companies trying to privatize water, but instead of lying down, citizens are standing up in a national social change movement.

Help us bring global awareness to this issue and show others how to protect their human rights to create a better world.


100 Litres: Why the name?

The United Nations General Assembly of the Human Right to Water and Sanitation has recognized that every human being should have access to 50 - 100 litres of clean water, every day, for personal and domestic uses. When Ireland's government decided to ignore that families have already paid for their water through taxation and charged them twice for any water used, they unwittingly ignited a water revolution that has ricocheted around the country.

This boils down to Irish citizens are being charged 10X more for water than the average American.


Why you should care

This could happen to you. Water is being privatized all over the globe. If people stand by and let this happen, then this financial grab for precious resources will become commonplace.

The people of Ireland are standing up for their Right2Water and are establishing a lasting model for others to learn from. The major catch here? Due to government and corporate corruption, there aren’t any Irish media outlets that are brave enough to cover this social change movement and Irish citizens have been relying on social media to spread the good word. The 100 Litres crew believes that these citizens deserve a global voice.

The Synopsis

100 Litres is a full-length PBS documentary about water privatization in Ireland and the human rights movement being led by Irish citizens. While Irish citizens have paid for their water through taxes, the Irish government have added new fees to their water usage. This is the equivalent of you buying a sandwich and the store clerk following you home to ask for ten times more than what you already paid.

Community organizations, political parties, and trade unions have joined together in a National human rights movement that's hundreds of thousands strong. Using peaceful protests and a human rights manifesto, Right2Water Ireland is taking on a corrupt government, corporations that are taking advantage of loopholes, and EU banks in a fight for the human right to water. This is a national revolution and no one is talking about it.

100 Litres is a story of successful social change. We want to provide everyone with living examples of how activism can overcome bad government policies. This documentary will also expand outside of Ireland’s borders, shining light on the solidarity movement happening in Greece, the empowering work that’s being done by the Community Environmental Legal Defense Fund (CELDF) in the U.S., and a trip to meet with the Detroit Water Brigade.

All of these stories are about people fighting for their human rights and we want to share them with you. Will you join the movement?


(photo via: Right2Water Ireland)

What We Need & What You Get

We have our crew, we have our contacts, we did our research. All we need is the financing for the travel and production costs.
  • The budget for 100 Litres is actually $30,000
  • The $15,000 raised on here will help us get things started as far as production, travel, and gear. This may not cover the whole budget, but it can at least get the ball rolling and get our crew to Ireland to start filming before it's too late and we need to scrap the project.
  • We have all sorts of perks for donating available. Our goal with this Indiegogo isn't only to raise funds, we also want to connect the audience with these change-makers. Take a look at our Perks to find out how you can feel like part of the project (and learn a little Gaelic in the process).
Donation Options:
100 Litres has been backed by PBS. This means we have nonprofit status and the option for tax deductible donations is available. For those who are interested in using this avenue to contribute to the film, please contact the crew directly at info@100litresfilm.com and we will follow-up with instructions for donating through PBS.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we do need to raise funds for paying the crew and for food, there are other ways to contribute. If you can't donate, the second best thing you can do to support this project is share our Indiegogo. We are also looking for in-kind donations. To find out more, please visit 100LitresFilm.com or watch the video from our producers below:



The Impact

100 Litres isn't just a movie. It's a movement.
We all depend on water, and in a warming world, billions may lose reliable access to this precious resource. This is the story of global water warriors united in a worldwide campaign to protect human access to reliable, affordable drinking water. From politically-motivated water charges in Ireland, to fracking in Ohio, from solidarity rallies in Greece, to water shutoffs in bankrupt Detroit, 100 Litres is a story of social change and how street activism works outside of the realm of traditional politics.

At the moment, the Right2Water Ireland human rights campaign is a grassroots movement, but we want this film to make it more than that – we want to bring Right2Water Ireland’s stories, struggles, and proactive strategies to the world. People all over the planet are being oppressed by greed, corporate interest, and scarcity of resources. We believe that the actions of Right2Water Ireland, combined with the solidarity movement happening in Greece, and the work of the Detroit Water Brigade all offer positive models of social change that a mass audience can relate to and use.

We believe this documentary could be the critical mass that many people who are living with oppression need. Are you looking to start a revolution? Are you sick of "the greedy few" slowly destroying our only home and all the resources it needs to sustain life? Our planet and it's resources are not just commodities to be bought and sold. The working class should no longer have to carry the burden of the irresponsible decisions made by those who have the best financial portfolios. It's time to stand. It's time to shout. 100 Litres will provide the stories, experiences, and failures of others to help every global citizen learn from their actions and find the solutions they need change our world for the better.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is making sure that the masses are aware of what’s happening and unite together to support the making of this project. We need the funding in time for the human rights, Town Hall Tour that will kick off in mid-September. If we don't reach our production goal, we'll have to scrap the project.

More in-depth information

100 Litres is a full-length documentary about water privatization in Ireland and the human rights movement being led by Irish citizens.
 
While Irish citizens have paid for their water through taxes, the Irish government have added new fees to their water usage. Currently, they are charging each Irish household twice for their water through taxes and direct charges.

With these additional costs, whispers of scandal have also been echoing throughout the country. Money that was supposed to go towards Ireland’s decaying water infrastructure is unaccounted for, tax dollars from citizens seem to have disappeared, and Irish Water, the company that now manages Ireland’s water infrastructure, has already come under fire for profligate spending of taxpayer money.

Using the human right to water, the Irish have mobilized in a new revolution to stop the endless austerity measures their country has been enduring since the EU bailout. Community organizations, trade unions, and political parties have united to establish the Policy Principles for a Progressive Irish Government (a human rights manifesto). This document addresses 10 human rights claims, including water. The proposal was released to every Irish citizen to amend and will now be the platform of a coming Town Hall Tour in September 2015.

100 Litres is a story of social change and will provide living examples of how activism can work outside of politics. The human rights manifesto hitting the streets of Ireland next month will provide a lasting story of how people can work together to overcome injustice. This documentary will also expand outside of Ireland’s borders, shining light on the solidarity movement happening in Greece, the empowering work that’s being done by the Community Environmental Legal Defense Fund (CELDF) in the U.S., and a trip to meet with the Detroit Water Brigade (whose members have helped in Ireland's fight against privatizing this precious resource).

With media blackouts and corruption in Ireland seeming to be on the rise, 100 Litres helps give these activists a conduit to share their story and provides a model of how positive activism can be implemented locally and globally. Made of some of the toughest sinew and bone, with strong currents of blood running through their veins, the people of Ireland deserve a voice. Let’s tell their stories and chant with them “water is a human right,” a human right that will not be taken away from the Irish.

The Crew

DR. PHIL HOFFMAN - Executive Producer: Phil is a documentary Producer and General Manager with PBS KMOS station outside of Kansas City, Missouri. He has won multiple Emmy awards for his work on his documentaries Turn Blue: The Short Life of Ghoulardi, Hammer on Steel, and more. Phil is a former News Anchor for Akron’s ABC affiliate, professor for the School of Communications at The University of Akron, and General Manager of The University of Akron’s “ZTV” program.


KATIE YOUNG – Producer / Director: Journalist and independent filmmaker, Katie Young, produced the international award-winning documentary, The Graceful Descent. While she covers stories that effect the environment and human rights, she also builds her life around these convictions. She's an organic gardener, food activist, founder of Edible Kent, and the visionary of Young Blood Productions.

KARA MARTINELLI – Associate Producer: Kara has produced the Emmy award-winning aviation documentary titled The Restorers – They Were All Volunteers, Beyond the Powder: The Legacy of the First Women’s Cross-Country Air Race, a documentary for the Texas Flying Legends Museum, and the short historical aviation film, Rise Above, for the CAF Red Tail Squadron’s traveling exhibit.

She has returned to Cleveland from New York City, where she had worked as a Producer creating spots for Food Network, USA, and Touchstone Energy. Her experience also includes various production work with Comedy Central, HBO, A&E, E!, NBC, Bravo, ESPN, PBS Thirteen, and TBS.

ADAM WHITE – Cinematographer: Adam, a graduate of the film program from Wright State University, has won multiple regional Emmy awards for his films The Restorers, Red Tail Reborn, and The Restorers: They Were All Volunteers, and an Emmy for cinematography for the PBS documentary Generations: Cuyahoga Valley National Park. Adam and his company Hemlock Films received the rare “Special Achievement” award from the International Council of Airshows in 2011 for his film Rise Above.

With over 20 years of experience, Adam has worked on most every type of media in various roles. The majority of his time is spent working as a director/cinematographer with a specialty in SteadiCam working on big budget Hollywood films, TV movies, award winning documentaries, and commercials.

ROB NETHERTON - Editor / Animator: Rob edited, animated, and designed the packaging for the award-winning documentary The Graceful Descent. Database guru, programmer, and artist, Rob is blessed with artistic talent and the analytical skills to give films a cohesive look, and to add their final touches.


Young Blood Productions Company Profile:

Young Blood Productions is the brainchild of Katie Young. This award-winning production company was started in a living room in Akron, Ohio. Our production company maintains a reputation of producing unconventional films that bring environmental, social, and political issues to an international audience.

We believe that the actions of Right2Water Ireland, combined with the solidarity movement happening in Greece, and the work of the Detroit Water Brigade all offer positive models of social change that a mass audience can relate to and use. We believe this documentary could be the critical mass that many people who are living with oppression need. Are you looking to start a revolution? Are you sick of "the greedy few" slowly destroying our only home and all the resources it needs to sustain life? Our planet and it's resources are not just commodities to be bought and sold. The working class should no longer have to carry the burden of the irresponsible decisions made by those who have the best financial portfolios. It's time to stand. It's time to shout. 100 Litres will provide the stories, experiences, and failures of others to help every global citizen learn from their actions and find the solutions they need change our world for the better.Risks & Challenges Our biggest challenge is making sure that the masses are aware of what’s happening and unite together to support the making of this project. We need the funding in time for the human rights, Town Hall Tour that will kick off in mid-September. If we don't reach our production goal, we'll have to scrap the project. More in-depth information
100 Litres is a full-length documentary about water privatization in Ireland and the human rights movement being led by Irish citizens. While Irish citizens have paid for their water through taxes, the Irish government have added new fees to their water usage. Currently, they are charging each Irish household twice for their water through taxes and direct charges.With these additional costs, whispers of scandal have also been echoing throughout the country. Money that was supposed to go towards Ireland’s decaying water infrastructure is unaccounted for, tax dollars from citizens seem to have disappeared, and Irish Water, the company that now manages Ireland’s water infrastructure, has already come under fire for profligate spending of taxpayer money.Using the human right to water, the Irish have mobilized in a new revolution to stop the endless austerity measures their country has been enduring since the EU bailout. Community organizations, trade unions, and political parties have united to establish the Policy Principles for a Progressive Irish Government (a human rights manifesto). This document addresses 10 human rights claims, including water. The proposal was released to every Irish citizen to amend and will now be the platform of a coming Town Hall Tour in September 2015.100 Litres is a story of social change and will provide living examples of how activism can work outside of politics. The human rights manifesto hitting the streets of Ireland next month will provide a lasting story of how people can work together to overcome injustice. This documentary will also expand outside of Ireland’s borders, shining light on the solidarity movement happening in Greece, the empowering work that’s being done by the Community Environmental Legal Defense Fund (CELDF) in the U.S., and a trip to meet with the Detroit Water Brigade (whose members have helped in Ireland's fight against privatizing this precious resource).With media blackouts and corruption in Ireland seeming to be on the rise, 100 Litres helps give these activists a conduit to share their story and provides a model of how positive activism can be implemented locally and globally. Made of some of the toughest sinew and bone, with strong currents of blood running through their veins, the people of Ireland deserve a voice. Let’s tell their stories and chant with them “water is a human right,” a human right that will not be taken away from the Irish.


The Crew
DR. PHIL HOFFMAN - Executive Producer: Phil is a documentary Producer and General Manager with PBS KMOS station outside of Kansas City, Missouri. He has won multiple Emmy awards for his work on his documentaries Turn Blue: The Short Life of Ghoulardi, Hammer on Steel,
 and more. Phil is a former News Anchor for Akron’s ABC affiliate, 
professor for the School of Communications at The University of Akron, 
and General Manager of The University of Akron’s “ZTV” program.KATIE YOUNG – Producer / Director: Journalist and independent filmmaker, Katie Young, produced the international award-winning documentary, The Graceful Descent.
 While she covers stories that effect the environment and human rights, 
she also builds her life around these convictions. She's an organic 
gardener, food activist, founder of Edible Kent, and the visionary of Young Blood Productions.KARA MARTINELLI – Associate Producer: Kara has produced the Emmy award-winning aviation documentary titled The Restorers – They Were All Volunteers, Beyond the Powder: The Legacy of the First Women’s Cross-Country Air Race,
 a documentary for the Texas Flying Legends Museum, and the short 
historical aviation film, Rise Above, for the CAF Red Tail Squadron’s 
traveling exhibit.She has returned to Cleveland from New York 
City, where she had worked as a Producer creating spots for Food 
Network, USA, and Touchstone Energy. Her experience also includes 
various production work with Comedy Central, HBO, A&E, E!, NBC, 
Bravo, ESPN, PBS Thirteen, and TBS.ADAM WHITE – Cinematographer: Adam, a graduate of the film program from Wright State University, has won multiple regional Emmy awards for his films The Restorers, Red Tail Reborn,
 and The Restorers: They Were All Volunteers, and an Emmy for 
cinematography for the PBS documentary Generations: Cuyahoga Valley 
National Park. Adam and his company Hemlock Films received the rare “Special Achievement” award from the International Council of Airshows in 2011 for his film Rise Above.With
 over 20 years of experience, Adam has worked on most every type of 
media in various roles. The majority of his time is spent working as a director/cinematographer with a specialty in SteadiCam working on big 
budget Hollywood films, TV movies, award winning documentaries, and 
commercials.ROB NETHERTON - Editor / Animator: Rob edited, animated, and designed the packaging for the award-winning documentary The Graceful Descent.
 Database guru, programmer, and artist, Rob is blessed with artistic 
talent and the analytical skills to give films a cohesive look, and to 
add their final touches.



Young Blood Productions Company Profile:
Young Blood Productions
 is the brainchild of Katie Young. This award-winning production company
 was started in a living room in Akron, Ohio. Our production company 
maintains a reputation of producing unconventional films that bring 
environmental, social, and political issues to an international 
audience.

story:
A short horror film, Written and Directed by Thirati K.

Let’s get to know each other!  :) 

My name is Thirati, but you can call me Tee! I am a U.S.-based special effects makeup artist and have been working in the entertainment industry for the past 4 years. I started my career in Thailand as a commercial actor at the age of 14 and am thankful to be able to say that I’ve had a successful career in the entertainment industry for more than a decade. I attended SrinakarinvirotePrasanmit (SWU) in Bangkok, Thailand and majored in Fine Art of Directing and Acting. This is where I first learned that I had an interest in Directing.

My love of cinema, specifically the horror genre, lead me to the Cinema Makeup School in Los Angeles where I learned the craft of makeup and special effects. After graduation, I interned with Emmy Award winner Dean Jones, who started out as a makeup artist (just like me) and went on to write, direct and produce his own horror films. This was an inspiration for me to do the same, but I also knew I needed to learn more. To do so, I joined the prestigious team at the Makeup Effects Laboratory(MEL), working under the mentorship of Academy Award winning makeup artist, Kevin Haney. While at MEL, I really honed my craft as a special effects makeup artist, learning the tricks-of-the-trade, complete with how camera angles effect the look of make-up on an actor.

After years of acting, working in makeup and special effects, and learning about all the craft of production, I am now ready to put it all together in my own film; similar to many before me. This film will be submitted to film festivals across the U.S. with the goal of developing it into a feature film in the future.

However, to make all this reality, I need your help.


"I love horror films, and my goal is to make a horror film that not only keeps you on the edge and jumping out of your seat, but to also have a strong storyline that enriches your own life." 





Imagine when it gets dark...!!



     

     



  

 •  Produce a horror film that the avid horror fan can appreciate and enjoy.

 •  Showcase the film in well-known horror and indie film festivals.


 

• August - September : Pre - Production

• October 17 - 21 : Production.

• November – December, 2015 : Post - Production.

• January 2016 : Festival Submissions.


Your contribution is appreciated and our team is deeply thankful for your support in helping us make this film!



Tell your friends about our campaign, and help us spread the word!


THANK YOU 

(^_________^)

story:
"KrausFunding" - Ein Update für KrauseLocke!

Wir sind Barbara und Esther, die Gründerinnen von KrauseLocke.de – ein multikulturelles Onlinemagazin, das wir 2011 ins Leben riefen.

Als Afrodeutsche waren wir selbst jahrelang vergeblich auf der Suche nach einer Plattform mit Beiträgen  über unsere Identität und den Umgang mit unseren krausen Haaren. Im vorherrschenden Schönheitsideal sind wir unterrepräsentiert. Als Begründung heißt es oft, unser Markt sei zu klein. Das wollten wir ändern, haben uns 2011 zusammengesetzt, KrauseLocke.de gegründet - und hier sind wir! Mittlerweile begleiten wir unsere Leser fast vier Jahre lang, haben eine ganze krause Bewegung ins Rollen gebracht und freuen uns über das positive Feedback zu unseren Inhalten.

KrauseLocke richtet sich an Menschen mit krausen Köpfen und an Menschen mit krausen Gedanken (Letztere hat jeder Mensch!). Unsere Devise lautet: egal, wie verschieden wir alle sein mögen - wir verstehen uns.  Wir treten ein für die Gleichheit aller - ungeachtet der Haarstruktur, Hautfarbe, Herkunft oder Körbchengröße. Neben Beiträgen rund um Locken, krause Haare und Kosmetik ist es uns wichtig, das Selbstbewusstsein unserer Follower zu stärken und immer wieder neue, positive Denkansätze zu schaffen.

Warum Crowdfunding?

Wir schreiben das Jahr 2015 und unsere Webseite platzt aus allen Nähten. Über 350 Beiträge, Fotos und Videos liegen in einem ziemlich veralteten, unmodernen Blog, der viele der Inhalte verschluckt und dessen Bedienung modernen Anforderungen nicht mehr entspricht. Das macht doch kaum noch Spaß!

Mit einer neu gestalteten Webseite, wollen wir uns Krauselocken eine Plattform bieten, die sich sehen lassen kann! Eine Plattform, die stolz präsentiert, dass es uns gibt, wir uns vernetzen und für unsere Bedürfnisse einstehen. Die bestmögliche Präsenz für die Krauselocken von heute: KrauseLocke 2.0! 


Auf der neuen Webseite werden Dich noch mehr krause Inhalte erwarten! Mehr Haartipps, mehr Portraits und Interviews, mehr Videos – ein rundherum krauses Programm, das Du jederzeit zu Deinen Wünschen mitgestalten darfst.

Um das zu erzielen arbeiten wir mit einem Webdesigner zusammen, der von der Idee begeistert ist. Der Clou an der Sache: Er stellt uns gleich zwei potentielle neue Designs zur Verfügung – und DU kannst darüber abstimmen, welches Design am Ende umgesetzt wird!

VARIANTE A:

VARIANTE B:

(Zur Umfrage geht's hier)


Was noch?

Esther arbeitet an einem deutschsprachigen KrauseLocke-Buch. Denn seien wir mal ehrlich: so hilfreich die Tipps aus dem Netz auch sind – in der Praxis ist es manchmal doch ganz schön schwierig, den Laptop und ein Tablet mit ins Badezimmer zu nehmen, wenn man die neueste, selbstgemachte Haarkur ausprobieren möchte. Ein Buch geht nicht so schnell kaputt, wenn es Wasserspritzer oder Conditioner abbekommt. Bei einem Buch hast du was in der Hand.

Last but not least wollen wir Feste feiern! Krause-Events und Treffen bei denen du andere Krauselocken und uns kennenlernen und dich vernetzen kannst. Nach unserem ersten offiziellen KrauseLocke-Treffen im November 2013 in Köln, ist eure Nachfrage nach weiteren offiziellen Treffen (auch in anderen deutschen Städten) groß. Bei erfolgreichem „KrausFunding“ wartet im kommenden Jahr also auch mindestens ein großes und offizielles„Krause-Treffen“ auf DICH!!!

Hilf mit!

Wir würden uns sehr über Deine Unterstützung freuen, wenn du KrauseLocke kennst und wir dir mit unseren Inhalten bestenfalls schon einmal weiterhelfen konnten. Wir würden uns auch freuen, wenn wir es geschafft haben dir ein Lächeln auf die Lippen zu zaubern, du von unserer Idee überzeugt bist und einfach ein krauser Mensch bist.

Kein PayPal?! Kein Problem!

Überweise uns deine Spende gerne auch ohne PayPal an


Deutsche Kreditbank
Esther Donkor
IBAN: DE12120300001014794711
BIC: BYLADEM 1001

story:
Short Summary

Hello my name is Chris Gonzalez and enjoy working along side others who share the same vision as mine.
This campaign is for a short film called A Glimpse of Hell. Its about a 19 year old boy named Aaron who faces the struggling decision of being a father at an early age. Aaron gets a glimpse of hell that shakes his life.
This film is important because it allows you to get a sense of hell. We all come to a time when we are faced to make decision that drives us crazy what if that decision is right in front of you.
What We Need & What You Get 
In order for this film to get made we need to meet the goal of $5000. With this amount we are able to pay for the whole cost of the film. 
This film is about Hell we want to make it look real, not crappy. A rough $3000 is for the production design alone. The other $2000 is for  wardrobe, sound, and distribution of the film.
If you give right now you will be on the list for perks that are enjoyable.
If we don't reach the entire goal of this campaign it will mostly go to the production design and sound of the film. 

The Impact

If we reach the goal on this campaign horror fans will be able to see something they never seen before. Every contributor on this campaign will be appreciated from our crew. 
People will be able to have a sense of what Hell may look like. Isn't that interesting? Im sure people you are interested in knowing more about hell. You can be a part of our story in making this happen. 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risks and challenges that come to mind as a writer and director of this film is that there are many people that have different views on hell and I hope to satisfy everyone's view.

My inspiration (writer/director) and view on hell comes from biblical passages that have engaged my creativity to create an original story with elements of truth that I perceive. I feel that my faith,dedication, and passion will be driving forces to make this film. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help we understand. But please help us spread the word out by sharing this campaign and hashtag  #aglimpseofhellmovie

Also if you believe in hell and believe in prayer as the director and writer I ask that you pray for this film and everyone working on it.

Thank you and Blessings,

Chris Gonzalez

Writer and Director 

A Glimpse of Hell

story: Am Ndombellah Sikwattah, from Kenya.i recently pitched my idea to start a development center for people with autism at a UNDP innovation pitch and it won. i studied special needs education in campus and i have agreat passion for people with disabilities. i came across Ryan, 13 years old, whose parents have kept behind locked doors for 10 years. in this community, autism is considered a curse, misfortune and a shame to the community and family. it compelled me to start a development cenrtre for such people where we can teach them basic math, english and ADLs. in addition, we can teach them vocational skills like drawing, beading, weaving, molding and sewing. these skills can eventually earn them a basic salary , we intend to sell their products on open days and exhibitions. this will earn them respect and a place in the society. We can save them!!
