story:
Fadeaway movie

  • Humanitarian Award-winning writer/director Ron Leach brings his experience and vision to an original story by Sima Seperhi to create Fadeaway. A lustrous vision of a relationship in crisis. 
  • Producer Ashleigh Rains and cinematographer Henry Sansom join forces with actors Justin Tensen and Scott Cavalheiro to bring an all-star team of artists to realize this vision of gender identification; relationship and machismo to the screen.
  • We need your help to realize the ambitious vision of Fadeaway.  
  • Fadeaway chronicles a relationship in crisis, as Jamie and Pavo struggle to cope with Jamie's intention to fully transition from man to woman. Her resolve threatens to destroy their loving relationship, and plunges Pavo into questions about his own identity and closeted lifestyle and values. Set against the backdrop of the hyper machismo world of inner-city basketball and rarified environment of sport, bromance and romance. 
  • Fadeaway intends to share it's heartbreaking intimacy and exuberant athleticism to tell a human story of a man in transition and the world evolving around him.
story_txt:
Fadeaway movie 
Humanitarian Award-winning writer/director Ron Leach brings his experience and vision to an original story by Sima Seperhi to create Fadeaway. A lustrous vision of a relationship in crisis. 
Producer Ashleigh Rains and cinematographer Henry Sansom join forces with actors Justin Tensen and Scott Cavalheiro to bring an all-star team of artists to realize this vision of gender identification; relationship and machismo to the screen. We need your help to realize the ambitious vision of Fadeaway.   Fadeaway chronicles a relationship in crisis, as Jamie and Pavo struggle to cope with Jamie's intention to fully transition from man to woman. Her resolve threatens to destroy their loving relationship, and plunges Pavo into questions about his own identity and closeted lifestyle and values. Set against the backdrop of the hyper machismo world of inner-city basketball and rarified environment of sport, bromance and romance. 
Fadeaway intends to share it's heartbreaking intimacy and exuberant athleticism to tell a human story of a man in transition and the world evolving around him.

story:
Short Summary

Introduction

The music industry has changed, in the modern internet age, playing live is no longer just a marketing expense to promote a new album. Recordings are freely downloaded (legally or otherwise) and more and more musicians are earning their wage playing gigs, giving rise to the never ending tour that has become the norm for many established artists.

Small intimate gigs – the smaller the better –  have always been a rare, sought after experience. In recent years a new phenomenon has emerged: housegigs are popping up across the UK. No longer do you need to travel to a large venue to see your favourite singer perform, you can get them to come to you.

Can you imagine that? Your favourite musician pulling up outside your house, walking up your path, guitar slung over shoulder, setting up in the corner of your living room?


How would that work? Who attends house gigs? Who puts them on? Who plays them?

We want to find out what it is that makes house gigs so special and why they are becoming more and more popular.

We asked established housegig performers Henry Priestman (over 40 housegigs in the past 18 months) and his guitarist and compadre, Loved Up Les, if we could follow them around the house gig circuit, meeting established promoters as well as first timers and find out what is it that makes house gigs so good.

Who's Involved?

Henry Priestman

After over 35 years in the music business – and with a credit list longer than both your arms – in 2009 Henry Priestman reinvented himself as a singer-songwriter, and released his debut solo CD “The Chronicles of Modern Life” to critical acclaim. Followed by “The last Mad Surge of Youth” in 2014 and the live DVD “Settle Down” in 2015.


He’s sold millions of records, performed in stadiums around the world to tens of thousands of people and was a regular fixture on Top of the Pops in the 80s and 90s with his band The Christians. His first band, Yachts, supported The Who on a European tour and toured America with Elvis Costello. The Christians played Wembley Arena, and even performed to 100,000 people in Paris.

But Henry says “My smallest solo gig was playing in someone’s kitchen in Ibrox, Glasgow, in front of about 25 people… I’m now enjoying myself more than ever.”

Loved Up Les

Over the last 35 years, Les has been performing, either as a solo artist or as part of a band, both in the UK and across Europe, and has several TV and radio appearances to his credit.


He has a healthy love of all styles of music, from Hank Williams to Motorhead and an unhealthy love of 70’s Pop. Les can often be heard incorporating an interesting cover or two into his live performances.

Les has been playing alongside Henry for 2 years and the pair have developed an on stage presence that has been described as 'Vic & Bob with guitars'.


The Film Makers

Helen

Helen  co-produced Henry's live dvd - Settle Down - along with Paul, who filmed and edited the show. Having worked with Henry on a variety of projects - from website design to music videos for Valentine Song  and Goodbye Common Sense, she suggested working on a full length live release. Throughout the process, they heard Henry talking about house gigs and met several fans at merch' stalls, talking about house gigs they'd attended, or were promoting themselves. It made them wonder how this phenomenon got started and what makes someone open up their living room and turn it into an intimate concert venue. 

Helen runs a digital media social enterprise and has lots of experience coordinating budgets and community projects. She's also an author so she's always looking for the story in everything she does. She's worked with Henry for 5 years, as his web designer, designing his artwork, posters and adverts and t-shirts. She said "it's been an honour and privilege to work with Henry over the last couple of years. He has enjoyed an enviable career in music spanning 35 years and we are excited at being able to tell some of Henry's story alongside exploring this emerging trend for house gigs."

Paul 

Paul is a freelance video editor, who, after working in a boring office job for 15 years embraced redundancy and pursued his dreams of making films. He's been involved with the filming and editing of many short documentaries focusing on local community businesses and social enterprises. He's also the editor of a weekly business news video blog for YB News. 


After filming and editing music videos for Henry - Valentine Song and Goodbye Common Sense, as well as Men of a Certain Age for Les, he's gotten to know their best sides! 

He has always wanted to make a feature length documentary and feels we have found a subject that will interest and inspire people. 

Promoters

This story is about the people who host house gigs and without them we wouldn't have a story. Henry has already spoken to some of his hosts who have agreed to let us come along and film the gig, interview them about their experience and talk to some of their guests. But we're also giving you the opportunity to host a house gig for inclusion in this documentary (check the perks for more information).

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to pay for the following:

o  DVDs pressed

o  Licenses (music/broadcast licensing)

o  Postage

o  Travel /accommodation/subsistence costs for film crew

o  Venue hire for preview screening

Variable – aspired costs (while it's a labour of love, we still need to pay the mortgage!)

As we're both self employed, additional funding will subsidise our income to cover our time spent away from paid work while we concentrate on filming and editing this documentary. Our time will be spent:

o  Filming House gigs and interviews

o  Post production (editing, colour correction, sound)

o  Design (cover design for the DVD)

o  Admin (contacting promoters, arranging interviews, booking the preview screening etc)

o Social Media (keeping everyone updated with every stage of the process)

Our minimum budget is £4000  but our variable budget is around £20,000

Rewards

Rewards

We have a varied list of perks available to thank those that wish to contribute to our campaign.

Pledge £8 and receive a download link for the documentary once it is completed.

Pledge £12 and we'll thank you in the end credits as well as sending you a download link.

Pledge £20 and we'll send you a signed copy of the finished documentary on dvd.

Pledge £25 and we'll send you a signed copy of Henry's live DVD 'Settle Down ' along with a download link of the finished documentary.

Pledge £40 and we'll invite you to the preview screening of the finished documentary in Liverpool. You will also be thanked in the credits and receive a signed copy of the documentary on DVD (as well as a download link)

Pledge £50 and as well as a signed copy of the documentary dvd, we'll also send you a limited edition T-shirt.

Pledge £100 and as well as download copy of the documentary, we'll also give you 2 free tickets to a Henry Priestman gig, and invite you along to the soundcheck.

Pledge £1000 and Henry and Les will play a house gig in your home, which will be filmed for the documentary. You'll also be invited along to the preview screening and receive a signed copy of the DVD, thanked in the credits and a download link.

We also have 3 production credits priced at £1500, £2000 and £2500. Your name will be included in the opening credits and we'll interview you about your experience with house gigs. You'll also be invited along to the preview screening and receive a signed copy of the DVD, thanked in the credits and a download link.

The Impact

The documentary will follow Henry for 12 months, filming key house gigs, and interviewing the promoters and attendees to get a feel for why house gigs are growing in popularity.

We will identify a couple of first time house gig promoters and document their planning process and first house gig experience. We’ll also speak to well established house gig promoters and identify some other regular performers on the house gig circuit to find out what makes this experience so special.

The documentary will be entertaining as well as informative and will show a different side to the music industry, away from the bright lights and glare of the media. 

We'll then submit the film to festivals to see if we can get a screening and raise the profile of the film to a wider audience. 


Risks & Challenges

There's a risk that some gigs might get cancelled, or the promoters won't want to talk to us on camera, or might not be happy for us to turn up and film them getting their gig ready. 

But Henry has a lot of house gigs booked in and we're confident that we'll be able to film enough to make for a good documentary.


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute to the funding, there are other ways you can help us if you want to. For instance, while this campaign is live it would be a great help if you could tweet, like and share our social media updates and help us raise as much awareness as possible about what we're trying to do. #HouseGigsDoc
You could also help by telling us if you know anyone that has promoted a house gig, who might want to get involved. Maybe you've been to a house gig and you fancy talking to us about your experience. Either way if you think you might like to be part of the film please get in touch.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Introduction
The music industry has
changed, in the modern internet age, playing live is no longer just a marketing
expense to promote a new album. Recordings are freely downloaded (legally or
otherwise) and more and more musicians are earning their wage playing gigs,
giving rise to the never ending tour
that has become the norm for many established artists.
Small intimate gigs –
the smaller the better –  have always
been a rare, sought after experience. In recent years a new phenomenon has
emerged: housegigs are popping up across the UK. No longer do you need to
travel to a large venue to see your favourite singer perform, you can get them
to come to you. 
Can you imagine that?
Your favourite musician pulling up outside your house, walking up your path,
guitar slung over shoulder, setting up in the corner of your living room? 


How would that work?
Who attends house gigs? Who puts them on? Who plays them?We want to find out what it is that makes house gigs so special and why they are becoming more and more popular.We asked established
housegig performers Henry Priestman (over 40 housegigs in the past 18 months) and his guitarist and compadre, Loved Up Les, if we could follow them around the house gig circuit, meeting established promoters
as well as first timers and find out what is it that makes house gigs so good.Who's Involved?
Henry Priestman
After over 35 years in the music
business – and with a credit list longer than both your arms – in 2009 Henry
Priestman reinvented himself as a singer-songwriter, and released his debut
solo CD “The Chronicles of Modern Life” to critical acclaim.
Followed by “The last Mad Surge of Youth”
in 2014 and the live DVD “Settle Down”
in 2015.



He’s sold millions of records, performed
in stadiums around the world to tens of thousands of people and was a regular
fixture on Top of the Pops in the 80s and 90s with his band The Christians. His
first band, Yachts, supported The Who on a European tour and toured America
with Elvis Costello. The Christians played Wembley
Arena, and even performed to 100,000 people in Paris.
But Henry says “My smallest solo gig was playing in someone’s kitchen in Ibrox,
Glasgow, in front of about 25 people… I’m now enjoying myself more than ever.”
Loved Up Les
Over the last 35 years, Les has been performing, either as a solo artist or as part of a band, both in the UK and across Europe, and has several TV and radio appearances to his credit.

He has enjoyed an enviable career in music spanning 35 years and we are excited at being able to tell some of Henry's story alongside exploring this emerging trend for house gigs."

Paul is a freelance video editor, who, after working in a boring office job for 15 years embraced redundancy and pursued his dreams of making films. He's been involved with the filming and editing of many short documentaries focusing on local community businesses and social enterprises. He's also the editor of a weekly business news video blog for YB News.

story:
What is "Homestruck"?

"Homestruck" is a new comedy web series about life and all of it's comically unfortunate side effects. 
Logline: Broke and unemployed, Sean Edelman is forced to move across the country to live with the three worst roommates imaginable...his family.

Plot Synopsis: Ever since he was a kid, Sean Edelman wanted to be on Broadway. Raised in Los Angeles, the film industry never really interested him so he moved out to New York. Three years later, at age 27, he is forced to move back west and once again live with his dysfunctional family which includes a hard-ass father, a mother who always tries just a little too much, and a brother who cares more about video games than the world around him. Now, Sean doesn't really know what to do with his life except to take it as it comes. It doesn't help matters that his ex-girlfriend still lives next door.

While the series is comedic, we think there are a lot of themes that are going to hit home for a lot of viewers.

Dollars & Cents

To make the first season of "Homestruck" a reality we need some financial assistance. The days of shooting films in our friends' backyards is over. To make this show look as good as it can we need to pay for some necessities.

Cast & Crew: ~$5200. Somewhere along the way these people got it in their heads that they deserved to be compensated for their hard work. Pfffft. Ok, I guess that makes sense.

Food: ~$500. Wait, they want us to pay them AND feed them while on set? Food for a big group for seven days costs a lot. Plus, since we're in L.A, everyone is probably going to want a vegan, organic, gluten-free, fat-free, low-calorie, diet almond milk protein shake.

Locations: ~$700. We need to pay for locations to be able to use them.

Equipment: ~$500. While we have access to most of what we will need, there are a few necessary additions to make production go smoothly.

Props/etc: ~$300. We gotta make everything look good so we are going to need little knick knacks to "dress the set"

Fees: ~$300. It costs money to register scripts, submit to festivals, get royalties and various other boring paperwork doodads.

Why not use your own money? We are but that will only take us so far (not very) so we need all the help we can get.

The Perks

We want you to feel like your money is going toward something. Not only will you get the enjoyment of watching our show but there is also a wide selection of perks you can earn from contributing.

What's Our Plan?

While we will be showing all episodes on our youtube account for you to watch, we also plan on brining the series to various festivals and ultimately trying to shop it to networks to get picked up. Wouldn't that be swell? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about our series. Tell your friends about us.  We already have a strong fan base heading into production but we can use all the support we can get!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Timothy Ray Brandon. I am an independent film maker that wants to create interesting films for people to see. I began writing the script for Black Widow a year ago. This campaign is going to help the cast and crew for this film make the best possible film for you the audience. We want to make sure that we have the resources to make great film. 

I am proud of the script, the crew and the cast that we have assembled for this project. I really do feel that with the support of all of you, that we can make an intriguing film that you will enjoy. A film that you will be proud of and satisfied with your decision to help us.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds that we raise her will be used on prop purchases/rentals, cast, crew, location rentals, catering. The purpose of this campaign is to ensure that we are able to make the most realistic looking film and secure the most believable performances. 

Depending on your contribution you will entitled to certain perks involved with the film, ranging from a special mention on the website of the film to your name as a producer and special contributor, being invited on set, signed photos and more.

We do have a price point that we would like to reach and if we somehow can not reach it, the money raised will still be put to good use to make this film great!

The Impact

Your contributions will help us make a film that in the long run we want you to enjoy watching. We want you to talk about it days, weeks, months and years after you view it. We all love engaging and interesting movies that keep us entertained and our goal is to give you that.
I have created several music videos and another feature film. All of my projects have been completed on time. I am passionate about making films that people enjoy and I take the responsibility of entertaining the audience very serious. 
My goal is to entertain with my storytelling.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge would be saving money to secure our locations and props to make this film. In reality we would like to shoot this project quickly but with the care to ensure we make a quality film. Without the contributions from you, this project will be difficult to shoot and take and extreme amount of time to complete.

Other Ways You Can Help

In the event that you can't contribute, I invite you to share this page, share the 5 minute preview and spread the word all over with friends and family. Our cast and crew have worked hard and look forward to creating a lasting film for you!

story:
<<< SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH>>>

Sevgili arkadaşlar,

Ödüllü belgeselimiz Ekümenopolis’in ardından yeni bir uzun metraj belgesel için kolları sıvadık. Bu sefer çıtayı biraz daha yükseltip küresel finans sektörü ve ona hükmeden sermayenin kentlerimizi nasıl şekillendirdiği üzerine uluslararası çapta bir belgesel yapmak amacımız. Resme daha küresel ölçekte bakan, hikayeyi sermayenin merkezinden, New York'dan alıp, finansal yatırım ve emlak araçlarının oluşturduğu çarklardan geçerek kentlerimizi, yaşam alanlarımızı şekillendiren bu devasa mekanizmaya içeriden bir bakışı ekrana taşımayı hedefliyoruz. 

Bize göre oldukça yüksek bir yapım bütçesine sahip olan bu projenin finansmanı için (özellikle sinema kalitesinde ekipman ihtiyacı ve dünyanın belli başlı kentlerinde çekimler yüzünden) yurtiçi ve yurtdışından birçok fona ve ortağa ihtiyacımız olacak. Ancak kar amacı ile tasarlanan birçok yabancı yapımla yarışmamız için projemizi geliştirip sağlam bir fragman hazırlamamız gerekiyor. Bu da New York'da yapılacak bir araştırma ve çekim süreci demek. Filmimize ihtiyacı olan fonu bulabilmemiz büyük ölçüde bu fragmana bağlı. Bu fragmanın başarısı filmin yapımında desteğinizin misliyle geri dönüşü demek olacak. 

Desteğiniz ve dayanışmanız için teşekkürler!

sevgiler,

Gaye ve İmre


Dear friends,

After the award-winning “Ecumenopolis: City Without Limits” we have now embarked on another feature-length documentary. This time we are aiming a bit higher, trying to make a truly international film about how the global finance sector and the capital that governs it shape our cities. Looking at the big picture on a global scale, we will start our story from the heart of capital and finance, in New York City. Going through the gears of financial investments, speculation, and real estate instruments, we hope to reveal the inner workings of this elaborate mechanism that dominate our cities and living spaces.

The relatively high production budget of this documentary (due to the cinema-quality equipment needs and shootings in major cities around the world) requires us to find funding and production partners, both domestic and foreign. However, in order to compete with profit-oriented big-budget films for funding, we need to fully develop our project and produce a very strong trailer. And this means researching and shooting in New York, which is quite expensive by itself. Finding the funding for the documentary depends for the most part on this trailer. The success of this trailer means that your contribution to the documentary will be multiplied many fold.

Thank you for your support and solidarity!

Love and peace,

Gaye and Imre

The relatively high production budget of this documentary (due to the cinema-quality equipment needs and shootings in major cities around the world) requires us to find funding and production partners, both domestic and foreign. However, in order to compete with profit-oriented big-budget films for funding, we need to fully develop our project and produce a very strong trailer. And this means researching and shooting in New York, which is quite expensive by itself. Finding the funding for the documentary depends for the most part on this trailer. The success of this trailer means that your contribution to the documentary will be multiplied many fold.
Thank you for your support and solidarity!
Love and peace,
Gaye and Imre

story:
Acid Daemons is an independent horror movie to be shot in Leicester, England during November and December 2015.

This is a story of parallel worlds, almost perfectly superimposed on each other. One world is the run-down housing estate in which Hannah, our protagonist, has spent her teenage years. But turn your head quickly and you might just  glimpse the other world - a time and space of daemons.

Hannah and her brother Carlo live on the 18th floor of a housing block in the middle of the estate. But two floors below, a chemist has set up a kitchen sink laboratory. In a dream he saw a new designer drug. Now he has cooked it up.

When Carlo tries it, he glimpses the daemon world. Then he disappears into it. Hannah becomes convinced the only way to rescue him is by taking the drug herself and following. Is this hallucination or is it reality? And what will happen if she leaves a doorway open between the two worlds?

The team behind Acid Daemons have a track record of completing long form projects. This gives us and our backers confidence that the movie will be made and the pledges will be met. 

Rhys Davies directed and produced the feature film 'Zombie Undead', which received a theatrical release and international distribution. It was described by the Fantasporto festival (rated by Variety as the world's premiere fantasy festival) as "Pure British gore", and Scream magazine as "A brain- munching classic." 

His latest short film Finding Richard, starring Dr Who Colin Baker, premiered at Cannes in 2014.

Co-writer Rod Duncan is the author of six novels published by Simon & Schuster and Angry Robot Books. His work has won nominations for the Philip K. Dick Award (one of the most prestigious juried awards in science fiction) and the John Creasey Dagger of the Crime Writers’ Association.

Co-writers Rod Duncan and Rhys Davies have deliberately placed a strong female lead at the heart of Acid Daemons. Hannah is a force of nature. Her love for her brother is helping her to transcend the difficulties of her background and surroundings. But there are things lurking in their shared past that are trying to re-enter their lives.

Rod stated: “We didn't want to present the housing estate as something inherently dark or miserable. There is life and creativity and passion here. Hannah sits at the centre of that.”

Rhys, who also directs the film, has said his vision for Acid Daemons is “Shane Meadows meets John Carpenter. By locating the film in an everyday setting we can ramp up the concept of the 'other' - the daemons and their world layered underneath."

The movie will mostly be shot on built sets. Director Of Photographer Tom Barker said that "Using purpose built sets gives us complete control. We can do shots and sequences that we just couldn't do on location. As A DOP this liberates me to focus on my art and raise the production levels of the film as high as possible."

Rhys said "The Indie Go Go model allows us to retain control of the project, which will let our team craft a psychological horror with an untainted vision. But more than this, it enables a wide collaboration between crew, cast, funders and supporters. It is a film made by the people, for the people."

As our tag line for this campaign suggests, this is 'The film YOU can be a part of.'
That doesn't have to be via financial support. Spreading the word through Facebook, Twitter or face to face, providing transport for the cast or help us to build the sets would all mean a great deal to us. One way or another, your help will enable us to push the film to completion. Finally any words of encouragement and support would be gratefully received. Making a feature film is the most collaborative of arts - and we need YOU! Join Us...

story:
We're a group of Film & Media Production students at Humber College in Toronto, Canada. We have spent the last three years learning and making films in preparation for our final Thesis Film.

**Please remember that if you donate anonymously we have no way of delivering perks! 

Comment any questions you may have.

Story

Distance is Nour’s story: a woman fighting against all odds to be together with her son. The protagonist is a recent escapee from Syria who finds sanctuary in Canada, far away from her young son, who is still in danger. She becomes good friends with Jenny, the upbeat girlfriend of her thrifty landlord. This odd friendship between a middle-aged Syrian refugee and a lively bartender, with their interwoven family pursuits—that’s Distance in short. Through this film, we envision a way to convey a refugee’s story through a unique lens, infused with humor and the unexpected. 

Costs

Our school provides guidance and resources to help us make the film, but the bare minimum resources are not enough to properly make our film. Your contribution will help us secure the following...

Food: To feed our crew and cast during those long days of production.

Transportation: Gas! With your generosity, we will be able to transport our production equipment, cast, and crewmembers with no worries.

Location: With your help, we could secure the locations we want. An unnamed supporter has offered us a house to shoot in, which works for us creatively and financially, but for transitions and other smaller scenes, we will have to book locations. We have select locations in mind that will need financial compensation.

Production Design: Wardrobe, props, set decoration, and hair/makeup. We have to create a set of an immigration court. Likewise, Nour’s wardrobe, hair, and makeup need special attention; they need to reflect her background, but at the same time, they need to underscore her unbridled mind. We will not lack in art department resources, with the support of your donation.

Equipment Rental: Camera, lenses, lights, batteries; these are our paints and brushes to create the cinematic image.

Fees: Once the film is made, there will be costs for submitting the film at festivals and exhibitions. You will help us make the film reach a broader audience.

story:
Jazz For Life is a feature length-Documentary about Ski Johnson, a jazz saxophonist who discovered the Power of Marketing and how to Maneuver through the Good, the Bad and the Hidden Dangers to create success. For over 25 years Ski Johnson has released over 10 recordings, of which two albums hit #1 on the Billboard Charts and were considered for Grammy Awards in several categories on the Ballot. Ski Johnson has tried to come up with innovative ways to promote Jazz through his music, music videos and appearances from The Emmy Awards to The Grammy Awards.    There are many familiar faces to help tell this incredible story.




Jazz For Life Documentary is more than a story about Ski Johnson and his early diagnoses of Alopecia, being bullied or his many high profile appearances. It’s a story about a shy boy who through the love of Jazz music overcame these challenges. He went on to further explore Jazz music only to realize that there was no Jazz music being aired on the radio stations, T.V. Networks or Award shows. 95% of people when they think of Jazz music they tend to think small as it relates to the listening audience. It is this very mindset that is hurting Jazz musicians all over the world and they find it hard to see themselves with the type of success that many of the rock, pop or rap artist have. As a result Ski Johnson came up with ingenious ways to “brand and market” Jazz music and himself to the mainstream media and audiences everywhere. This was very unusual and unheard of for a Jazz musician to do and would ultimately lead to major controversy with him.









                                               


            


We are almost finished with production and will headed into post production. We have a few more interviews to finish and we are now about to cross the bridge into licensing of archival footage/materials and music (all very pricey).  We also need  to build our post production team who will help us shape this phenomenal story. We've used up a lot of our favors, relationships and thankfully we have some generous and  talented friends and colleagues who were able to help us get to this point. The $65,000 we are trying to raise will barely scratch the surface of our overall costs, so we hope to be able to raise above and beyond this amount.  

We have self-financed everything up until now and have been working on this film in between other projects, but we know with the appropriate support from the Indiegogo and indie film community, not only will we be able to finish it faster, we will be able to make the film the best it can be. We want to do a honest and candid film. To do it right, and to get it done by mid 2016, we need your help. 

Know that any amount given will go towards finishing the film and will help get this remarkable story out there. We have some pretty nice perks available (see them to the right). We have come up with some interesting perks from our Partners, as a way of saying thank you. We even have perks for those who really want to get involved called the EXECUTIVE ON THE FILM ,GET REALLY INVOLVED AND CO-PRODUCER . These are ones that could really help us alot.






             


The Jazz For Life Documentary is ultimately about promoting Jazz music! Because Jazz music is America's #1 art form, there's no reason why there should not be any Jazz music on mainstream radio, television or major concert venues. Jazz musicians should not be homeless and starving. The Jazz Awards are no longer televised at the Major Award Shows making it nearly impossible to sell records, build branding partnerships or get booked at Major concert venues without major media exposure. By helping us telling this story it exposes these issues with the hope of bringing Jazz music back to the mainstream again where it belongs.



For The Past 2 years we have been working with a great team of professionals, Producer/Cinematographer Carlus McCormick, Cinematographer Mathew Sloan, Ceo of First Step Inc Douglas Crocker and many other contracted lighting, sound and on-set folks. We expect to release the Jazz for Life Documentary around mid 2016.


 


             


Shooting and completing a film requires the dedication and passion of so many people.  Any independent filmmaker will tell you that film making is hard but incredibly fulfilling.  We hope to have a full rough cut by early 2016. We are committed to this project and will finish it Regardless, but with some help, we can share Ski's inspirational and remarkable story in 2016. Ski told us last year that he was really eager to get the film out as soon as possible. He speaks often of being diagnosed at the age 12 with Alopecia and how music saved his life.            This is all the more reason to support this project and help us tell this amazing story. 

             


Any Contribution can help, no matter how small.  In addition to giving to our campaign, please share the link on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and by email.
Also please use Hashtag: #JazzforlifeDocumentar @jazzforlifeDocumentary
 We know that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by sharing the news about the film and the campaign. Email or share the link on your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. 

            


Carlus McCormick is a documentary director and producer based in Washington D.C.,  also known as Y.F.M, is part owner of W.a.s.t.e Entertainment LLC. Y.F.M. means Your Favorite Manager as it exemplifies an above industry standard of conducting commercial and community projects. As an executive member of W.a.s.t.e Entertainment LLC., his duties include being a consultant for personal business affairs for Recording Artist. Also he arranges Artist live performance bookings for indie and mainstream talent. As VP of operations management he extensively works with record company's on everything from approvals of album artwork to coordinating the choice of producers, location of recording, establishment of recording budget, rental of equipment and lodging, travel, promotional appearances, press and publicity in accordance to the Y.F.M. standard. His is a specialist in establishing artists' image for branding their album project and helping artists set and achieve commercial goals. Y.F.M is also the lead videographer for W.a.s.t.e Entertainment. Video production is the art and service of creating content and delivering a finished video product. This can include production of television programs, television commercials, corporate videos, event videos, wedding videos and special-interest home videos. Client projects already completed by W.a.s.t.e Entertainment and Y.F.M. include ABC News 7, Children's Defense Fund, Creative Hysteria LLC, 93.9 WKYS, 95.5 WPGC, POSSETV, Eve Lora, Joe Budden, Katsucon 19, Miguel, Black Indian, Bowie State University, Omillio Sparks, DC Scorpio, Marlin Wiggins, Macy's, Mike Styles, Tyson Family, XXL, The Children's Defense Fund, Hillary Rodham Clinton, Marian Wright Edelman, Vivica Fox, Laz Alonso, Maureen Bunyan, Caruthers Gant IV, The Umbrella Syndicate, Fabolous, Ra-Ra The Party Starter, Dj Kenney Hollywood, Bad Girls Club GIA & Erica, Beanie Sigel, Freeway, Tone Trump, Lil Scrappy, Mr. Cheeks, Dj Dynomight, Eddie Kayne Show, Queen Charis Show, Jennie Jones, Dj Gemini, Dj Lucky, Phokis Philms, and Resident Outfit Entertainment. The Y.F.M. stamp is recognition of new and innovative standards in entertainment and video production.

Matthew Sloan is the Ceo of Urban Forest Media, Matt started his photography career documenting adventure sports in the Applachian Mountains. As his passion grew and his career developed, he brought his exciting and compelling style into a much broader scope including short films, corporate work, promotional, and documentary and most recent the Lead Cameraman for The National Geographic Channel.

Waste TV is a Maryland based production company formed by Carlus McCormick and others. W.A.S.T.E stands for Wandering And Surviving Through Everything. We wander and survive through everything by Working And Striving Towards Excellence. We believe this is a mantra all of us can live by. Our mission as a company is to fortify and stimulate the Entertainment market in the DC metro area. Our mission is to introduce new talent by providing productions, promotions and management services for local/mainstream talent, recording labels and production studios. More importantly, our mission as people will always be to support our fellow entrepreneurs, students, parents, employees, and activists in pursuing their goals as we all build a better community together. W.A.S.T.E TV is our top brand for video promotions and marketing. It has been serving as a grassroots marketing, press and publicity hub in the DC/Baltimore Metropolitan entertainment market. W.A.S.T.E TV has cataloged over 150 video projects in the last 2 years with exclusive clientele such as ABC News 7, Children's Defense Fund, Creative Hysteria LLC, 93.9 WKYS, 95.5 WPGC, POSSETV, Eve Lora, Joe Budden, Katsucon 19, Miguel, Black Indian, Bowie State University, Omillio Sparks, DC Scorpio, Marlin Wiggins, Macy's, Mike Styles, Tyson Family, XXL, The Children's Defense Fund, Hillary Rodham Clinton, Marian Wright Edelman, Vivica Fox, Laz Alonso, Maureen Bunyan, Caruthers Gant IV, The Umbrella Syndicate, Fabolous, Ra-Ra The Party Starter, Dj Kenney Hollywood, Bad Girls Club GIA & Erica, Beanie Sigel, Freeway, Tone Trump, Lil Scrappy, Mr. Cheeks, Dj Dynomight, Eddie Kayne Show, Queen Charis Show, Jennie Jones, Dj Gemini, Dj Lucky, Phokis Philms, and Resident Outfit Entertainment. W.A.S.T.E TV is now expanding its brand to the community with our new website WasteTV.net. WasteTV.net is the newest innovation in multiplatform broadcasting. It seeks to revolutionize the broadcasting industry through its new technological foundations. Join us in the journey in creating the new way of broadcasting!

Douglas Crocker is the Ceo of First Step artist management, He is currently the Manager for Ski Johnson, Miss. Virginia Brittany Athey, Former Miss. United States Candiace Dillard and has worked with many of the Major Pageants.

Kecia Spencer  is the Campaign Manager, She was the Personal Assistant for the Orlando fox Show, Assistant Editor for Da Mic Newzine and the Talent Coordinator for Rush Communications (Russell Simmons)  Hip Hop Summit.

story:
When is a prayer, not a prayer?

When the prayer is not from the heart…

Then what stops the sex workers of Sonagachi from praying to their goddess and participating in the rituals of Durga Puja festival?

Sonagachi, of Kolkata, India is the largest red light area in Asia. The area houses more than 11000 sex workers involved in various aspects of the trade. Once a year for six days, the city of Kolkata is gripped by the festive fervor of Durga Puja. However, till 2013 this festive spirit didn’t reach Sonagachi.  The sex workers are socially barred from participating in the festival. Despite the fact that without the earth from a sex worker’s house, the idol of the goddess created for veneration during Durga Puja is considered incomplete, the very sex workers are ostracized from the festival because of their profession.

This is the story of how the sex workers of Sonagachi, claimed their right to worship Goddess Durga and their continuing struggles against a hypocritical society which questions their rights, by the virtue of the presumed morals of their profession.

(Her)History...

Way back in 2013, these sex workers with the help of their collective Durbar Mahila Samanwaya Committee went all the way to High Court to get the permission to have their own Durga Puja. They were allowed to hold the puja inside Durbar’s clinic “Avinash”.

The following year, the sex workers found themselves at the High Court again as their appeal to hold the puja in an outdoors Pandal was opposed. The space chosen for the pandal was contested by police as being an impediment for smooth flow of transport and emergency services. Various other communities have previously used the very same space to set up pandals for other festivals like Ganesh Puja and Kali Puja. However, the sex workers were compelled to hold their Durga Puja inside the clinic again.

However, this is just the story of Sonagachi, other red light areas of Kolkata like Kalighat,  Mushigunj Road etc have not yet received the permission to hold their Durga Puja. Many sex workers travel to Sonagachi during the Puja to worship Goddess Durga.

What is Durga Puja?

Durga Puja is perhaps the most important festival for Bengalis all over the world. The festival is celebrated with a lot of passion in Kolkata. It marks the time when Goddess Durga fought and defeated the demon Mahisasura. It is a festival that celebrates triumph of good over evil.

However, it is not just the meaning of the festival that makes it important, it is how it is celebrated. Usually, for large scale Pujas, many communities come together to celebrate Durga Puja. Here various families gather together to worship the goddess and participate in the rituals. Smaller pujas are considered a family affair where generations of a family and the extended family attend the Puja and participate in the rituals. It is a very social festival.

In addition, an added attraction of Durga Puja is the Pandal, the outdoor temporary shed that are designed in the most artistic ways. These pandals house the goddess’s idol and also provide an area for various cultural programs, dance and music shows to take place. Large groups of families and friends are often seen traversing through various pandals, marveling at the architecture, worshiping the idols, checking out the cultural programs and having a merry time.

What is the story?

This year the sex workers are going to apply to have their puja in a pandal again. We are going to follow them through their journey. In addition, we will look into the importance of holding their own Durga Puja for these sex workers. The rituals and the festive spirit that was so far denied to them is being claimed by them. This is an account of sex workers fighting for their rights. At a deeper level it is a fight for human right; the right to worship your god/ goddess, as and how you wish.

For us, we want to make more people aware of the issue. Many people do not know that sex workers are the only group that cannot participate in Durga Puja. We hope that after this documentary, it becomes easier for the sex workers of Sonagachi and other red light areas of Kolkata to hold their Durga Puja as they want.

Where will the money go?

We have been working on the film for almost a year now and up to now this project has been 100% self funded. While my savings account has gotten us this far, the time has come to add committed resources that will turbo-charge the post-production process and ensure that we finish our film.

Our commitment to this project implies that we are going to finish it no matter how successful this campaign is, because we believe that this story must be told.

Our fundraising budget is designed to with the aim of avoiding the situation where the common man is oblivious to the film and the struggles of these women. For this reason we still need you to make sure that the film reaches everyone and makes a social impact.
When the campaign is a success the film will be sent to film festivals in India and abroad, where people just like you will get to know about the strength of these women. Afterwards, it will be available for DVD, TV, online streaming, educational distribution etc.
Do you have questions about Six Sacred Days ? Email us! info@sixsacreddays.com

Who is the Director?

I am Shruti Sengupta, an independent filmmaker in Mumbai. This is my second documentary film as a director.I have worked in Mumbai, India as a writer and assistant director; before that, in Delhi, I have worked as an assistant editor and assistant producer. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Share! Isn't that what film is all about? Tell your family, friends, enemies and anyone you know who's interested in film and culture! We want to get this out to anyone and everyone we know and by sharing with people you know, you're doing an amazing service to our film!

THANK YOU!

For taking the time and showing an interest in our film! I can't express my gratitude for everyone who's helped along the way and for anyone taking the time to read this. Keep checking back for updates as we head forward to finishing our project!

Sincerely,
Shruti Sengupta

story:
Hi There,

My name is Oliver Ades. I am a Bolivian-American field producer and explorer of ancient technologies. I’ve spent the last 5 years of my life exploring and researching subjects like Sumerian civilization, Pre-Incan, ante-deluvian architecture, Vedic science, the ancient astronaut theory, ley-line theory, and Khemitology to name a few.

Shaun Ingram (our Writer/Producer/Director for La Chincana) and I met in Bolivia while producing a docu-series called Ancient Tomorrow dealing with the pyramid power plant theory proposed by Engineer Christopher Dunn.  Shaun and I had the blessed opportunity to explore the depths of Bolivia and in our travels we met with the Uros people, local tribesmen of Lake Titicaca, who spoke of subterranean tunnels beneath the lake that linked like veins to different ancient sites throughout South America including Tiahuanacu and Machu Pichu. This was paramount in the founding of La Chincana's backstory, as it is founded on the urban myths of the Aymaran and Quechuan people of Bolivia, the forbidden history of the country and its global ties to an advanced ancient civilization, the Nazi connection post World War II, and lined with a dash of horror mimicking Ruggero Deodato's unmistakable directorial style, that will surely keep you on your feet the entire time.

Ok. So a little about our project.'LA CHINCANA'


Born into an old money family, Phillip Winthrop’s lack of ambition has left little reason for his father to allow the squandering to continue. An ultimatum is issued, which ignites an old idea to make a documentary exploring an internet mystery.

In search of Under Water Anomalies (UWA’s) found on Google Earth images, Phillip and his band of misfits venture into South America, searching for sunken cities in the Andes Mountains. As rookie tourists, none of them notice how convenient this adventure has come together.

When Phillip wakes in a raft, missing his friends, the footage and his memory, he is left wandering for help in a foreign land where his money is no good. As he traces his step back, he collects found footage on Go Pro’s and SD cards, but confusion quickly turns to terror as the footage reveals what his memory had lost.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

So why Bolivian Cinema?

The most frequently asked question about Bolivian cinema outside the country is probably this: “Bolivian cinema? Huhh?” And, usually, the quick and somewhat angry response to this perplexity is simple: yes, there is such a thing as a ‘Bolivian cinema.’ Granted. Their cinema is small, only capable of producing a few movies a year, made in almost impossible conditions. But with your help, we can produce a movie that will help grow the industry, giving it that added movie it so desperately needs, and in the process, we will be introducing a new genre to the market which we believe can and will be replicated, since it offers a cost advantage alternative to other more expensive formats.

What We Need:

  • Genre – Suspense / Horror
  • Budget - $85,000 USD ($60k Pre-Prod and Production/ $25k Post)
  • Schedule – 7 weeks (4 weeks pre-production/ 3 weeks production)
  •  Locations – Bolivia, Los Angeles


The Impact:

* BRINGING STUDIO LEVEL TEAMS TO BOLIVIA WITH LOS ANGELES BASED PRODUCTION COMPANY FORTUNE FILMS;

* WE WILL BE HIRING OUR CAST AND CREW OUT OF BOLIVIA;

* HELP US BOLSTER BOLIVIA'S GROWING FILM  ECONOMY;

* WE WILL BE FILMING IN LA PAZ, THE TOWN OF COPACABANA AND ISLANDS OF THE SUN & MOON; POSSIBLY LIMA, PERU AIRPORT

* BRINGING MUCH NEEDED FILM WORK TO AN UNDER-SERVED FILM COMMUNITY;

* VIEW OUR REWARDS PROGRAM. BECOME PART OF THE PRODUCTION AND HELP US BOLSTER A GROWING FILM MARKET IN BOLIVIA. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
UPDATE! (and thanks!)

Thank you to all who so generously contributed to PYOTR495! Our campaign is finished, but if you still wish to support the project, please email us at driveinkeepoutproduction@gmail.com specifying your preference of perk, and we would be happy to have you join our team!

About the film PYOTR495:

"Set one evening in present-day Moscow, 16 year-old Pyotr is baited by an ultranationalist group known for their violent abductions and attacks bolstered by Russia's LGBT propaganda law, but Pyotr has a dangerous secret his attackers could never have accounted for..."
PYOTR495 is a short film set in Russia in the year 2014. The country has invaded the Ukraine, the newly instated LGBT propaganda law makes it illegal to present gay life as normal, while Russian President Vladimir Putin's approval rating is at a 6 year high. We begin in the run-down, white Soviet-era tower blocks in the Cheryomushki district of Moscow, and follow our character, Pyotr, as he leaves his friends and ventures out into the night on his scooter and under the passing lights of the city streets as he is baited into a dangerous scenario at the sprawling apartment of a member of one of Moscow’s financial elite. 

OUR TEAM:

Blake Mawson  - WRITER/DIRECTOR/PRODUCER 

Raised in British Columbia, Canada, Blake has been working in film & television for over 15 years. He began studying acting and film at the age of 16 and has appeared in film and television projects like Freddy VS Jason, X-Men 2, Blade: The Series, Poison Ivy, and The Strain. After living in Germany for 4 years and working within the music and art world, Blake returned to Canada and to once again work within the horror realm, where he continues to write and develop a number of his own screenplays today.

Alex Ozerov - LEAD ACTOR - 'Pyotr'  

Alex Ozerov originated from Russia and came to Canada in 2004. During his school years he began taking drama, and in 2006 started studying acting for film and TV. Ozerov's passion for the craft allowed him to land numerous roles at a young age. His TV appearances include shows like; Rookie Blue, Cracked, Transporter: The Series, and Orphan Black. Ozerov made his film debut in Jason Buxton's award-winning indie film, Blackbird, playing the lead antagonist, Trevor, opposite Falling Skies’ Connor Jessup and appeared in Sarah St. Onge‘s Molly Maxwell. This year Alex has four films coming out; What We Have, Guidance, A Christmas Horror Story, and The Dark Stranger. He’s also recently starred in the feature films Natasha, The History Of Love, and the upcoming Coconut Hero. 

Catherine Lutes - CINEMATOGRAPHER 

Catherine Lutes is a Leo Award winning cinematographer with ten years of experience in film and television. Her work has screened at international festivals including Sundance and TIFF. Recent works include the feature films Molly Maxwell (MoMa Canadian Front 2013, Palm Springs International Film Festival 2013), Algonquin (Montreal World Film Festival 2013) and Mountain Men (Borsos Competition Whistler 2014). Lutes recently completed work on the Sundance Documentary Fund supported feature documentary Winter Buoy with Cannes award winning director Frida Kempff, director Stephen Dunn's Sundance-selected Pop-up Porno short film series, and feature film drama The People Garden with director Nadia Litz. 

Konrad Black - COMPOSER

Part of the first wave of North American producers to infiltrate Berlin's modern techno movement, Konrad Black's shadowy production style and charismatic live persona has since had dance-floors basking in the long shadows cast by his presence on the scene. His signature sound is a masterwork of harmonious contradictions, pairing apocalyptic basslines and moody synth progressions with a cinematic temperament that finds its most compelling moments within the spaces between the notes. Konrad has been being tapped to play the scene's most coveted venues, including Fabric in London, Rex Club in Paris, Space in Ibiza, and as one of the regulars at the legendary Panorama Bar. Konrad is set to release his ongoing collaboration with Buttrich will have matured into a full length release in 2016.

https://soundcloud.com/konrad_black

Matthew DeWilde - PRACTICAL SPECIAL EFFECTS  

Matthew began working in film production in the early 1980s. After attending the movie premiere of John Carpenter’s, The Thing, Matthew reached a turning point in his career in Special Effects Makeup and Animatronics. He began working on various horror films, television series and also freelanced for toy and leisure companies. In 1987, he started his first company, Creations Unlimited, and has created works for iconic film and TV like Jacob's Ladder, The Twilight Zone, Goosebumps, Stir Of Echoes and Saw II. A second company, named Form and Dynamics was later formed with colleagues, Allan Cooke and David Scott. It produced work for numerous television series including, FX: The Series, Psi Factor, The Silken Laumann Story, Earth: Final Conflict, The Listener, and more. Today Matthew divides his time between feature film and television and prosthetics instructor. Matthew continues to stay busy today working on productions like Between, Beauty & The Beast and Orphan Black.

Sasha Fisher - PRODUCER 

Sasha Fisher is a Toronto-based independent producer. Sasha's passion is producing entertainment that makes an impact on her audience, and she seeks out projects with characters who aren't represented in the mainstream. Currently, she's producing a feature-length documentary in Haiti called A Wild Ride Thru Haiti as well as a feature-length documentary about the life of trans activist Susan Gapka, titled The Susan Gapka Documentary. Sasha is also currently acting as the Production Manager of Alopecia, an Arts Council funded short film. Her recent work includes Make It Pop,  Close Encounters Season 2,  Pay The Ghost,  Not Your Girl, and Flamenco., 


CONTACT:

If you wish to contact the production, or for media inquires, please feel free to get in touch at:

driveinkeepoutproductions@gmail.com

series and also freelanced for toy and leisure companies. In 1987, he

Sasha Fisher is a Toronto-based independent producer. Sasha's passion is producing entertainment that makes an impact on her audience, and she seeks out projects with characters who aren't represented in the mainstream. Currently, she's producing a feature-length documentary in Haiti called A Wild Ride Thru Haiti as well as a feature-length documentary about the life of trans activist Susan Gapka, titled The Susan Gapka Documentary. story:
For our English speaking friends - Please find the English description below

Einmal..

um die Welt, das ist der Plan. Wir, Andrea und Klaus Gattringer beide dreiunddreißig Jahre alt aus Innsbruck/Österreich, seit einem Jahr verheiratet und seit dreizehn Jahren ein Paar, sind los gezogen um diesen Plan Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. Abenteuer erleben, die Welt sehen wie sie wirklich ist, Menschen treffen um Ihre Geschichten zu erzählen. Unvoreingenommen reisen, öfter Ja als Nein sagen, dass haben wir uns vorgenommen und umgesetzt. Und Österreich wollen wir transportieren, als freundliches Land mit freundlichen Menschen.


Zwei Monate und 13.000 Kilometer...

sind wir unterwegs und haben viel erlebt. Wir haben oft unsere Limits erreicht, physisch, wie psychisch. Im Guten und auch im Schlechten, daran sind wir gewachsen. Was wir erlebt haben ist in Film und Foto festgehalten und wo immer wir ausreichendes Internet haben, füttern wir unseren Blog, posten auf Facebook und Instagram. 

Und wir wollen weiter.


Sponsoring bzw. Crowdfunding

 Leider haben wir ein Problem, denn eines unserer Sponsorings hat nicht funktioniert. Aufgeben hat aber noch nie zu unseren Stärken gehört, sonst wären wir nicht dort wo wir sind. Daher haben wir uns entschlossen eine Crowdfunding Kampagne auf indiegogo zu starten. 

Unser Ziele

Ein großes Etappenziel ist das erreichen von Südostasien (Thailand, Laos, Kambodscha, ...), dass ist das Hauptziel dieser Crowdfunding Kampagne . Wir haben gerade den Nordosten von  Kasachstan verlassen und sind wieder in Russland. Vor uns liegen mehr als achttausend Kilometer durch Russland, die kaum erschlossene Mongolei und das restriktive China. Wenn diese Kampagne das Kampagnenziel übersteigen sollte fließt dieses Geld in die Passage nach Südamerika, mit Zwischenziel Australien (die mit den Kängurus :) ). Die Durchfahrt durch China (seeeeehr teuer) haben wir im Vorfeld schon bezahlt. Klappt das Crowdfunding nicht, verlieren wir dieses Geld und das wäre sehr schade.

  • Wir werden am Ende unserer Reise diese als Buch und Film veröffentlichen. Kostenfrei, für alle. Auf Youtube, Facebook, Amazon und allen anderen Plattformen die wir in die Finger bekommen.  
  • Unser zweites Ziel ist es unser Land zu repräsentieren. Das kleine, schöne Österreich. Wir, beide stolz auf unser Land, wollen Österreich als das freundliche Land vermitteln dass es auch ist. 


Warum geht ihr nicht einfach arbeiten?

Das ist natürlich eine legitime Frage. Natürlich wollen wir unser Reisebudget mit Arbeitspausen, mitunter in Südoasasien, aufbessern. 
Das Problem ist im momentan dass wir eine fest gebuchte Durchfahrt durch China haben, die ca ein Monat dauert und am 14. September startet. Davor müssen wir noch durch die ganze Mongolei, es fehlt uns dadurch die Zeit zu stoppen. Wir haben diese Durchfahrt vor längerer Zeit gebucht, nicht wissend dass uns das in eine Zwickmühle bringen wird. 

Für unsere Sponsoren

Wir wollen natürlich eine Gegenleistung erbringen für das Geld. Film- und Buchcredits gehören dazu, als auch Flächen für Werbung auf unserem Auto. 

Das Auto ist mit 4000 Stickern (Stickerbombing) planiert. Dadurch zieht es  die Aufmerksamkeit auf sich, wird fotografiert und gefilmt. Der verblichene Kuhschädel den wir in Kasachstan auf die Motorhaube montiert haben ist die Kirsche auf der Torte.

 Unsere Sponsoren bekommen nun Plätze für ihre Werbung in den Seitenscheiben, der Heckscheibe und auf der Motorhaube des Autos. Individuell kann auch eine ganze Scheibe oder ein Teil davon vereinbart werden (bitte um Kontakt). 

Die seitlichen Solarzellen Marke Eigenbau, die leider nie wie gut funktioniert haben und inzwischen durch Temperatur und Erschütterung kaputt sind, werden mit Filz in Signalfarben verkleidet, wie auf einem der Fotos ersichtlich. So kommt die Werbung zu Geltung. 

Die Folie auf der Motorhaube wird entfernt, darunter ist das Auto Dunkelgrau Metallic. Farbenfrohe Werbung sticht auf diesem Untergrund heraus.

Deine Werbung oder eine Botschaft die du vermitteln willst, geht so um die Welt, ist Teil eines einzigartigen Fahrzeugs und einer unglaublichen Reise. 

Gerne drucken wir eine Grafik oder Werbung auf unserem Canon Selphy Fotodrucker aus und kleben diese ins Auto. Wenn du uns einen Aufkleber lieber zusenden möchtest geben wir rechtzeitig vor Ablauf der Kampagne die Adresse einer Unterkunft, vermutlich in Russland, bekannt. Als Zustelldienst empfehlen wir DHL oder FED-EX.



Weitere Möglichkeiten

Was können wir noch umsetzen? Ein Heiratsantrag für die Freundin in den Sand eines traumhaften, einsamen Strands geschrieben - fotografiert, gefilmt, geschnitten und an dich übermittelt? Fotos und Film von einem Platz den du immer sehen wolltest? Oder willst du uns herausfordern  (Ihr traut euch nie...) . Alles möglich. Machen wir uns was aus, schreib uns auf summersun.at@gmail.com

Wie nutzen wir das Geld?

 Für 8000-9000 km, den nächsten Streckenteil der sich auf ca 2.5 Monate erstreckt, werden wir ca 1000 EUR an Benzin verbrauchen. 

Dazu kommen die Kosten für Visa in Südostasien - wir kalkulieren dafür 400 EUR ein. 

Die monatlichen Lebenskosten für uns liegen bei ca 900 EUR. 

Es ergeben sich 3650 EUR für 2.5 Monate, der Rest entfällt auf Indiegogo Gebühren.

Unsere Mission

Abgesehen davon Abenteuer zu erleben möchten wir unseren Beitrag leisten die Welt greifbarer zu machen, abseits von Nachrichten die meist Negatives berichten, abseits vom Mainstram. Wir wollen über Freundschaft schreiben und über wunderbare Natur, über Erstaunliches und Gewöhnliches, dass fernab von daheim dennoch oft sehr ungewöhnlich ist.

 Wir wollen damit  helfen Brücken zu bauen. Brücken zu Ländern, Orten und Menschen die man nie in den Nachrichten sieht, die ein Tourist nie zu Gesicht bekommt. Dazu haben wir unser Auto, einen alten Chrysler Voyager Allrad, mit allem darin, was wir zum Leben brauchen.


Österreich ist unbekannt

Unser zweites Ziel ist es unser Land zu transportieren. Das kleine, schöne Österreich. Österreich,  liebe Mit-ÖsterreicherInnen und liebe Tourismusbüros, ist relativ unbekannt. Mit viel Pantomime, Google Translate und dem klassischen Wörterbuch haben wir wohl schon etliche Male erklärt wo unsere Alpenrepublik zu finden ist, und dass es bei uns keine Kängurus gibt. 

Mag in den größeren Städten vielleicht noch der Name der Republik den Menschen etwas sagen, sind wir spätestens in den kleineren Orten und Gemeinden das Dorfgespräch. Wir schütteln viele Hände und umarmen Menschen. Die vielleicht ersten Österreicher die diese Menschen getroffen haben waren nett, dass bleibt im Kopf.


Welche Risiken gibt es?

  • Wir schrotten unser Auto, sei es durch Unfall oder einen mechanischen K.O.. Das wäre schlecht für Sponsoren mit Werbung auf dem Auto aber das gehört dazu und es kann passieren. Dreizehntausend Kilometer lang ist abgesehen von einer gerissenen Antriebswelle nicht viel passiert aber Garantie gibt es keine. 
  • es kommt nicht genug Geld zusammen und wir müssen zurück. Auch der schnellste Rückweg ist ca siebentausend Kilometer lang auf denen das Auto gesehen wird. Geschichten gibt es genug für Buch und Film, die gesammelten Daten umfassen aktuell ca 500 GB.
  • wir müssen aus Krankheitsgründen abbrechen, das Auto zurück lassen und nach Hause fliegen. Für den Transport und die Versorgung sind wir versichert. In diesem Fall werden wir uns bemühen unsere Reise später fortzusetzen, denn wir sind noch lange nicht reisemüde.

Was kommt nach Südostasien?

Und wie finanzieren wir den weiteren Weg, denn wir wollen ja um die ganze Welt. 
Wir haben uns eine Einnahmequelle über das Internet vorbereitet. Diese funktioniert gut und wir haben davon auch schon vor einigen Jahren gelebt, dann aber wieder in die Sicherheit von Jobs gewechselt. Diese Sache braucht etwas Zeit anzulaufen und wir arbeiten mit Hochdruck daran. Uns fehlt effektiv das Geld für ca  zweieinhalb Monate. Wenn diese Kampagne erfolgreich ist, klappt alles und wir sind im Rennen für die restliche Welt.

Kein Geld..

bedeutet nicht dass du uns nicht unterstützen kannst. Teile unsere Kampagnen auf Facebook,  Google Plus und den vielen anderen Netzwerken. Indiegogo hat dafür eine Funktion auf der Seite. Erzähle auch deinen Freunden von uns, denn oft muss nur die richtige Person von einem Projekt hören. Auch damit hilfst du uns sehr und wir sind dir sehr dankbar.
Solltest du trotzdem finanziell weiterhelfen wollen, aber kein Paypal Konto besitzen, schreib uns einfach eine email (summersun.at@gmail.com) wir finden sicher eine Lösung. 
Go Indiegogo go - please keep us going :)


English description:


Around..

the world, that's the plan. We, Andrea and Klaus Gattringer both thirty-three years old from Innsbruck/Austria, married for a year and a couple for twelve more, have started to turn this plan into reality. Having adventures, seeing the world as it really is, meeting people to tell their stories. Travelling without prejudices,to say yes more often then no, that's what we have set out to do and what we have done up until now. And we want to bring Austria on the landscape, as a friendly country with friendly people.

For Two months and 13.000 kilometres...

are we on the road now and have had many adventures. Frequently we reached our limits, physically as well as psychologically. Both good and bad, and we have grown with it. What we lived through is captured in film, photo and whenever we have sufficient internet we blog, post to Facebook and Instagram. 

And we want to go on.

Sponsoring / Crowdfunding

Unfortunately we have a problem because one of our sponsorings did not work out. But giving up was never an option for us and we don't start now.  For this reason we have decided to start a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo.

Our goals

A big milestone for us is reaching South East Asia  (Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, ...), this is the main goal of this campaign. We just left the north-east of Kazakhstan and we are back in Russia. Ahead of us there are eight thousand kilometres through Russia, the hardly developed Mongolia and the restrictive China. If this campaign overshoots the campaign target the money is invested into the transfer to South America, with Australia in between. The trip through China (veeeery expensive) is already paid by us . If the crowdfunding fails, this money is lost which would be very sad.

  • At the end of our trip we are going tell the story of our journey as a book and a movie. Free, for everybody. We will post it on Youtube, Facebook, Amazon and all other platforms we can lay our hands on
  • The book will be available in English as well as in German and the movie will have subtitles wherever necessary in English.  
  • Our second goal is to represent our country. The small, beautiful Austria. We, both proud of our country, want to show Austria as the friendly country, with friendly people it is.

For our sponsors

Naturally we want to give something back for the money we get. Movie- and book credits are a part of it, as well as advertising spaces on our car. 

The body of the car is covered in 4000 stickers (sticker bombing). Because of its "design" the car gathers curiosity everywhere, its photographed and filmed all the time. The cow skull we found in Kazakhstan and mounted to the hood just adds to its fabulous design  and is the icing on the cake.

For our sponsors we have reserved spaces in the side-windows of the car, the rear window and on the hood of the car. Individually we can make a deal for a whole window, or a part of it (please contact us).

The solar panels in the side windows, which are no longer working,  will be clad with felt, like you see in one of the pictures. So your ad will be much more accentuated.

According to this also the foil on the hood will be removed. On the dark grey surface a colourful ad will be nicely visible. 

With us your advertising or a message goes around the world, as part of a unique car and an amazing journey.

We can print a graphic you mail us on our Canon Selphy Photoprinter and glue it into the car. If you prefer to send us a sticker we are going to provide you with the adress of an accomodation, most likely in Russia, where we stay for a timeframe to fetch parcels. As shipment service we recommend DHL or FED-EX.

Notice for our English sponsors: 

To avoid confusion we put the perks (Indiegogo packages) only in German online. We will happily explain the details of the packages individually in English, please contact us on 

summersun.at@gmail.com


Other possibilities

What else can we do? A proposal for your girlfriend, written into the sand of a beautiful lonely beach, photographed, filmed, cut and send to you? Pictures from a beautiful place you always wanted to see yourself? Or do you want  to challenge us (you don' t dare to...) . Everything is possible. Write us on 

 summersun.at@gmail.com

and we'll see what we can do.

How do we use the money?

For 8000-9000 km, the next milestone of our journey which lasts for 2.5 months, we need approx 1000 EUR for gas. 

Then we need some visa for SEA - we budget 400 EUR for them. 

Our monthly costs of living are approx. 900 EUR. 

This sums up to 3650 EUR for 2.5 months, the rest is for Indiegogo fees


Our mission

Apart from having adventures we want to make the world more tangible, far from news which live from telling bad things, far from the mainstream. We want to show friendship and beautiful nature, great places, the usual and the unusual things. 

We want to help building bridges. Bridges to countries, places and people one never sees in the news, a tourist will never see either. To accomplish this we have our car, a Chrysler Voyager AWD, equipped with everything we need for our daily life.

Austria isn't a well known place

Our second goal is to bring our country, Austria, on the maps. The small, beautiful Austria. With a lot of pantomime, Google Translate and the classic dictionary we have described a lot of times where to find our little alpine republic and that there are no kangaroos around.

Whilst in bigger towns some people may know where to put us, we are the gossip of the day in smaller towns and villages. We shake many hands and hug a lot of people. The very first Austrians some people may ever have met where friendly and we hope that this sticks to the mind.

Are there any risks?

  • Its possible that our car gets damaged to the point of destruction, by an accident or due to a mechanical fault. This would be bad for our sponsors with advertising on the car, but sadly it can happen and it is a possible risk. Within the last thirteen thousand kilometres the only major problem we had was a broken drive shaft, but there is no guaranty.
  • we can't collect enough money and have to turn around. Even the fastest way home is a distance of over seven thousand kilometres where the car gets seen. Stories are sufficient enough for a book as well as a movie, as we have so far collected over 500GB of data. 
  •  we have to stop because of illness, leave the car behind and fly back home. For the transport and all costs related to illness we have an insurance. In this case we will try to come back and travel on as soon as possible. We are still not tired of travelling.

What happens after South East Asia?

And how do we pay for the journey, as we want to go all around the world. 

We have prepared a source of income via the internet. This source works well and we used to live on it some years ago, but later changed into the security of jobs.  But this source needs some time to kick off and we work on it all the time. We effectively lack the money to get us through a time frame of approximately two and a half months.  If this campaign is successful, the rest works out and we are back in the race to go around the world.

No money..

doesn't mean that you can't support us. Share our campaign on Facebook, Google Plus and the many other social networks. Indiegogo has a function to that easily directly on the page. Tell your friends about us, sometimes just the right person needs to hear about a project at the right time. You help us a lot this way, thanks so much.

Do you want to help us, but have no paypal account - no problem, send us an email (summersun.at@gmail.com) we will definately find a solution. 

And now - go Indiegogo go, please keep us going  :)
