story:
Welcome to  Pirates of Adventure Alley (Pirates of the Devils Gauntlet)

A Veteran Rehabilitation, Adventure at sea on a real  pirate ship "GALLEON", Aboard we will have 6 veterans, counselors and a overly qualified crew that specialize in helping people with PTSD, PTSI, Alcohol, Street Drugs, Prescription, Drugs, Disfigurement, Depression, Loss of family and Friends. 

Our main goal is to help our Veterans regain control of their lives by giving them a place to go, get help, in a relaxing environment while they learn how to navigate and maintain a real pirateship. 

The reason for the reality show is so the audience is made more aware of the hardships that are plaguing this country.  This show is the first and only one of its kind offered where healing comes as an adventure while learning the skills needed to be a ships crew member and real life hands on training.

Our show is planned for 45mins, one night a week for 12 weeks that is 58 days aboard the ship.  In that time you will get updates on how our veterans are doing, what they have learned so far and each one has an option to tell their story and what they want to work on being on the show. The crew will be on board the entire time getting the help they need just like in a facility. But no locked doors, no bars on the windows, not hospital gowns or anything to make our veterans feel demeaned in anyway.  

We will have modern staterooms, fully functioning facilities, comfortable beds, fresh food, friends, the ability to leave the show at any time if it becomes to much, and a safety net of people waiting to help continue the healing process long after the show is over. 

There will be no drugs, alcohol, or weapons. We have licensed medical staff that will be on board 24-7 and a chaser boat for emergencies. 

We have Plotted our course!! 

Starting from Belize heading south along the caribbean coast, to Panama we make a historical trip through the Panama Canal with our galleon, then make our heading toward Jamaica, through the Bahamas, To our final Destination in Key West Florida,  This Voyage is scheduled for 58 days, god and weather willing. 

 All we want to do is to help people overcome  the hurt and get back to the life they love.  

No one is left behind nor will they ever be forgotten. 

Help us aid in the recovery of our Veterans. 

Thank you for your support


WGA NUMBER IS 1722108

story:
In Short

My name is Jonathan Nosan. I have been a professional contortionist for 20 years and teaching internationally for 10 years. I’m 46. When I started training at 22 I couldn’t touch my toes. My handstand took 3 years to learn--the flexibility and strength developed methodically though my training with Mr. Lu Yi in San Francisco. Like many of my students, I didn’t have a natural flexibility; but I did have the drive and desire to physically push myself to an extreme I knew I could possess.

In celebration of two decades of contorting I will film and release five 50-80 minute videos for the public to share my knowledge: 1. Contorture™ Technique 2. Inversions 3. The Contorture™ Chamber: a full start to finish group class 4. Weighted Stretching 5. Inner Sanctum: Breaking down the moves in my act. These videos will be available as a 3 Workshop Series and a 5 Workshop Series depending on your level of masochism by online streaming and/or downloads.

This project is important to me. Performing and teaching my art sparks my soul, and I hope to help safely spark, ignite and light your Contorture™ path of extreme flexibility training. From here will follow Contorture™ Teacher Certification programs and who knows...maybe Contorture™ Chambers in your neighborhood.

But first, please contribute to my campaign to make this possible for me and my team to create this program of safe, methodical and deep training. Thank you so much in advance for your love and support! Without you this wouldn't be possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down now:

The films will be shot in Nashville Tennessee because its the Music Capital of the World. It is also much less costly than shooting in New York City.  We have a top notch crew, cast and location in place--an 1885 tobacco, jam and hosiery  warehouse renovated to create a complete experiential and inspirational product bringing you right into our Contorture™ Chamber.

This is way beyond setting up an iPhone and pressing record or hiring a Fitness Video Production House. We are creating personal training sessions with Jonathan and four demonstrators/students for you to learn and train together with--all the  bells and whistles of fitness films created on a super slim budget.  

  • The Cost Needs are simple: location rental, equipment (3 cameras, lighting, sound), director, assistant director, producer, gaffer, boom operator, editor, hair, make up, demonstrator/actors, assistants, cost of insurance, pre and post production...oh and we can't forget...taxes, legal, web and crafty (food).
  • When you donate to help us cover those costs then you will receive a perk--a present, a gift! We have sweet perks ranging from virtual high fives to awesome swag, private Skype lessons, and getting the Workshops before it is released to the public!! 
  • Okay. So lets say that we don't reach our goal. That would be sad, but okay. We will utilize the funds graciously received and make it anyway! We will not give up. This is happening and we are incredibly excited!

The Impact

This is a very special and important project to me. While touring the world I’m able to lead workshops and train individuals from circus, pole dance, fitness, and yoga disciplines and inevitiably their “aha” moment arrives—discovering a new pain free way of extreme movement, backbending, balance, counterbalance, and breath control. 

I now have the time and connections to create a video series which will show and share my method of instruction and training in an environment and aesthetic you would expect from me.

This truly will be a workshop program I wholeheartedly can present to you in response to the years of requests for training, advice and guidance. 

So who is this Jonathan Nosan??

Originally from Mt. Pleasant Michigan, Jonathan’s flexibility is not natural.  He was simply well trained. 

After graduating U.C. Berkeley in Asian Studies and Geography he was awarded a Fulbright to Japan to conduct research toward his PhD in Design of Sacred Space of New Religious Movements.  His second research year was spent in a wood cabin with an outhouse in the Northwest Mountains of Kyoto. It was during that year he changed course from academics to acrobatics after seeing a Chinese Contortionist in Nagasaki and a Canadian Clown in Tokyo.

Jonathan moved to Manhattan in 1998 and has since developed a unique performance and teaching style.  His work has been featured in film, fashion, television/commercials and on stage.  2010 brought the premier of his performemoirt piece BAGABONES and is currently touring the world with the spiegeltent spectacular LIMBO.  He is president  of Acroback Productions, a performance design firm catering to international galas and events. 

He is an avid ceramacist at Mud, Sweat and Tears studio in Manhattan.

JONATHAN'S TEACHING/WORKSHOP (partial) HISTORY: 2014 International Contortion Convention (ICC) Cologne Workshops, 2012 ICC Las Vegas Workshops, Circus Warehouse NYC, Body & Pole NYC, Zurich Mystique Pole, Circus Adelaide Workshop, London Contorture at The Place, Sankalpah Yoga NYC, Pure Yoga NYC Workshop,Radu, Fly Fitness NYC, Crunch Gym Soho, International Pole Convention 2011, Still Mind Zen Center NYC. 


Risks & Challenges

Just like with anything there is always challenges and risks that arise. When filming there is always something that comes up.

  • No matter what the risk that presents itself we can handle it. We have put together a team of professionals that are familiar with the risks and challenges of making a film. With a team of qualified film makers we can handle anything and make this happen!
  • We have come up with a plan to be ready for any challenges. While filming we have put together a small team of Production Assistants to face all challenges head on so that we do not lose any valuable time while filming. Because remember.. time is money!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and any other social media site to help get the word out. You can also send it out via email to all of your friends! And don't forget word of mouth! Tell everyone you know.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Need more reasons why you should donate? Okay.. Don't take it from us, Take it from them!

"Jonathan Nosan is an unbelievably supple contortionist, flicking his legs over his head like a human scorpion in an act that feels more related to German expressionist cinema than Cirque Du Soleil."  -London Evening Standard (Limbo)

"Jonathan Nosan can bend it better than Beckham, tucking his legs over his head as if his spine was made of rubber and scuttling about like a human arachnid."  -The Telegraph (Limbo)

"It is as if yoga, mime, butoh, acrobatics and contortion had all been ingeniously crammed into the meat grinder of physical theatre to create an original and exciting new art form..."  -Robert Lepage (Bagabones)

"A truly amazing contortion who provides the show with its single most disturbing image." -The New York Times (Twyla Tharp’s The Times They Are A-Changin’)

"Like any athlete, Nosan broadens what we think the human body is capable of, and shows us that it is possible to push beyond what we believe to be the physical limits of this world."

  -nytheatre dot com (Bagabones)

Still not convinced? What???

Then just donate because Clover the Beagle says so...

Don't take it from us, Take it from them!"Jonathan Nosan is an unbelievably supple contortionist, flicking his legs over his head like a human scorpion in an act that feels more related to German expressionist cinema than Cirque Du Soleil."  -London Evening Standard (Limbo)"Jonathan Nosan can bend it better than Beckham, tucking his legs over his head as if his spine was made of rubber and scuttling about like a human arachnid."  -The Telegraph (Limbo)"It is as if yoga, mime, butoh, acrobatics and contortion had all been ingeniously crammed into the meat grinder of physical theatre to create an original and exciting new art form..."  -Robert Lepage (Bagabones)"A truly amazing contortion who provides the show with its single most disturbing image." -The New York Times (Twyla Tharp’s The Times They Are A-Changin’)"Like any athlete, Nosan broadens what we think the human body is capable of, and shows us that it is possible to push beyond what we believe to be the physical limits of this world."  -nytheatre dot com (Bagabones)Still not convinced? What???
Then just donate because Clover the Beagle says so...

story:
Where's Your Boyfriend is a romantic comedy about a girl named Maggie. She's a young career oriented young woman on a mission... well sort of. After non-stop pressure from her mom to finally meet a guy, she finally does, well, sort of. Maggie invents ‘Jeffery’ to finally get her mom off her back. Hilarity ensues when she finds herself in a race against time to find a real life Jeffery. With the help of her best friend, Stella, Tinder, and a slew of New York City’s most “eligible”bachelors, can she find the man of her dreams or will she have admit to her mother that she has been lying all along?

This story was inspired by the lovely ladies in my life (hola!) and pretty much every person who has asked me when I'm getting married (you know who you are). I had the amazing opportunity to work with screen writer, MIchael Panes. So far the feedback has been spectacular! Regardless of age or ethnicity it is something everyone can relate to. And seriously, who doesn't love a romantic comedy?! 


Listen, making a short film ain't cheap! My short is estimated to cost about $8,000...... minimum! Luckily, I have already raised a good portion of the funds.

By giving to this campaign, I will be able to make my film amazing. This includes hiring professional actors, crew and equipment. I want the best for my production and crew! Every donation counts! Here are several specifics that I need help funding: 

    TALENT: In order for this become a success, I need to hire 8 actors and a full crew. These talented artists deserve an amazing experience as well and I want to pay them for their talents and skills.  They will show up and give their best and the least I can do is give them my best too!
    PRODUCTION COSTS: I will need to rent out several spaces, equipment, wardrobe, and props. I want my vision to be executed to it's fullest extend. No one likes a bad romantic comedy!

    TRANSPORTATION    : This one is simple. I need to get a bunch of equipment and people from location to location. 

    FOOD: I don't want to starve anyone on set. They are taking time out of their busy schedules to help an up and coming director. The least I can do is feed everyone decent food!

Alas! I will be giving a little something back for the donations. I want to express my gratitude and show how much this really means to me! This ranges from date nights to personal thank you's. 

Any additional money that is raised that will not be used, I will donate to NO MORE, a public awareness and engagement campaign focused on ending domestic violence and sexual assault. NO MORE seeks to break social stigma, normalize the conversation around domestic violence and sexual assault, and increase resources to address these urgent issues. 

"Where's Your Boyfriend" celebrates love, freedom and healthy relationships. Unfortunately many people will experience some sort of domestic abuse in their lifetime.  For example, 1 in 3 teens experience sexual or physical abuse or threats from a boyfriend or girlfriend in one year.  This is mind blowing and something that needs to be talked about!




Still not convinced? I get it! I've never directed a film but I am hardworking and driven! I raised more than half of the funds needed in less than two months!  With my background in design, advertising and production, I have already developed an eye for direction, the ability to stay on budget and schedule and how to lead a team. There is not doubt in my mind that "Where's Your Boyfriend" will become something more than a student short. So I ask you, take a leap of faith and believe in me! Jump in and become a part of something exciting!


Can't donate? It's ok! There are other ways you can help! You can turn this campaign into something much bigger!

Please take a moment of your time and share this campaign! Tell everyone you know! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, or your choice of social media. Send it to your friends, family and co-workers! It’s important I get my story and team known. Hey! I might even be able to raise and extra few bucks! Let's make like Kim K and break the internet!

Jump in and become a part of something exciting!

    

Can't donate? It's ok! There are other ways you can help! You can turn this campaign into something much bigger!

Please take a moment of your time and share this campaign! Tell everyone you know! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Tumbler, or your choice of social media. Send it to your friends, family and co-workers! It’s important I get my story and team known. Hey! I might even be able to raise and extra few bucks! Let's make like Kim K and break the internet!

story:
Menschenhandel ist einer der profitabelsten Geschäftszweige überhaupt

Der  jährliche geschätzte Umsatz erreicht mittlerweile ca. 7 Milliarden Euro - genauso viel wie der internationale Drogenhandel.

Aber Menschenhandel besteht nicht nur aus solch abstrakten Zahlen, sondern ist schon längst Teil unserer nahen Umwelt. So befindet sich zum Beispiel nur 130 Kilometer von Regensburg entfernt, sechs Minuten Fahrt nach der deutsch-tschechischen Grenze, Cheb, der größte Kinderstrich Europas.

Menschenhandel wird durchaus in Reportagen und in Printmedien thematisiert. Aber dennoch glauben die meisten Menschen, dass so etwas niemals in ihrer Nähe passieren könnte. Unser Ziel ist es, einen möglichst realitätsnahen Thriller zu zeigen. Die Figuren sind ganz normale Menschen, die mit den grausamen Methoden des Menschenhandels konfrontiert werden. Es sind eben keine Film- oder Actionhelden und trotzdem sind sie in der Lage, das Leben von Menschen zu retten.

Wir alle können helfen, indem wir einfach nicht mehr wegsehen!

Durch das Bewusstsein und die öffentlichen Debatten wird es den Tätern viel schwerer gemacht, ihre Machenschaften zu verbergen.

Wenn ihr mehr über Menschenhandel erfahren wollt, informiert euch über die Internetseite des KOK (Bundesweiter Koordinierungskreis gegen Menschenhandel e. V.). Hier findet ihr genaue Informationen und Initiativen in Eurer Nähe.


Durch Eure Unterstützung können wir den Film realisieren!


Wer ist mit dabei?

Als Schauspieler:
Stephan Zinner (Dampfnudelblues, Tatort, Polizeiruf, Söder beim Nockherberg)
Klaus Stiglmeier (Tatort, Rosenheimcops, Hubert und Staller)
Helmut Schwaiger (z. B. Synchronstimme in Toy Story 3)
Anna Maria Sturm (Polizeiruf 110; Gestern waren wir Fremde; Beste Zeit; Beste Gegend; Beste Chance)

Mit dabei ist auch ein Song von Mathias Kellners neuen Album "Zeitmaschin", das im April 2015 erscheinen wird.


Sponsoren

Wir haben das große Glück bereits einige Sponsoren gefunden zu haben, bei denen wir uns an dieser Stelle sehr herzliche für ihre tolle Unterstützung bedanken möchten:

- Buchbinder Autovermietung: Egal was geht – Buchbinder bewegt

- Bischofshof Brauerei

- Central Hotel Jakob Regensburg

- Ristorante Pizzeria Taormina

- Wein, Olive und mehr

- Piratenhöhle Musik Cocktail Snackbar

- Café Sofa / Die Couch

- Blutdruck Fashion

- Spitalkeller Regensburg

- Orphée Hotel & Restaurant

- Markt Regenstauf

- Biederer: Der Küchenspezialist

- Bistum Regensburg

- Blumen Pappenheimer

- Bauhaus

- Bayern WC

- REWE

Was aber auch zu einem guten Film gehört, sind die Kamera- und Lichttechnik. Hierbei müssen wir leider mit harter Münze bezahlen. Da eine kinotaugliche Kamera (RED Epic Dragon + Zubehör) viel Geld kostet, haben wir beschlossen, das Equipment zu mieten. Hierbei kommen uns die Verleiher Matthias Fleischmann und Thomas Spitzbart preislich sehr entgegen (vielen Dank für Eure tollen Angebote).
Zudem können wir auf eine revolutionäre neue Technik für ferngesteuerte Kamera Dollys zurückgreifen, die uns von der Firma Innok Robotics zur Verfügung gestellt werden!
Außerdem müssen wir das gesamte Team anreisen lassen, unterbringen und versorgen.

--> Hierfür brauchen wir Eure Unterstützung!

Wir haben euch ganz besondere Pakete als Gegenleistung für Eure Hilfe geschnürt, die euch bestimmt viel Spaß und schöne Stunden bescheren werden.

Wer nicht über indiegogo spenden kann, weil er kein Paypal-Konto oder keine Kreditkarte hat, kann uns auch durch eine Überweisung helfen. Bitte im Verwendungszweck das jeweilige "Perk" und eure Mailadresse angeben, damit wir euch kontaktieren können!

Kontoinhaber: Constantin Weber
IBAN: DE76120300001035778636
BIC: BYLADEM1001

Verwendungszweck: "Perk" + "Mailadresse"


Waldsterben - Der Film

Ein aufrüttelnder Thriller über zwei Jugendfreunde, die bei einem Wandertrip eine Mädchenleiche finden und dabei Frauenhändlern in die Quere kommen.

Die beiden Jugendfreunde Alex und Chris vermissen die gute alte Zeit. Von den „Jungen Wilden“ ist mittlerweile durch quengelnde Kinder und kränkelnde Eltern nicht mehr viel übrig. Also beschließen sie ihre gemeinsamen Erinnerungen bei einem zweitägigen Survivaltrip im bayerischen Wald neu aufleben zu lassen.

Nach einem stundenlangen Marsch mit intensiven Gesprächen entspannen sie am nächtlichen Lagerfeuer. Als Alex austritt um seine Notdurft zu verrichten, macht er einen grausigen Fund: Die Leiche eines 14-jährigen Mädchens.

Von einem Unbekannten verfolgt, versuchen sie sich durch den Wald zurück zur Straße zu kämpfen. Die grauenhafte Nacht überstanden, hoffen sie auf Hilfe in einer Blockhütte. Doch dort entdecken sie ein Gruppe verängstigter osteuropäischer Mädchen. Unter Beschuss ihres Verfolgers und dessen Komplizen können Alex und Chris den Mädchen zur Flucht verhelfen. Doch Irina, zu schwach und verletzt, muss von Alex huckepack getragen werden.

Schaffen es Chris und Alex den Fängen der Frauenschleuser zu entkommen und Irina zu retten?


Warum wir es schaffen...


... weil wir den absoluten Willen haben dieses Thema so weit wie nur möglich ins Gespräch zu bringen. Keine Hürde ist uns zu groß!

... weil wir von allen Seiten bereits auf viel Verständnis und Interesse für das Thema Menschenhandel gestoßen sind.

... weil wir Schauspieler gefunden haben, denen das Thema ebenso am Herzen liegt wie uns.

... weil wir ein professionelles Team zusammenstellen konnten, das wegen der Begeisterung für das Thema bereit ist die Gagen hinten anzustellen.


Produzent Constantin G. M. Weber / Regisseur Lars Smekal


Unser wunderbares Team:

Lars Smekal (Regie)
Dennis Mirza (Regieassistenz)
Katrin Krause (Regieassistenz)
Constantin G. M. Weber (Produzent)
Jana Rippel (Produktionsassistenz)
Christina Berger (Produktionsassistenz)
Barbara Vöckler (Aufnahmeleitung)
Wing Lim Cheung (Setrunner)
Bernhard Schinn (Kamera)
Juri Lotz (Kameraassistenz & Licht)
Korbinian Altenbuchner (Kameraassistenz)
Jacob Linhard (Digital Imaging Technician)
Elina Reimche (Szenenbild)
Markus Albert (Ton)
Michael Bohne (Tonassistenz)
Josephine Berger (Kostümbild)
Christian Dronia (Schnitt)
Annika Suu (Schnittassistenz)
Konstantin Holl (VFX)
Etienne Hestermann (Grafik & Titledesign)
Nicola Reitmeier (Sounddesign, Sound-Editing, Dialouge-Editing  & Surround Mix)
Alexander Urban (Standfotograf)
Johannes Lang (Komponist Filmmusik)


Andere Wege, wie ihr helfen könnt

Vielleicht könnt ihr keinen finanziellen Beitrag leisten, das heißt aber nicht, dass ihr nicht helfen könnt:

  • Sprecht mit den Leuten in Euerer Umgebung und macht auf unsere Film aufmerksam
  • Sprecht die Leute darauf an, unsere Seite bei Indiegogo zur weiteren Information zu nutzen

Das war's auch schon und so kann uns jeder eine große Hilfe sein.

Schaut nicht weg!

story:
* For those of you who are uncomfortable paying online, you can send a check to:

Catherine Peters, PO Box 74, Kenoza Lake, NY 12750

WHAT IS THE STORY OF BARNBURNER?

Barnburner is a nail-biting drama about the struggles of a young girl, ANDY (20), aspiring to be a boxer against all odds. Living in an abusive home with her younger brother,CODY (8),  Andy struggles to follow her dreams while maintaining the responsibilities of an older sister. This film is not just about getting up from one more punch of an opponent, but rather over coming the punches of life which all of us have struggles with. 


WE NEED TO RAISE $4,500 TO MAKE THIS PASSION PROJECT POSSIBLE AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!


WHY?


ABOUT THE CREATOR OF THE FILM:

Catherine Peters is a senior drama student at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. She has studied acting in New Studio on Broadway, Stonestreet Film Acting School, and The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute. During her time at NYU she has been largely involved in both the theatre and film community doing works such as Melancholy Play, Trojan Women, The Bacchae 2.1, The Hamilton House, and The Bumblebees. She has been trained in stage combat for over 3 years as well as multiple mixed martial arts.

This is the first short film that Catherine has written and she is looking forward to starring as the role of ANDY in "Barnburner."


What is a Barnburner?

A barnburner is a very good fight; one that is very intense and exciting, a real nail-biter. It is a fight that is so close it's hard to predict who will come out the winner until seconds before it ends. The film was written with the exact intention that with life we never know what we are going to get and we must over come the uncertainty and strive for greatness.


LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION:

Catherine comes from a family of five in small town Jeffersonville, NY. As a drama/film student she has always wanted to utilize the many beauties that the Catskills have to offer. She will be shooting her film on Peters Rd. which was named after her family.


In Memory of: 

"See this, watch out for this!" -Libby Manzo "Pop"

The film is also a tribute to Catherine's grandfather, Liberato "Libby" Manzolillo. Also a native to Jeffersonville, he was known for his brief, but stellar career in boxing. Under the tutelage of Ray Shaara, he was a Golden Gloves champ in the late 40s and early 50s. Fighting under the name of Libby Manzo, he had more than 28 professional bouts, entering the ring with the likes of Paddy DeMarco and Sandy Saddler. He had a cadre of loyal fans who regularly traveled to New York City to watch him fight. He entered the service in 1952 and traveled throughout Europe coaching a U.S. Army boxing team while stationed in Germany.

What We Need & What You Get

Making movies is an expensive endeavor. Because the production will be filmed in upstate NY, we need funds to help cover the cost of lodgings for a 8 person crew for four days. In addition, we also need funds to help accommodate 3 actors during the duration of the shoot.  We need funds for truck and pass van rentals to transport the crew and equipment to our location in the Catskills. 
It doesn't end there. The items listed above are needed for just the production of the film, now for post-production costs.  The post-production costs include editing the footage, coloring, sound mixing, and sound design. Also, we want to create room in the budget for festival fees. 
Let's Break it Down....
Funding to make this film possible:
  • Air BnB for four days for crew
  • Hotels for three nights for the actors
  • Food for actors and crew for five days
  • Gas money
  • 16 foot truck rental for five days
  • Pass van rental for five days to transport crew to Catskills location
  • Production Design: props, costumes, etc. 
  • Camera accessory rentals
  • Coloring for post-production
  • Sound design 
  • Sound mixing
  • Festival Fees

Total: $4,500

HOW TO DONATE?

  • PERKS= different amounts of $$$ to donate
  • You choose your PERK
  • All donations are securely saved in a PayPal account
  • All donations are used for the film and ONLY the film.

The Importance of the Film

This film means so much to everyone on set. We all have a deep connection to the character's and their story. The creation of this film will not only be a calling card for the crew and great reel material for the cast, but as a way for each artist to full stretch their abilities of expression.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you still want to help, but don't feel like donating, that's ok!

There are plenty of other ways to help, like donating any boxing equipment, snacks, and/or water for the crew.
story_txt:
* For those of you who are uncomfortable paying online, you can send a check to:
Catherine Peters, PO Box 74, Kenoza Lake, NY 12750
WHAT IS THE STORY OF BARNBURNER?

Barnburner is a nail-biting drama about the
struggles of a young girl, ANDY (20), aspiring to be a boxer against all odds. Living in
an abusive home with her younger brother,CODY (8),  Andy struggles to follow her dreams while
maintaining the responsibilities of an older sister. This film is not just
about getting up from one more punch of an opponent, but rather over coming the
punches of life which all of us have struggles with. 




WE NEED TO RAISE $4,500 TO MAKE THIS PASSION PROJECT POSSIBLE AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!

WHY?

ABOUT THE CREATOR OF THE FILM:

Catherine Peters is a senior drama
student at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. She has studied acting in New Studio on Broadway, Stonestreet Film Acting School, and The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute. During her time at NYU she has been largely involved in both the theatre and film community doing works such as Melancholy Play, Trojan Women, The Bacchae 2.1, The Hamilton House, and The Bumblebees. She has been trained in stage combat for over 3 years as well as multiple mixed martial arts.



This is the first short film that Catherine has written and she is looking forward to starring as the role of ANDY in "Barnburner."

What is a Barnburner?
A barnburner is a very good fight; one that is
very intense and exciting, a real nail-biter. It is a fight that is so close
it's hard to predict who will come out the winner until seconds before it
ends. The film was written with the exact intention that with life we never
know what we are going to get and we must over come the uncertainty and strive
for greatness.



LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION:
Catherine comes from a family of five in small town Jeffersonville,
NY. As a drama/film student she has always wanted to utilize the many beauties
that the Catskills have to offer. She will be shooting her film on Peters Rd. which was named after her family.






In Memory of: 

"See this, watch out for this!" -Libby Manzo "Pop"

The film is also a tribute to Catherine's grandfather,
Liberato "Libby" Manzolillo. Also a native to Jeffersonville,
he was known for his brief, but stellar career in boxing. Under the tutelage of
Ray Shaara, he was a Golden Gloves champ in the late 40s and early 50s.
Fighting under the name of Libby Manzo, he had more than 28 professional bouts,
entering the ring with the likes of Paddy DeMarco and Sandy Saddler. He had a
cadre of loyal fans who regularly traveled to New York City to watch him fight.
He entered the service in 1952 and traveled throughout Europe coaching a U.S.
Army boxing team while stationed in Germany.
What We Need & What You Get
Making movies is an expensive endeavor. Because the production will be filmed in upstate NY, we need funds to help cover the cost of lodgings for a 8 person crew for four days. In addition, we also need funds to help accommodate 3 actors during the duration of the shoot.  We need funds for truck and pass van rentals to transport the crew and equipment to our location in the Catskills. It doesn't end there. The items listed above are needed for just the production of the film, now for post-production costs.  The post-production costs include editing the footage, coloring, sound mixing, and sound design. Also, we want to create room in the budget for festival fees. Let's Break it Down....Funding to make this film possible:

Air BnB for four days for crew
Hotels for three nights for the actors
Food for actors and crew for five days
Gas money
16 foot truck rental for five days
Pass van rental for five days to transport crew to Catskills location
Production Design: props, costumes, etc. 

Camera accessory rentals
Coloring for post-production
Sound design 

Sound mixing
Festival Fees
Total: $4,500HOW TO DONATE?
 PERKS= different amounts of $$$ to donate You choose your PERK
All donations are securely saved in a PayPal account
All donations are used for the film and ONLY the film.


    The Importance of the Film  This film means so much to everyone on set. We all have a deep connection to the character's and their story. The creation of this film will not only be a calling card for the crew and great reel material for the cast, but as a way for each artist to full stretch their abilities of expression.   Other Ways You Can Help If you still want to help, but don't feel like donating, that's ok!There are plenty of other ways to help, like donating any boxing equipment, snacks, and/or water for the crew.

story:
Daily Galaxy Radio, which will premiere on June 25, 2015, is an advertising-free global initiative tailored for the mobile era by the creators of dailygalaxy.com, a widely popular news site about the discoveries and events in space, science, and technology that are changing our understanding of our planet and the universe.

Curious about the origins of life? The quantum fabric of spacetime? The odds of life on Jupiter's "ocean moon," Europa? About a solar system with Earth-like planets formed at the dawn of our galaxy? About our human destiny in the cosmos? 

Sign up for our June lift-off today, and join us on our voyages of discovery.



An Immersive Experience

Daily Galaxy Radio will feature the major news and images of the day and easily digestible audio and video interviews in a beautiful graphic environment with the world's leading astronomers, astrobiologists, physicists and cosmologists -- the men and women behind the news who will bring the cosmos to life with stories of their discoveries and insights. 

Our podcasts and "Starship One" interactive community forum will function as a think tank devoted to brainstorming the ultimate "why" questions, with emphasis on questions of existence, such as the origin of the universe,  the search for life beyond Earth, the nature of time, and the destiny of the human species.



We'll also cover important works of science fiction, both book and film. We're totally in sync with Ridley Scott,  Christopher Nolan (Interstellar) and Kurt Vonnegut in their love of sci-fi authors. 

"You're the only ones zany enough to agonize over time and distance without limit, over mysteries that will never die, over the fact that we are right now determining whether the space voyage for the next billion years or so is going to be Heaven or Hell."

 – Kurt Vonnegut, God Bless You, Mr. Rosewater



Refreshing Advertising-Free Environment

It's been our experience that advertising has become increasingly more annoying and intrusive, as well as just plain ugly. Especially in audio.

In contrast to ad-supported dailygalaxy.com, Daily Galaxy Radio will be a refreshing advertising-free audio and visual experience, accessible via smartphone, tablet, or desktop, created by Val Landi, one of Silicon Valley's Internet radio pioneers (see "Our Story" below).

The Cosmos Live! Daily for $2 a Month

Our radio programming team will reach out for daily interviews with the people --today's explorers of the universe -- making the news and discoveries that are shaping our destiny. People such as:



  • Dimitar Sasselov (pictured above), Director of the Harvard Origins of
    Life Initiative and author of The Life Of Super-Earths, who suggests that intelligent life may be in it's "very young" stage in the observable Universe.
  • Paul Davies, physicist and astrobiologist and director of Arizona
    State University's BEYOND: Center and author of The Eerie Silence: Renewing Our Search for Alien Intelligence, who thinks that advanced civilization
    may have technologies that have moved beyond matter as we know it. 
  • UCLA Galactic Center's Andrea Ghez, one of the world's leading experts on
    our Milky Way Galaxy's supermassive black hole. 

The PERKS: Our "YOU" Engine

We suspect you might not need another tee shirt, tote bag, or poster. Our perks are designed to invite YOU to participate in powering Daily Galaxy Radio by contributing compelling content such as our daily Scoop!, Street Views, The SciFi Signal, Today's Big Number. 

Your contributions will be converted to both audio and text and streamed with your byline, posted on our dailygalaxyradio.com home page and global contributors page, which will be tweeted to our highly-engaged Twitter community (338,000) and posted on our Facebook timeline (25,000) to provide the widest audience possible.


The "Street Views" are simple smartphone or tablet-created interviews. Think: street reactions to a major discovery or event in science or space. These will be streamed in both audio and/or video formats and posted to our website, Twitter stream, and YouTube channel. An example would be an opening night "Street View" of Ridley Scott's The Martian (above), about a manned mission to Mars starring Matt Damon, scheduled for release this November.

We think this is a pretty cool "WOW" factor. Use your imagination, have fun, get published, and be recognized for your creativity and talent. All contributors will have a byline credit and a listing on the Daily Galaxy Radio homepage under "Contributing Editors." 

                                           

                              

    

Each of our perks is wrapped around a core number of annual subscriptions, one for you, the balance to give out to friends and family as gifts.

All perks selected include a beautiful "I Helped Bring the Cosmos to Life," digital badge (actual size above) for your Facebook page, website,  or Tweets. 

Our Goal:  5,000 "Lift-off" Subscribers

Your pre-launch order will help us reach our June Liftoff goal. All Daily Galaxy Radio one-year subscriptions may be renewed in June 2016 at the same Indiegogo pre-launch $24 offer (a 30% discount off our post-launch subscription price). We'll email you your password and simple instructions to access the site on our June launch, along with an "I Helped Bring the Cosmos to Life" digital badge for your Facebook and Twitter pages.



When we meet our goal of 5,000 founding subscribers, in addition to our regular daily programming, we'll create a weekend call-in talk show and reach out to several of the most engaging astrobiologists to host weekly "Insight" programs focused on the search for life both in and beyond our solar system.  

We'll be recruiting the best radio-host talent on the planet for our daily programs from several centers of astronomy, origins of life, astrobiology, astrophysics and cosmology, including MIT, Caltech, Princeton, Stanford, ASU, Colorado, Washington, Arizona, Harvard, Oxford and Australia National University. (Please throw your hat in the ring if this sounds like you!)



The Daily Galaxy (dailygalaxy.com) has operated on a breakeven budget since its launch in 2007 from revenue generated by advertising networks run by AOL, TechMedia, and COX Digital Media that place their ad campaigns on the site and take 50% of revenue earned. 

But starting an advertising-free daily Internet radio program is a major commitment that requires serious global support. Reaching our initial subscriber goal of 5,000 subscribers will underwrite our first year's operating expenses through breakeven, including website and Apple iTunes Store and Google Play app development.

Our "Galaxy" DNA 

What makes us unique? In words representative of our Twitter community: it's the "best of the news about all things cosmos" and "awesome graphics." 


Here's a small sampling of the discoveries, events, unsolved mysteries, and big questions we covered on dailygalaxy.com the past year.  

  • NASA: "Life May Exist in the Milky Way that Dates Back 11 Billion Years" 
  • "ATTEMPT NO LANDING THERE" --New NASA Mission to Europa will
    Ignore Arthur C Clarke's Warning 

  • "6EQU35" The Signal from Cosmic Depths That Might Have Changed Human 

    Civilization 

  • Ancient Antarctic Lake Provides Clues to One of the Unsolved Mysteries
    of Early Earth
  • "The Scaffolding of Our Universe Is Being Slowly Swallowed by Dark Energy"
  • "The Messier 67 Mystery" --Is Our Solar System an Orphan from a Distant
    Star Cluster?  


  • The Hunt for Colossal "Quark" Stars -- Do They Exist? 
  • "Detecting Alien Life from a Single Pixel of Light"
  • Vanished! Mystery of Europa's 200-Kilometer-High Geysers
  • Cosmic Glow Discovered -- "Radiates More Light than All the Known Galaxies in the Universe"
  • Enigmatic Object -- "It May Be a Supermassive Black Hole Ejected Into
    Deep Space"

Twitter Plus: Our Social Media Building Blocks 

All the social-media building blocks are in place to promote and grow Daily Galaxy Radio. Following our June launch, "Galaxy" radio subscribers will be recruited from our dailygalaxy.com site and our social media communities: Twitter (338,000 followers) and Facebook (25,000 followers).   

   

Our vibrant Twitter community, growing organically at approximately 1,000 new followers per week, includes many of the world's leading astronomers and scientists, astronauts, space observatories, news organizations, universities and governmental space organizations such as NASA, JPL, ESO, SETI, Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics (CfA), International Space Station, ULCA Galactic Center Group, Max Planck Institute, and Royal Astronomy Society members, as well as celebrities from Mia Farrow to Kevin Spacey, musician David Crosby, and Gary Busey.   
   

                           

The Daily Galaxy Google Analytics statistics for the past 30 days reflect the solid foundation and springboard we've built over the past seven years to launch Daily Galaxy Radio: Pageviews 585,000; Sessions 333,000; Unique Users 258,000. We expect our audience reach to eventually double after the launch of Daily Galaxy Radio.

The Daily Galaxy In the Press

                  

             

Our Story :  "Something Incredible is Waiting to Be Known"

So whose idea was this anyway? It was Val Landi's, that's me, the founder and publisher of The Daily Galaxy -Great Discoveries Channel, which I launched In 2007, when I moved from San Francisco to Park City, Utah, site of the 2002 Winter Olympics, to live in a beautiful alpine environment,  reduce expenses, and publish dailygalaxy.com.

The idea for dailygalaxy.com was inspired years ago, when I read Carl Sagan's Cosmos cover to cover several times. Sagan's comment about the mind-boggling mysteries of the universe, "somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known" gripped me and planted the seed to someday create a venture dedicated to space news and the search for life in the universe. 


This early interest in "all-things-space" was reignited by my classes with Bernard "I.B." Cohen, professor of the history of science emeritus at Harvard, and one of the world's leading experts on Isaac Newton. 

My experience with Internet radio began when I was recruited in 1998 from Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen's Interval Research venture in Palo Alto to join the startup team at Looksmart.  

At Looksmart, an early Google competitor and search directory for Microsoft MSN, I incubated and founded Redband Radio, a Silicon Valley venture-capital and Sony-funded company in partnership with Public Radio International, Expedia, XM Radio, and the Sundance Film Festival. 



Redband was the Web's first major Internet radio site with an amazing all-star team I recruited from NPR, CBS, and CNN, and amazing programs on science and technology, music, film, finance, and travel. Sadly, Sony and our venture-capital investor had us shut Redband down in early 2002 when the U.S. economy went dark, some six months after the tragedy of the World Trade Center attack of 9/11.

After the closure of Redband,  I was invited to serve as an advisor to the board of directors of Pandora Internet Radio, which transformed "radio" as we know it with the arrival of the iPhone in 2007.  

Fast Forward to Today...  

Fast forward to today, seven years after its launch ...more than fifty percent of dailygalaxy.com's traffic comes from Apple iOS and Android smartphones and tablets via Barcelona-based Marfeel Mobile (view via smartphone or tablet) as well as a free app in the Apple and Google Play stores. 


Industry experts say that 2014 was the year Internet radio "came of age," with the widespread adoption of iOS and Android subscriber-based premium apps and advertising-free audio offerings from Spotify, Pandora, and Sirius XM Radio.   In 2015, there will be more listening hours as the world shifts its listening habits to Internet radio, due to increased mobile use and convenience. 

2015 is shaping up as the inflection point, the perfect moment to launch Daily Galaxy Radio.
                            

The BIG Challenge 

To launch Daily Galaxy Radio, we invite and cherish support  from  enthusiasts and fans around the world who want to help us "Bring the Cosmos to Life" by featuring the stories of the men and women behind the great discoveries changing our knowledge of the universe and ultimately enhancing our odds of survival as a species.

                

 "Since, in the long run, every planetary civilization will be endangered by impacts from space," wrote Carl Sagan in The Pale Blue Dot, "every surviving civilization is obliged to become spacefaring--not because of exploratory or romantic zeal, but for the most practical reason imaginable: staying alive... If our long-term survival is at stake, we have a basic responsibility to our species to venture to other worlds." 

THANK YOU for your enthusiasm and support! We look forward to your participation and feedback about our exciting new venture.  And, please help us spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.

Meet Our Office Mascot --Cairo the Pug (AKA Agent "C") -He let us know (don't ask!) that if you've ordered your Pre-Launch Subscription, you can watch his all-time favorite space-adventure video here. Now, that's a Perk!


Audio and Video Credits

With thanks to NASA/Hubble Space Telescope, ALMA Observatory, The Amnis Initiative, TED, California Institute of Technology, The Science Foundation, Nour Foundation, SETI Institute, American Museum of Natural History, The University of Edinburgh. Our thanks to imgkid.com for use of the "dark energy" balloon image.    

The men and women behind the voice-overs in our video in order of appearance included NASA's Chris McKay, Neil Turok (author of Beyond the Big Bang), Jill Tarter, Maggie Turnbull,  and Jim Holt (author of Why Does the World Exist). 

The main video image at the top of the page is "Pandora's Cluster," where the Hubble Space Telescope picked up the faint, ghostly glow of 200 billion outcast stars ejected from ancient galaxies that were gravitationally ripped apart several billion years ago.

story:
"Win. No matter what. Win, at all costs..."
Check out Driven on Facebook.

Short Summary

Driven is the tale of Harry Lennon, son of deceased Formula One champion Jack Lennon, a young man racing in go karts with the aspirations to become world champion in the pinnacle of motorsport, F1. Taking place at the beginning of the intercontinental class championship, young racers are all jostling to be noticed by team talent scouts to be fast-tracked to the top. In a climate where results and stunning lap times can be the winning ticket, Harry is stuck at the back, unable to fund a reliable program and facing accusations of being too old against his junior competition. To complicate matters for Harry's personal success, he has a young family to support and an increasing pressure to drop the dream and settle into his Uncle Frank's mechanic business and make a decent wage. Harry thinks he's found a way to make his last chance count, a risk that for him is worth taking and endangering those around him who don't want to lose another father-figure to the sport. 


Driven explores the themes of success versus risk, determination and young fractured families through the exciting backdrop of grass-roots motorsport. The film is a new angle shunning the celebrity culture of the motorsport elite and focusing on a story of a son trying to emulate a father by doing what he loves and disregarding the consequences. As my final year film at Bournemouth University, Driven reflects a combination of passions and an opportunity to channel my learning into an authored entry to the short filmmaking space. I really think this story belongs on the screen and I think it is more than just a film about 'boys and their toys', Harry's actions have consequences for his girlfriend April and his son Sean, a powerful dynamic of the drama we are intending to show. I can't wait to start making this film and I think it will be a highly valuable experience for everybody involved and I'd love to take you to the starting grid with us!

Any contribution no matter the size is highly valued, myself and the crew will be highly thankful of any generosity towards the project. Please don't feel pressure to donate, but sharing this page and our Facebook page on social media and word of mouth goes a long way, so if you are able to help in that way thank you so much! And if you've read something that's inspired you with ideas and you want to know more, please email me at tomjimp@aol.com, I'd love to know any thoughts you have on how we can make Driven the best that we can. Likewise as this is so motorsport based, please share this with enthusiasts in that area, we want to make a film that represents why I personally love the sport so much and would love to do that for even one other person out there!


The script is currently in development and we will reveal more as updates during the  pre-production, production and post stages. But for now let's have a chat about logistics, where your donations will go and what we need to make this film a great experience for all.


What We Need & What You Get


When making a film, costs are a big consideration for us as we want to ensure any money received is spent in areas that will contribute the most to the film in the most successful way. As always, we will be looking to keep costs down without losing any of the crucial aesthetics of the film. Money that is raised will be put towards elements of the film that are essential in any production and will mean the film will be as successful as possible.

Locations: 

Finding the appropriate locations is very important to the story of this film. As the film is based around go-karting, a race track with an authentic racing look is going to make a huge difference but will most likely come at a cost. By contributing to the project you will ensure we are able to afford the locations along with a small number of others which, as mentioned, will make a huge difference to the film.

Travel:

Getting between locations is something that needs to be made as easy as possible. A multitude of cars will be needed to ferry the crew, cast and kit between locations and this cost can begin to grow depending on distance between locations. Whilst we will aim to keep this to a minimum it is an important consideration and we aim for journeys to be as smooth as possible which your contributions can help.

Catering:

Keeping the cast and crew motivated on set can normally be solved with a hot meal and drink. Some of the money raised will be put towards catering to ensure everyone is always provided with lunch and dinner as well as drinks when necessary.

Accommodation:

At the end of a long shoot day, everyone will need somewhere comfortable to sleep before the next day. When it is not possible to find locations nearby to home, suitable accommodation needs to be taken into consideration. This is something that is of the upmost importance for taking care of the cast and crew which is, as always, a priority.

Costume and Make-Up:

As mentioned, keeping the film feeling realistic and authentic is something that we are keeping as a priority. During the racing scenes, racing costumes will be essential to keeping to the feel of the film and whilst we hope that our locations may be able to aid us in terms of props and costumes, there is always the possibility we will have to fund this ourselves.

Camera Hire:

We intend to hire a camera with the money raised from this campaign. More news on this will follow, as our DOP is particularly keen to utilise a camera setup which both reflects the high-speed action of the racing sequences and is capable of heightening the family drama aspect of Harry's story. 
The Crew
In addition to the bio's seen below, we have a fantastic camera team of second operators and AC's as well as a team of production assistants. They are all specialists in their respective fields and have produced high-quality work in the past. Working alongside them I can testify that our crew will be incredibly hard-working and motivated towards delivering Driven to screen. Our new graphic designs will also be done by the fantastic Nicole Cook, stay tuned to see those soon!

Tom Parratt - Director/Editor

Tom has been a fan of motorsport for most of his life, mostly due to having a dad obsessed with all things motoring. An education such as this led to stories of heroic Formula One drivers of the past, flamboyant mavericks and idols who would risk their lives on the track. Tom quickly became fascinated by the drama of motor-racing, ideas such as the underdog success story and the hair-raising comebacks of racers carving their way from the back of the pack to the lead. As Tom became invested in filmmaking, a passion to bring motor-sport to screen became a big part of the development of his final Television Production short film at university.

Tom has specialised in editing and sound and during his time at university has produced and directed a number of extracurricular projects as well as university films. Tom's work experience has included stints at UK digital production companies as well as incorporating live events work, such as working as a Video Playback operator at the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow for Great Big Events. In the summer of 2014, Tom had an opportunity to realise a dream of sorts and have a week of work experience at a Formula One broadcasting company. This has further confirmed Tom's dedication to making Driven a high-action drama which juxtaposes go-kart racing with a classic pursuit of success narrative. 

Tom is very excited to bring all that he has learnt at university to Driven and to helm a crew of motivated and talented individuals passionate about the project. The film is more than a university film for Tom, as he has ambitions to take the film on a festival run and showcase is abilities to potential employers. If you would like to see Tom's directing and editing work, here is his showreel.


Rebecca Houston - Producer

Having loved television for many years, Rebecca is currently in her final year, studying BA (Hons.) Television Production at Bournemouth University. 

Rebecca has produced a multitude of works whilst at University from drama to documentary to studio shows. Her most recent work includes directing a studio morning programme “Morning Rush” which involved two well known Sky News presenters and working as a PA on "Film Focus", a film discussion studio show with director/producer Tom Parratt. Rebecca has previously worked for companies such as Talent TV South and has also worked at the Commonwealth Games with Tom as a live vision mixer. Rebecca is excited to work with Tom again and ensure that Driven reflects Tom's vision for the film and will bring the script to life. 


Jamie Burns - Scriptwriter

Jamie is a Bournemouth University graduate with a BA (Hons) in Scriptwriting for Film and Television.
Within university several of his screenplays were forwarded for production and produced within the course. He was involved in both the editing and soundtrack of his short film “Annabelle”, and his 60 minute drama “Psychic” reached the penultimate stage of the BBC writer’s room competition.
He is currently working with aspiring writers towards pitching a television series, along with practicing script reading as a potential career in mind. Jamie is also involved in acting and has featured as a lead in an MA film production, garnering experience on both sides of the creative process. Tom and Jamie have common ground in their paths to Bournemouth University which has produced great ideas for the script and the story of Driven. 


Douglas Benge - Director of Photography

Douglas is passionate about visual story telling. Coming from a photography background, he soon realised the delight of the motion picture industry, and in particular, the art of cinematography. For Douglas, each shot should exist as a photograph, a visual treat; this is what he aims to create in his work. 

Douglas is currently in his final year at Bournemouth University studying BA (Hons.) Television Production. As well as making films at University, Douglas has worked as a runner on two music videos produced by Kode Media; working with the artists ‘Meridian Dan’ and ‘Enter Shikari’. Douglas was also the second camera assistant for a music video featuring the artist ‘Xilent’, produced for UKF Dubstep. Douglas has worked in the grip department on a television drama for ITV, produced by the production company Kudos. The camera department is where Douglas feels at home; he enjoys the technical side of camera operating, and looks to provide the best and most suitable image possible for the story that is being told. He has worked with Tom on a number of projects, and is looking forward to collaborating with him again for the film ‘Driven’.

Josh Wright - Assistant Director

Josh is a final year Television Production student at Bournemouth and a talented writer and production manager. Josh has worked with Tom on a number of projects including most recently in the same team working at the 2014 Commonwealth Games. Josh has also undertaken work experience at Left Blank Productions and Hattrick as well as shadowing runners on programs such as DCI: Banks and Have I Got News For You?  Josh is highly regarded for his attentiveness and idea-generating on shoot and will be a fantastic addition to the crew when ensuring Driven sticks to schedule. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can donate then that is fantastic but if you can't and still want to support, there are ways you can help! 

-Sharing the page & Facebook page

-Sending any advice or possible assistance you could think of (contacting me at tomjimp@aol.com might be a good way to do this).

-We are currently sourcing racing outfits for go-kart drivers of the 18-25 age category. We would be looking for overalls, gloves and possibly helmets. If you have anything of use then please contact!

Spreading the campaign through word of mouth does wonders, so please feel free to do so!

Final words from the Director...


THANK YOU!!!

We appreciate you reading this page. If you are interested by the film in any capacity please feel free to message either Tom or Bex (rebecca.houston@live.co.uk). If you are able to donate your generosity and kindness if hugely appreciated, it means a lot to the team. We hope to put on a cracking race for you and make a film which you will thoroughly enjoy watching! 

All the best,
Tom Parratt

"Win. No matter what. Win, at all costs..."

Check out Driven on Facebook.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

Cameron Jackson

Writer - Co-Executive Producer

 Cameron Jackson is a graduate of Elon University where he majored in Communications with a concentration in Cinema. He also completed a professional program in Screenwriting with UCLA. He strives to use his voice as a writer to cultivate  unique perspectives of minorities.

Maria Simone

Director – Editor – Executive Producer 

A native of North Carolina and graduate of Hampton University, Maria started her career in Los Angeles as a Film & TV editor. Maria's calling as a filmmaker stems from her desire to see genuine portrayals of women and minorities in media.

She strives to create visually stimulating imagery that pushes the boundaries of standardized content.

             


Cameron and Maria are two filmmakers who came together with the objective of creating their own content to catch the attention of Hollywood. Their plan is to put together a pilot presentation. 

What is a pilot presentation? A pilot presentation in essence, is a micro pilot. It provides the audience a glimpse of the setting, characters and overall plot of the series. Once shot we'll have a visual to go long with our pitch to networks. The goal is to generate enough buzz from the pilot presentation to warrant funding for full pilot commitment. 

WHAT IS Gossamer about?

Gossamer delves into the ties that bind us to one another, honing in on the negative ramifications of social media on a college campus.

                          


Three friends create a virtual "little black book" as a social experiment for class, however when they decide to take the experiment out of the classroom the results prove deadly. Their presentation poses the questions: What if we knew who our peers had been with? What would that reveal about them? How would that affect our current and future relationships? How much does social media influence our daily life? And have we taken it too far?”

When one is found dead of an "alleged" suicide, the remaining friends must ban together to track down who killed them and why. After Benji is found dead of an "alleged" suicide, Sasha and Zach must ban together to track down who killed them.

Sasha

A brilliant and quick-witted student, who strives to get out of the shadow of her overbearing mother. Once she's set her mind on something there's no stopping her. She’s wedged firmly somewhere in between Olivia Pope and Veronica Mars.


Benji

Ambiguously European model. All eyes are on him when he enters a room. His good looks and charm are disguises for his secretive and elusive nature.


Zach

On the exterior he's the average fratty college guy. On the inside, he's struggling to find himself and impress his suppressive father.


WHY ARE WE DOING INDIEGOGO?

The purpose of this campaign is to garner the funds necessary to create the high quality concept envisioned by the producers.

If a 100 people donate $80 dollars, we'd reach or goal. 

Funds raised will go toward equipment rental, permits, insurance, locations, wardrobe, hair and make up, editing and score. All of these items can add up, and with help from generous donors and sponsors we can check them off our lists. Quality is key and the production team want to make sure they can create the best content possible.

HERE'S WHERE YOU COME IN!

Social media is huge. You can help us out by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and by checking out our website.

 You can also sponsor us, which can take many forms. We need locations, props, catering, advertising, equipment etc.

 We are also still looking for more awesome individuals to add to our cast and crew. If you are interested, email us at gossamertheseries@gmail.com . 

 We are currently in pre-production and production is scheduled to begin in early spring.

story:
Hi, I'm Beth Perry! And I've been leading a digital study for the past two years in our local congregation with some great results! Now, I'm ready to take it out into the larger world and I need your help with the start-up and first year costs!

  • What We Need & What You Get

  • To give this project time to get off the ground, I need to be sure I can cover the costs without charging so much that people can't afford to participate! So this campaign is designed to cover some one-time costs and then the basic first year costs.

What We Need
From the past two years' experience, I know that I need to have multiple points of entry for this project: text, web, and print. I'll need new software or texting  service to handle more people, my website will need an upgrade to handle fees, and a book version will include several publishing costs, such as an ISBN number!
Then there will be on-going costs for the first year: internet and phone service, plus online payment fees and marketing costs. 


What You Get
Now, the fun part for you.... Well, you get to be part of the first run of The Study! You'll get free time in the project - the more money you donated, the more time you can participate! You can also get a free copy of the book - and if you donate a lot, well, you can get it all with a t-shirt thrown in for good measure!

What I Get
The great part of this campaign is that even if I don't reach the goal, I can still use the funds. The Study will be happening no matter how much the campaign brings in so even less than the full need will help propel the program a little into the future! 
And, if we should go over the goal.... well, here's the exciting part to me! I want to ultimately have The Study available as an app! I don't see anything like this already available already so I think there's a niche just waiting to be filled! But I also don't see anything out there that I can copy to fit the study's format. So I'm going to need to hire someone to write the app for me... which could be a big investment. 


The Impact

I think there can be a strong impact from The Study! People who take the time to look around them and see places where they can matter in the world - put their spirituality into action - well, they can (and do) change the world! We can build a community of people doing that in the same way over a large area - making their faith live in their community and relationships - and we can have an impact! 

Imagine not just reading a bit of scripture but finding a practical way to live it out! Imagine not just talking about some news but taking action in your neighborhood! Imagine not just listening to what someone else is doing but finding ways to join in! 

I've seen this happen in small ways in the project I've been doing for the past two years - people have just amazed me with their creativity and insights! So I know this can happen in The Study as well.


Risks & Challenges

Now, I know there are challenges here... It's a fairly simple sounding project with a lot of moving parts! But I've been managing most of them for the past two years and I will follow that successful process! And risks: I have already put a lot of time and money into the past version and into The Study without earning a cent from it! I could continue to do that and find I've made a mistake. But this project has been so much fun since the very beginning that I've been "paid" in many other ways. And I have to believe that The Study will enrich me (while never making me rich!) at the same time it enriches you! That's worth the risk!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can contribute here - others just can't! But that doesn't mean that any of you are unimportant here! Pass the word, check out the website, like my page on Facebook, follow me on Twitter... and if you're interested in doing a digital ministry within your church, I'd be glad to talk with you about how you can do that!


"Each and every time, I have found the Judson Study to be a welcome Light in what can be a hectic, unfocused moment in life!  I love that the texts come in early (though never TOO early) in the day, so that I have that reflective moment while commuting to work/when waking up.  Every pondering really helps me to step aside, get out of my own way, and really look at life in a way that makes me remember, and more readily see, the blessings which everything truly is." Chris
story_txt:
Hi, I'm Beth Perry! And I've been leading a digital study for the past two years in our local congregation with some great results! Now, I'm ready to take it out into the larger world and I need your help with the start-up and first year costs!



What We Need & What You Get

To give this project time to get off the ground, I need to be sure I can cover the costs without charging so much that people can't afford to participate! So this campaign is designed to cover some one-time costs and then the basic first year costs.

 What We Need

From the past two years' experience, I know that I need to have multiple points of entry for this project: text, web, and print. I'll need new software or texting  service to handle more people, my website will need an upgrade to handle fees, and a book version will include several publishing costs, such as an ISBN number!
Then there will be on-going costs for the first year: internet and phone service, plus online payment fees and marketing costs. 






What You Get
Now, the fun part for you.... Well, you get to be part of the first run of The Study! You'll get free time in the project - the more money you donated, the more time you can participate! You can also get a free copy of the book - and if you donate a lot, well, you can get it all with a t-shirt thrown in for good measure!
What I Get
The great part of this campaign is that even if I don't reach the goal, I can still use the funds. The Study will be happening no matter how much the campaign brings in so even less than the full need will help propel the program a little into the future! And, if we should go over the goal.... well, here's the exciting part to me! I want to ultimately have The Study available as an app! I don't see anything like this already available already so I think there's a niche just waiting to be filled! But I also don't see anything out there that I can copy to fit the study's format. So I'm going to need to hire someone to write the app for me... which could be a big investment. 

   
The Impact
I think there can be a strong impact from The Study! People who take the time to look around them and see places where they can matter in the world - put their spirituality into action - well, they can (and do) change the world! We can build a community of people doing that in the same way over a large area - making their faith live in their community and relationships - and we can have an impact! 
Imagine not just reading a bit of scripture but finding a practical way to live it out! Imagine not just talking about some news but taking action in your neighborhood! Imagine not just listening to what someone else is doing but finding ways to join in! 
I've seen this happen in small ways in the project I've been doing for the past two years - people have just amazed me with their creativity and insights! So I know this can happen in The Study as well.

   Risks & Challenges
Now, I know there are challenges here... It's a fairly simple sounding project with a lot of moving parts! But I've been managing most of them for the past two years and I will follow that successful process! And risks: I have already put a lot of time and money into the past version and into The Study without earning a cent from it! I could continue to do that and find I've made a mistake. But this project has been so much fun since the very beginning that I've been "paid" in many other ways. And I have to believe that The Study will enrich me (while never making me rich!) at the same time it enriches you! That's worth the risk!
    Other Ways You Can Help
Some people can contribute here - others just can't! But that doesn't mean that any of you are unimportant here! Pass the word, check out the website, like my page on Facebook, follow me on Twitter... and if you're interested in doing a digital ministry within your church, I'd be glad to talk with you about how you can do that!

"Each and every time, I have found the Judson Study to be a welcome Light in what can be a hectic, unfocused moment in life!  I love that the texts come in early (though never TOO early) in the day, so that I have that reflective moment while commuting to work/when waking up.  Every pondering really helps me to step aside, get out of my own way, and really look at life in a way that makes me remember, and more readily see, the blessings which everything truly is." Chris

story:
My name is Valerie, and I am a victim of bullying!

I decided to do the toughest thing I think I have ever done… Bare my soul. I am telling my story in hopes that it will help others. I decided to create this film based on my life. Being bullied as a child/teenager doesn't mean it stops and can be forgotten as a child/teenager. A bullied child/teenager still grows up and carries the stories, memories and emotional scars with them. There is life after high school. You just don't hear about how an adult deals with their tortured memories. This is where I come in.  I will be the voice for those who haven't found theirs yet or can't because they though suicide was the answer to getting away from their day to day torture. 
When faced with a bully from the past, or even knowing they are in the same room, you probably shut down and immediately become that innocent child/teenager back in school where you were a victim with no voice. YOU ARE NOT A VICTIM ANYMORE! You can get through it and make peace. You can build the life you always wanted for yourself.

About My Film BAGGAGE

Amber looks beautiful and unscathed on the outside. Unbeknownst to her, her confidence will soon dwindle. She is bombarded by a group of kids who think they rule her schools hallways. These kids are relentless and torture Amber. Their bullying tactics of hurtful words and actions will be the end of Amber’s beautiful soul and innocence. 
Amber keeps seeing this mysterious hooded girl. The girl is seen carrying suitcases everywhere she goes. Amber is curious about what is in them. Why is this hooded girl always around? Will Amber be able to escape the humiliation and cruel attacks toward her?



The Financial Investment

I have been extremely lucky with being able to take advantage of my really good friends who are very talented. They have donated their time to help bring my film to life! 
The $2,000 will go to all the film festivals I will be submitting to this year. Each time you submit a film into the festivals, there is a submission fee of $50-100 (depending on the festival). Here is the list I would like to submit to:

*FF = Film Festival

U.S. Festivals - Long Island FF, Sundance Festival, AFI Festival, Los Angeles FF, Tribeca FF, Telluride FF, Seattle International FF, Slamdance FF, Chicago International FF, Austin FF, St. Louis International FF, Cineques FF, Atlanta FF, Santa Barbara International FF, Rhode Island FF, Florida FF, Nashville FF, Hamptons International FF, Los Angeles International FF, Heartland FF, Starz Denver International FF, Woodstock FF, Hawaii International FF, Fort Lauderdale International FF, Mill Valley FF, San Diego FF, Cleveland International FF, Fort Lauderdale International FF, Philadelphia FF, New Orleans FF, Stony Brook FF, CineVegas International FF, Bumbershoot 1 reel FF, and World Arts FF

Overseas Festivals - Cannes FF (france), Short film Festival (france), Toronto International FF (Canada), Montreal World FF (Canada), Flickerfest International Short FF (Australia), Melbourne International FF (Australia), Sydney FF (Australia)


My Educational Program

I plan on using this film as part of my Anti-Bullying Program that I am creating. I am going to tour the schools all over the country to share my story and to talk about how we can prevent bullying. I will also talk about how the victims can cope with the attacks that have already occurred.  I want to help as many kids, teenagers and adults as possible. I need them to know that they are not alone and that they can take control of their own lives and be happy with who they are. 

Risks & Challenges

I have been extremely lucky with being able to take advantage of my good friends who are very talented and who have donated their time to help me get my film complete. I don't need to worry about editing because I am a professional editor. I will be doing that myself. I just finally got through my challenges of finding a school to allow me to use their building to finish my last scenes that I added to my film. I am very happy to say that I just wrapped up on shooting my film on February 6, 2015!! I am now in the editing room! Stay tuned for the trailer!

THAT'S A WRAP!!!

(The cast of BAGGAGE)

Please Share My Story and My Bully Awareness Film

Whether or not you can contribute financially to my project, I would love it if you would help me get my message out there. The adult side of Bullying is rarely talked about and is overlooked. It is so important for this information to reach other victims that need help. Not only do the victims need to know, todays kids need to understand that the actions and words they choose to use aren't just words… They do hurt! They leave scars that will last a lifetime.


Thank you for taking the time to watch my marketing video and read about my plans on how my film will help bring awareness to bullying from an adults point of view. Let's work together to stop bullies in their tracks!
