story:
What Is 'This Is Not Happening'? 

'This Is Not Happening' is the debut micro-budget feature film from UK Writer & Director Ewan Thomas. 

European in tone but quintessentially British, 'This Is Not Happening' is a dark, naturalistic coming-of-age drama set on the stunning East Sussex coastline. 

The film is a collaboration between Picnic Films and Pins & Needles Media and is self-funded by Director Ewan Thomas.  

We're here on Indiegogo to ask you to join our project and help finish 'This Is Not Happening' in time for our European premiere. 


What's the Story? 

The film tells the story of Chris (23) who after travelling for five years runs out of money in Morocco. Desperate and alone he calls older brother Andrew and asks for money. Andrew instead pays for Chris' flight home and offers him a place to stay with him and wife Emily. Chris' drunken behaviour and constant lying initially cause him problems as he re-adjusts to family life. However his arrival soon causes all three to confront issues they have been in denial of, as Chris realises he is not the only one who has been running from his problems.

The film mixes the story of Cain & Abel with the central idea that you can't run away from grief. 


Why We Need You? 

We've almost finished 'This Is Not Happening' but we've done it with very limited resources. This summer we've been invited to screen at a top UK film festival and we want the film to look and sound like what it is; a great debut British feature film. This is a level of polish we cannot achieve at home.

We also want you as our fans to come to the screenings, to join the team supporting the film and to be there to share in our successes. 

We think 'This Is Not Happening' is a real success story for the team involved and we want you to become part of that story.



What We Need? 

The money raised from this campaign will go directly into completing post-production work on the film, in time for our UK festival premiere. Specifically: 

* A professional Sound Mix 

* Digital Cinema Package 

* Certification 

With all of these in place the film will be finished to a professional standard and we'll be capable of screening the film anywhere in the UK and beyond.


What You Get? 

Aside from becoming an important member of the team by donating to this project, we also have many great, unique perks available.

These include limited edition artwork (including some of the images on this page) with perks also including our exclusive behind-the-scenes making of videos, charting the story of making the film. 

Our top reward tiers give you the chance to meet the filmmakers for lunch or become a producer on the film.


Who Are We? 

'This Is Not Happening' was made by a team led by award-winning Writer / Director Ewan Thomas & Producer Nell Garfath-Cox, who've been making films together for the last decade & been a couple almost as long.

The young and talented cast includes: 
Oliver Malam - Chris 
Hasan Dixon - Andrew 
Sophie Gibson - Emily
Ingvild Deila - Anna 

The film was Executive Produced by Gerry Maguire, from Pins & Needles Media. Gerry's work as a producer has been screened internationally at festivals and recognised by BAFTA. He's a long-term collaborator of Ewan and Nell's and was involved in the project from an early stage.

How Your Support Impacts On Us

With your help we can make 'This Is Not Happening' the well polished professionally finished film it deserves to be. You'll also be helping us compete on a bigger stage and be giving us a valuable opportunity to build industry connections for our next film.

The team behind 'This Is Not Happening' hope this film will be the first of many together, and with your help we can finish this film the way it deserves to be finished.

Risks & Challenges

The Independent film market is incredibly competitive in the UK, that's one of the reasons we want to finish this film to a high professional standard and allow our film to compete. We think we've made something special - an honest, beautiful drama about something real. It's a brave film and one that deserves an audience on the big screen. 

We want you to see it, share it with your friends and become part of something that we've always wanted to do - tell feature length stories. 

A film is nothing without its audience, and that's a big reason for launching this campaign. By building support from people like you, we'll be able to present the project with more confidence and ambition than would otherwise be possible. 

By becoming part of our story, helping us reach our goal and making 'This Is Not Happening' the best film it can be, we stand a good chance of making an impact on the British Film Industry and moving ahead with our careers.


Other Ways You Can Help

By sharing this project on Twitter, Facebook by email or even word of mouth you'll be helping raise the profile of this project. We value every mention and appreciate your support in Making This Happen. 
Please make sure to follow us on our Official Facebook and Twitter pages, too.
Thank you for reading and for your support.

story:
Short Summary

Hi from the Great White North!

My name is Susan and I live in Timmins, Ontario, a bilingual (french/english) mining town about 8 hours north of Toronto. It's surrounded by trees and lakes, there is little traffic and it's community based.

It's important to me to get my campaign funded because it's going to make a difference for four people in my part of the world. 


We are here to help each other and there is enough to go around if we share.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $6,000 to  help two young men get the major dental work they need and cannot afford, a young couple get some furniture in their apartment and lastly to fulfill an older couple's dream. 

One young man is a single dad who works but has no insurance.  He inspires those around him with his kindness and strength.  The other young man faces many health challenges and has no insurance either.  The young couple is struggling, have no money for furniture and they are sleeping and eating on the floor.  The older couple raised 9 children, have faced serious health issues along the way, have been there for others in our community and have never been outside of Timmins.  They really need a break.

I was thinking of what perks I could send you, and the thank you letter and emails with photos is what came to mind, however it seems not enough. I wish t-shirts could go to everyone.  So here I give you my sincere and heartfelt THANK YOU for helping this project come to fruition and I wish you much happiness for your generosity.

Any extra funds raised will go towards Families Needing Help in Timmins, a FB group for helping local families with basic needs.

For those of you who cannot contribute at this time, please spread the word.  That would be an extremely valuable contribution for sure.

Many Blessings!

Susan

story:
Acceptance: The Feature Film

With big dreams for a feature film and a small budget, often times a collaborative effort is necessary to make the film a reality.  An environment where everyone pulls together their expertise to make one fully functioning machine of talent is the best way to make dreams come true on screen.  It just so happens my film has all the components to be the perfect place for collaboration.  I have joined together with the greatest film team and we have an amazing storyline from my book: 'Acceptance'.  Now we need the capital to move forward with our dream of getting this book on the big screen.  As the creator I am relying on the fans to make this film possible.  

                                           

Do you ever think about how a film begins, where the ideas come from?

Do you love films with bigger meanings, which change the lives of viewers forever?

Are you interested in film and movies but don’t know how to get involved?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

First there was The Novel:

                       

   

“Acceptance” is a family drama about love, loss and betrayal and is the first of a series of novels. The novel shows the tragic consequences of secrets and lies and what happens when an ordinary girl is let down and is pushed to extremes by the people she loves – not only by her husband, but her family as well.

The main plot is about Eva and her passionate relationship with husband, Richard, with a back-story about her family history and her mother’s experiences in Nigeria during the Biafran war. As the story unfolds we discover that no one in Eva's life is quite what they seem, and Eva gradually uncovers the truth about their deception with tragic consequences.


Now Comes the Film:

'Acceptance' is currently making waves in the UK, USA and other parts of the world.  'Acceptance' will be officially launched in Lagos & Accra in November 2015. The books shall also be sold and distributed nationwide and other parts of Africa, particularly West Africa.

The story comes in 3 parts. The Part 1 is 'Acceptance', Part 2 is  'Acceptance: Into the Darkness' while the Part 3, the concluding part shall be released before the end of the year.

                                  

 The story is going to adopt into an international standard feature film. International Multi-award winning Script Writer and Director,  Fredi Nwaka AKA Fredi Kruga has converted the story to a screenplay.         


Our popular culture reinforces the idea that films are expensive and difficult to create. We're out to change that fallacious idea with our new feature film: Acceptance. Acceptance is a story filled with trademarks of love, loss and betrayal. Acceptance exists at the core of our being. It is our default status. In order to reach this base level of acceptance, one need only remove the items lying on top. To do this, we must first identify all the things we do not accept around us. Then, one by one, eliminate them.

This I did without so much as a backward glance or afterthought. But the people who hurt me deserved it. After today, no one will ever hurt or crush my world again.  And I believe the storyline in acceptance will strike an emotion and strength in everyone who watches it. It is a story that speaks to mankind’s biggest fears and challenges.

Looking back, I would say I had always been a fighter. And I think many people are, they just do not realize it.  This film can help people connect to their inner fighter.  Never backing down to anything or anyone, never accepting being second best, and definitely never ever letting another person bring me down. Help us establish this film to serve people in need of a new perspective on human growth. As little as $1 gets your name listed in the credits of the film, your name will be forever honored as a contributor. Seeing and being part of this film will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!"


The story of “Acceptance” is one that will resonate with most people who are trying to find strength in a tough place.  The storyline teaches us, as only a few stories can, about the essential wisdom of pushing through when times get tough, learning to fight against all odds.“Acceptance” will bring so many positive messages to people:

  •  Learn about life’s inevitable obstacles
  •  How to persevere with grit and courage
  •  Entertain through universal lessons

When reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a film that needs to be created. We feel these features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed.  This paired with attention to detail and quality filmmaking will send this project to the top of it's genre. Our mission is to create the best film and viewing experience for all fans and enthusiast alike!


We are passionate with creating a film for humanity, this film is meant to bring awareness and hope to people going through tough times. Film has been a tried and true way to bring an issue to the masses.  Films also provide a sense of understanding that not many other media outlets can do. Our goal is to stay dedicated to our mission of perseverance and courage because we know our society will benefit greatly! We have developed a unique script, actors and location that are second to none. Help us make this film a reality and let’s start spreading the word today!

About the Author: 

My name is Ibitola Ojoye-Adebayo, and I am a budding author of contemporary romance – with a twist. I am also a graduate of the University of Portsmouth with a BSc in Pharmacology. I have three beautiful children with my husband and spend my time building online communities through my writing and research. I currently live in the United Kingdom.This project has my heart and soul and welcome and encourage everyone to get involved. My deepest gratitude goes to all contributors, readers and fans.  Thank you.

                                        

AWARDS
Won Diva author of the year 2015 - Divas of colour awards 2015


NOMINATIONS
-Nominated for author of the year 2015 -women4africa awards 2015
-Nominated for Afro -Asia awards 2015 in the category Online Magazine/Blog
-Nominated for author of the year 2015 -Creativity awards 2015


The Director:  

Born Fredi Nwaka,  formerly known as Fredi Kruga, KRUGA  is established as one of the UK’s most prominent and hardworking independent Hip Hop artists performing countless shows and supporting some stellar names in the music industry along the way.

Not only a former rap artist and song writer, KRUGA is also a very talented actor and has worked along some of the big screen names such as Curtis '50 cent' Jackson, Danny Dyer, Brenda Blethyn, Tanner Hussain, Ashley Walters, just to name a few. His acting talents have landed him in feature films such as Deadman Running, Outside Bet, Pusher, The Dark Knight Returns,Tabloid TV, The Gun Runner and he is currently casting for a number of other films due to be released soon.

The recipient of several awards as a respected member of the UK Hip Hop scene; Kruga is also the founder of FathersTogether.co.uk (F2G) and Creatingrolemodels.com and has subsequently made a calculated and impressive switch to independent filmmaking.

                                                                                                                                                                                                          

Fredi’s production company, Gridloc Films has already produced award winning films. In 2013 he won ‘Best Online Community Film’ for London gang inspired ‘IF ONLY’, which was also won him ‘Best script & screen play writer’ at the the 2013 BEFFTA awards. The film picked up nominations in ‘Best Film Director’ and ‘Best short film’. Success followed in 2014, when Fredi won a NEL Award (Nigerian Entertainments and Lifestyle award) for his contribution to film and Media.

The latest release from Gridloc Films, AWOL (Absent Without Love) tells the story of Terrence Powell, who after returning home from fighting in Iraq, finds his fiance in the arms of another man.

You can follow Fredi on twitter

@fredikruga 
@creatingrm 
@gridlocfilms

  • Websites

    • http://www.gridlocfilms.com/

Producer:

Shereen Boucher is the head of Epicum Entertainment, which connects talent, media platforms, film production and distribution. A partnering distributor with Entertainment One with projects such as the award winning “Home Again” and producer of TV and Film projects, she has created a hub to bridge the gap between quality film production between the UK and the US. 

                               

She is currently in pre-production of the controversial story of George Stinney Jr in the epic feature length motion picture “83 Days” as well as a number of other TV and film projects for 2015-2016.

With her recent partnership with the BFI (British Film Institute) and their collaboration to launch the DVD and VOD release of “Home Again” after its theatrical success, her next distribution sign offs are set to be unveiled within the BFI over 2015. 

She also represents a great roster of talent based in the UK, Europe, throughout the United States and Dubai and markets their talent to in-house and commercial projects worldwide.


How you can help!

For us to bring “Acceptance” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to start production. It will assist us with the cost of filming, crew wages and production. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first to see “Acceptance”. We will also use our funding try and extend our audience through the Internet and film festivals.

We will also be using the funding to expand the possibilities for the usage for international distribution, to further work on and edit the first version of “Acceptance” and create additional films that will compliment “Acceptance” series. 

                    

Acceptance is always on the hunt for great new talent. We would also love to hear from sponsors, investors and partners, who could be individuals, private organizations, corporate bodies, Non-governmental Organizations, Charities or the government are hereby solicited for the production, as it is a massive project.  It is seriously worth considering the possibility of partnering with us in this endeavor. We intend to produce a film that is of enormous entertainment value to all.

“Acceptance” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about $464,000  in order to break “Acceptance” onto the market. That will includes marketing, supplies, labor and related expenses for start-up.

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Acceptance” film family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

Word of mouth is essential for crowd funding campaigns. So far, I have relied on my facebook page and my twitter account to spread the word, but I need your help! After you pledge, tell your family and friends about the project. Tell your neighbors! Tweet about it! Facebook it! Social Media a key marketing technique and could be a major factor in the success of "Acceptance-The Movie".

If you wish to contact me:

Website: www.ioadebayo.co.uk

 Social Media Connections:

  Instagram: @ibioadebayoofficial

  Twitter: @ibi_o_adebayo

  Facebook: www.facebook.com/acceptance1.0

  YouTube: ibitola Ojoye-Adebayo

Contact Information

Name: Ibitola Ojoye-Adebayo

Phone Number: 07983220648

E Mail: ibitola@ioadebayo.com

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at ibitola@ioadebayo.com / info@gridlocfilms.com
story_txt:
Acceptance: The Feature
Film
With big dreams for a
feature film and a small budget, often times a collaborative effort is
necessary to make the film a reality.  An
environment where everyone pulls together their expertise to make one fully
functioning machine of talent is the best way to make dreams come true on
screen.  It just so happens my film has
all the components to be the perfect place for collaboration.  I have joined together with the greatest film
team and we have an amazing storyline from my book: 'Acceptance'.  Now we need the capital to move forward with
our dream of getting this book on the big screen.  As the creator I am relying on the fans to
make this film possible.                                             Do you ever think about how
a film begins, where the ideas come from?

Do you love films with
bigger meanings, which change the lives of viewers forever?

Are you interested in film
and movies but don’t know how to get involved?
If you answered, “Yes” to
any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…
First
there was The Novel:                           “Acceptance” is a family
drama about love, loss and betrayal and is the first of a
series of novels. The novel shows the tragic consequences of secrets and lies
and what happens when an ordinary girl is let down and is pushed to extremes by
the people she loves – not only by her husband, but her family as well. 
The main plot is about Eva
and her passionate relationship with husband, Richard, with a back-story about
her family history and her mother’s experiences in Nigeria during the Biafran
war. As the story unfolds we discover that no one in Eva's life is quite what
they seem, and Eva gradually uncovers the truth about their deception with
tragic consequences.Now Comes the Film:'Acceptance' is currently
making waves in the UK, USA and other parts of the world.  'Acceptance' will be officially launched in
Lagos & Accra in November 2015. The books shall also be sold and
distributed nationwide and other parts of Africa, particularly West Africa.
The story comes in 3 parts.
The Part 1 is 'Acceptance', Part 2 is 
'Acceptance: Into the Darkness' while the Part 3, the concluding part
shall be released before the end of the year.                                  
 The story is going to adopt into an international standard feature film. International Multi-award winning Script Writer and Director,  Fredi Nwaka AKA Fredi Kruga has converted the story to a screenplay.         Our popular culture
reinforces the idea that films are expensive and difficult to create. We're out
to change that fallacious idea with our new feature film: Acceptance. Acceptance
is a story filled with trademarks of love, loss and betrayal. Acceptance exists
at the core of our being. It is our default status. In order to reach this base
level of acceptance, one need only remove the items lying on top. To do this,
we must first identify all the things we do not accept around us. Then, one by
one, eliminate them.
This I did without so much
as a backward glance or afterthought. But the people who hurt me deserved it.
After today, no one will ever hurt or crush my world again.  And I believe the storyline in acceptance
will strike an emotion and strength in everyone who watches it. It is a story
that speaks to mankind’s biggest fears and challenges.
Looking back, I would say I
had always been a fighter. And I think many people are, they just do not
realize it.  This film can help people
connect to their inner fighter.  Never
backing down to anything or anyone, never accepting being second best, and
definitely never ever letting another person bring me down. Help us establish
this film to serve people in need of a new perspective on human growth. As
little as $1 gets your name listed in the credits of the film, your name will
be forever honored as a contributor. Seeing and being part of this film will be
life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to
this project today!"The story of “Acceptance”
is one that will resonate with most people who are trying to find strength in a
tough place.  The storyline teaches us,
as only a few stories can, about the essential wisdom of pushing through when
times get tough, learning to fight against all odds.“Acceptance” will bring so many positive messages to people:

 Learn about life’s inevitable obstacles


 How to persevere with grit and courage


 Entertain through universal lessons

When
reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is
a film that needs to be created. We feel these features will make us incredibly
qualified to succeed.  This paired with
attention to detail and quality filmmaking will send this project to the top of
it's genre. Our mission is to create the best film and viewing experience for
all fans and enthusiast alike!We are passionate with creating a film for humanity, this film is meant to
bring awareness and hope to people going through tough times. Film has been a
tried and true way to bring an issue to the masses.  Films also provide a sense of understanding
that not many other media outlets can do. Our goal is to stay dedicated to our
mission of perseverance and courage because we know our society will benefit
greatly! We have developed a unique script, actors and location that are second
to none. Help us make this film a reality and let’s start spreading the word
today!

name is Ibitola Ojoye-Adebayo, and I am a budding author of contemporary
romance – with a twist. I am also a graduate of the University of Portsmouth
with a BSc in Pharmacology. I have three beautiful children with my husband and
spend my time building online communities through my writing and research. I
currently live in the United Kingdom.This
project has my heart and soul and welcome and encourage everyone to get
involved. story:
www.smpte.org/movingimages

Over the course of 60 days, we raised $66,382 from 378 supporters on Indiegogo. In addition, MOVING IMAGES became the #7 most funded film project, from a verified non-profit project of all time on Indiegogo! Not to mention, the additional funds outside of Indiegogo, including our corporate supporters.

This is simply amazing and we could never have accomplished any of this without our supporters!

It was because of the generous of individuals and corporations that this campaign was so successful. Words cannot possibly begin to express how much it means to us, that this project means so much to you! 

We are now gearing up for the exclusive preview of MOVING IMAGES at NAB Show's Technology Summit on Cinema, produced in partnership with SMPTE.

We're showing the world what SMPTE can do, and we're doing it together!

Our most sincere thanks and gratitude,



The MOVING IMAGES Team
www.smpte.org/movingimages


Original Campaign Details Appear Below

Our documentary MOVING IMAGES will explore the excitement surrounding the development of motion imaging technology from turn of the twentieth century through the present while inquiring about what the future has in store. Through interviews with top filmmakers, historians, entrepreneurs, and engineers, the documentary will investigate the influence that art and science have on each other. 

Film and television have been the most popular art form and communication tool for more than 100 years. The Oscar and Emmy Award winning Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers (SMPTE) is an important part of that history. To celebrate our centennial anniversary in 2016, SMPTE is producing a feature length documentary.

Have you ever seen the color bars television test pattern? Watched a live sports broadcast in high definition, or a movie in 3D? Downloaded or streamed content your device? Gone to see a live sporting or music event? Or, used closed captioning? If so, then you've need SMPTE in action!

Where We Are

SMPTE has named motion imaging technology and creative visionary Randall Dark as producer. Howard Lukk, former vice president of production technology at The Walt Disney Studios as director. Chris Kenneally, who is best known as the writer and director for the acclaimed Justin Szlasa and Keanu Reeves produced documentary SIDE BY SIDE, completed the initial treatment for the film. 

The SMPTE Board of Governors  has authorized initial funding for the project, which has included Kenneally’s treatment and Dark’s initial production work. The intent is to produce a 90-minute theatrical feature, as well as an abbreviated television version. 

Media Coverage

Broadcast Bridge: SMPTE Producing Documentary on the Story of Imaging for its 100th Birthday
TV Technology BE Extra: A Conversation with Randall Dark SMPTE chooses industry pioneer for historical production
TVNewsCheck: SMPTE Documentary To Examine Motion-Imaging Technology
RFV: SMPTE Documents Motion-Imaging History
InBroadcast: SMPTE Documentary on Moving Images
BTL: SMPTE to Produce Documentary on the Evolution of Motion-Imaging Technology
Sound & Picture: SMPTE to Produce Documentary on Evolution of Motion-Imaging Technology and the People Behind It
Student Filmmakers: SMPTE to Produce Documentary on Evolution of Motion-Imaging Technology and the People Behind It
Frequency: Moving Images SMPTE Documentary - Richard Welsh, Associate Producer
DisplayCentral: SMPTE Asks for Help in Making Movie to Celebrate 100 Year Anniversary

What We Need Now

In order to continue with the production work required to create an engaging, entertaining, and educational documentary that will appeal to the general public, history enthusiasts, and industry experts, SMPTE is now seeking supporters to underwrite the project. Supporters will become part of the SMPTE legacy of setting the standard for motion imaging. 

SMPTE is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and a portion of your contribution may be tax deductible. Please consult your tax professional for information.

Special Student Offer

Now is a great time to become a SMPTE Student Member! You can get your first year for free through the Student Membership Challenge - Click here to apply. Once you become a SMPTE Student Member, we ask that you pay it forward and select the Student Special Perk to receive the digital download for only $10! Remember, a Student Membership only costs $35, and you'll be receiving that for free! Watch Dr. Corey P. Carbonara, Professor of Film & Digital Media at Baylor University explain more:


The Impact

This project is a valuable contribution to the motion imaging industry. As technology picks up speed and heads toward a diverse, limitless future, it is necessary to reflect on how we overcame challenges in the past. This film will demonstrate how SMPTE's important work on industry education and standards has guided the technology.

SMPTE has played a key role in the evolution of motion picture arts and sciences for nearly 100 years. As the global leader in developing standards and education for the technology, media, and entertainment industries, SMPTE is in an excellent position to produce this film. We have close contacts to the leading industry experts, filmmakers and historians from all over the world. 


Corporate Supporters

Individual Supporters

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word about this exciting opportunity! Share the details of our campaign with your friends and on social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

SMPTE Innovation 

With nearly 100 years of motion-imaging standards leadership, SMPTE is the innovator of some of the most iconic standards for high-quality content, as well as those that are facilitating the transition to an IP-based multiscreen world.

SMPTE Color Bars© Television Test Patterns have set THE consistent reference point for more than four decades to ensure color is calibrated correctly on broadcast monitors, programs, and on video cameras and displayed beautifully for consumers.

SMPTE Time Code© gives every frame of video its own unique identifying number, makes digital editing possible, and enables the association of other data to make audio and video even more meaningful, accurate, and repeatable, whether in post for a major studio release, in hard news environments or live sports production. It even synchronizes music and is often used to automate lighting, pyrotechnics, video, and other effects in live concert production

SMPTE Digital Cinema standards — from those for higher frame rate capture and production, with high-performance, fast compression, and pristine projection, to others supporting efficient, interoperable workflows, better security, and a consistent and engaging movie-going experience — ushered in the era of digital cinema and are enabling its rapid expansion.

SMPTE Timed Text© is accelerating the transition of broadcast content to the Internet and makes it more easily accessible to tens of millions of people in the U.S. with disabilities. SMPTE Timed Text is also the basis for subtitles and captions in the Digital Entertainment Content Ecosystem’s UltraViolet™ format for commercial movie and television content and is used by several video services and Internet video players.

SMPTE Transport of High Bit Rate Media Signals over IP Networks creates a standardized framework for the transport of video over Internet Protocols (IP) networks. This framework is vital for future-proofing content creation and distribution infrastructures as the media and entertainment industries undergo massive transitions to the IP-based enterprises that facilitate multipoint transmission, a critical enabler in monetizing content and advertising in new ways across multiple screens, such as computers, smart phones, and tablets.

About SMPTE 

The Oscar® and Emmy® Award-winning Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers® (SMPTE®), a professional membership association, is the preeminent leader in the advancement of the art, science, and craft of the image, sound, and metadata ecosystem, worldwide. An internationally recognized and accredited organization, SMPTE advances moving-imagery education and engineering across the communications, technology, media, and entertainment industries. Since its founding in 1916, SMPTE has published the SMPTE Motion Imaging Journal and developed more than 800 standards, recommended practices, and engineering guidelines.

More than 6,000 members — motion-imaging executives, engineers, creative and technology professionals, researchers, scientists, educators, and students — who meet in Sections throughout the world, sustain the Society. Through the Society's partnership with the Hollywood Post Alliance® (HPA®), this membership is complemented by the professional community of businesses and individuals who provide expertise, support, tools and the infrastructure for the creation and finishing of motion pictures, television, commercials, digital media, and other dynamic media content. 


More About SMPTE

DisplayCentral: SMPTE Asks for Help in Making Movie to Celebrate 100 Year Anniversary
What We Need Now
In order to continue with the production work required to create an engaging, entertaining, and educational documentary that will appeal to the general public, history enthusiasts, and industry experts, SMPTE is now seeking supporters to underwrite the project. Supporters will become part of the SMPTE legacy of setting the standard for motion imaging. 

SMPTE is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and a portion of your contribution may be tax deductible. Please consult your tax professional for information.

Special Student Offer

Now is a great time to become a SMPTE Student Member! You can get your first year for free through the Student Membership Challenge - Click here to apply. Once you become a SMPTE Student Member, we ask that you pay it forward and select the Student Special Perk to receive the digital download for only $10! Remember, a Student Membership only costs $35, and you'll be receiving that for free! Watch Dr. Corey P. Carbonara, Professor of Film & Digital Media at Baylor University explain more:

The Impact
 This project is a valuable contribution to the motion imaging industry. As technology picks up speed and heads toward a diverse, limitless future, it is necessary to reflect on how we overcame challenges in the past. This film will demonstrate how SMPTE's important work on industry education and standards has guided the technology.

SMPTE has played a key role in the evolution of motion picture arts and sciences for nearly 100 years. As the global leader in developing standards and education for the technology, media, and entertainment industries, SMPTE is in an excellent position to produce this film. We have close contacts to the leading industry experts, filmmakers and historians from all over the world. 
Corporate Supporters







Individual Supporters











Other Ways You Can HelpSpread the word about this exciting opportunity! Share the details of our campaign with your friends and on social media. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!SMPTE Innovation 
With nearly 100 years of motion-imaging standards leadership, SMPTE is the innovator of some of the most iconic standards for high-quality content, as well as those that are facilitating the transition to an IP-based multiscreen world.SMPTE Color Bars© Television Test Patterns have set THE consistent reference point for more than four decades to ensure color is calibrated correctly on broadcast monitors, programs, and on video cameras and displayed beautifully for consumers.SMPTE Time Code© gives every frame of video its own unique identifying number, makes digital editing possible, and enables the association of other data to make audio and video even more meaningful, accurate, and repeatable, whether in post for a major studio release, in hard news environments or live sports production. It even synchronizes music and is often used to automate lighting, pyrotechnics, video, and other effects in live concert productionSMPTE Digital Cinema standards — from those for higher frame rate capture and production, with high-performance, fast compression, and pristine projection, to others supporting efficient, interoperable workflows, better security, and a consistent and engaging movie-going experience — ushered in the era of digital cinema and are enabling its rapid expansion.SMPTE Timed Text© is accelerating the transition of broadcast content to the Internet and makes it more easily accessible to tens of millions of people in the U.S. with disabilities. SMPTE Timed Text is also the basis for subtitles and captions in the Digital Entertainment Content Ecosystem’s UltraViolet™ format for commercial movie and television content and is used by several video services and Internet video players.SMPTE Transport of High Bit Rate Media Signals over IP Networks creates a standardized framework for the transport of video over Internet Protocols (IP) networks. This framework is vital for future-proofing content creation and distribution infrastructures as the media and entertainment industries undergo massive transitions to the IP-based enterprises that facilitate multipoint transmission, a critical enabler in monetizing content and advertising in new ways across multiple screens, such as computers, smart phones, and tablets.About SMPTE 
The Oscar® and Emmy® Award-winning Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers® (SMPTE®), a professional membership association, is the preeminent leader in the advancement of the art, science, and craft of the image, sound, and metadata ecosystem, worldwide. An internationally recognized and accredited organization, SMPTE advances moving-imagery education and engineering across the communications, technology, media, and entertainment industries. Since its founding in 1916, SMPTE has published the SMPTE Motion Imaging Journal and developed more than 800 standards, recommended practices, and engineering guidelines.
More than 6,000 members —
motion-imaging executives, engineers, creative and technology professionals,
researchers, scientists, educators, and students — who meet in Sections
throughout the world, sustain the Society. Through the Society's partnership
with the Hollywood Post Alliance® (HPA®), this membership is complemented
by the professional community of businesses and individuals who provide
expertise, support, tools and the infrastructure for the creation and finishing
of motion pictures, television, commercials, digital media, and other dynamic
media content. More About SMPTE

story:
Hi my name is Tatenda Mbudzi!

I am here because I love movies - and I am making:

THE FIRST EVER AFRICAN TEEN MOVIE & HIGHSCHOOL COMEDY!!... EVER!!! It's also my FIRST EVER FEATURE FILM, it's called:

-----------> ZIM HIGH <-----------


<-- "Interesting ...WAIT! Who is Tatenda Mbudzi again? " -->

(the italicized font between the arrows is your brain. Trust me.)

Oh that minor detail -
  • Tatenda Mbudzi - is the first Zimbabwean to be on stage at the Oscars - and the first of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences Oscar Experience winners in the world. Ever. You know, that competition where they replace the hot models handing out trophies at the Oscars with the most awk-- I mean --most talented students they can find, how fitting that his first feature film is about being a social outcast.

HIS EXPERIENCE

  • Tatenda Mbudzi is the  Producer of a feature film with James Franco - Heyday of the Insensitive Basterds, Associate Producer on a documentary about James Franco - Franco, A Documentary. Yes; he has spent a lot of time with James Franco. (We all have) --- But that's not all - he is the 2012 winner of a Fred Rogers Memorial Scholarship from the Television Academy and Emmy foundation to develop stories related to childhood development. ZIM HIGH is based on one of these two ideas. Twice he has been a semi-finalist for the Sundance International Writers Lab, with the script ZIM HIGH. And now he has decided to make the movie! Also he has worked in script development, marketing and publicity at just about every Hollywood studio known to man: Universal Pictures, Xbox Studios, 20th Century Fox, Focus Features, Sony Pictures Television etc - and he graduated with an M.F.A. in Film, in the Producing Program from the best film school in the world: the UCLA School of Theater, Film & Television.

<-- "Okay, that makes sense - but why now? And isn't making a film really hard?" -->

Why NOW you ask? Well - because :-

It's HIGH TIME we had an African Teen Comedy!!

This is not your regular Teen Comedy, bra, owne, exe.... Better get wise to the lingo if you want to survive ZIM HIGH. This is about surviving high school in Zimbabwe, which is like going to Hogwarts, but instead of magic, there is casual racism!

This is about telling a story with a different point of view - yes film is hard, but it is totally worth it - film is a part of our culture - it helps us connect with our humanity; or lack of it! Movies enlighten us and remind us that we are alive and they create work opportunities in every single sector of industry!


<-- It is high time! What's the story?-->

ZIM HIGH  is Zimbabwe's premier, most prestigious and violent fictional high school. An institution espousing British Post-Colonial excellence. Beneath it’s proper covering however is a violent Darwinian playpen of pure juvenile cruelty.

This is a truly Dark teen comedy. Not just because of the complexion of our characters. No. This is the First African Teen  &Young Adult film of all time. There is no magical device, and no moral compass to protect our  “hero” from the harsh reality of going to high school in Africa, where racial tension and economic instability reign supreme.

How does one escape such an environment unscathed?…Ask TATENDA, our main character a scrawny 17-year-old anime loving bowl of intelligent fear, who desperately and blindly wants to become – a PREFECT (an all powerful student leader) to win scholarships to study anime in Japan; but his chances are dashed when he is framed in an ancient ZIM HIGH bullying tradition - THE GAUNTLET  – in which a student almost dies - out of options he is forced to turn to a rebellious Aboriginal Australian new kid for help with his PREFECT campaign.

This film is about holding onto your dreams, and standing up for yourself before it's too late.


<<--OOOOH That's very cool! - but why Zimbabwe? Or Africa? -->>

  • This campaign is to fund the first ever AFRICAN TEEN COMEDY with a real point of view about being a young person with hopes and dreams in Africa - ZIM HIGH. This is a film from a Zimbabwean, African and  BLACK point of view. As you may well know - such things are rare. Africa is usually mentioned as a throwaway in all your favourite films or tv shows;  or it's the backdrop (literally and figuratively) for some white morally absolving adventure. Nothing wrong with white people adventuring -- just that we never see the black side of things. Rarely are there genuine African characters who are more than joke fodder (Token Characters in for example AMERICAN PIE) or target practice (Black Somali's in BLACK HAWK DOWN) - It's HIGH TIME we saw things from an African point of view. This is a film with African kids in it that are not child soldiers (Except when playing video games); and that do not have flies in their mouths. (It happens to everyone at least once) 
  • The African point of view is distinctly black; but this is not a "fer blacks only" film (those days are over! Right?) This campaign is about embracing African adolescence in all its colors and confusing wonder - and making fun of it in a way that is enlightening, and not completely offensive. This film has attitude. If you don't identify as African, you should care because -
  • There is a severe shortage of black African people on screens. Film language (and European based life languages "black" this and "black" that) for all of known history tells us that African people are less than; uncivilized; unworthy - we see this from a young age; this affects who we are. This is about changing the perception of the continent; from the inside out - one film at a time, one person at at a time. That person could be you...

-->"Wow - alright. I am on board - how can I help? " <--

  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN - make it spread like an epidemic of FILM POSITIVITY!!
  • You can help by contributing to this campaign! We need $70,000 to make the best version of this film. We want to get the best talent in the world working on this film; and produce a world class film that says something about the African adolescent experience while still being ridiculously fun.
  • And speaking of World Class here are the main TEAM MEMBERS so far!

NICHOLAS SAVANDER - CINEMATOGRAPHER

He has been the man in charge of the Camera for WILD WEST ALASKA; EVERY STREET UNITED for XBOX Entertainment Studios; and PROMOS forAMC'S BETTER CALL SAUL,  he's worked on every type of TV and Film project imaginable from NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC to CSI:NY and CSI: LAS VEGAS and he is a badass! The company he owns has worked on films like DRIVE; with people like SNOOP DOGG, JUSTIN TIMBERLAKE;  JAY-Z (Holy Grail Music Video) and brands like SONY, SPIKE TV, LEXUS and more!  Check out more about him and his company here - http://www.hollywoodspecialops.com/


TAKU SCRUTTON - EXECUTIVE PRODUCER

My big sister! Nepotism yes, but the good kind! She is the reason I survived Hollywood and the reason I won the Oscars competition. She is the recipient of numerous business awards from the GOVERNMENT OF AUSTRALIA for advancing opportunities for ethnic minorities; She is a globally in demand PUBLIC SPEAKER; and was just invited to speak at AUSTRALIA'S NATIONAL YOUTH LEADERSHIP DAY. She's a Children's book Author, and Social Justice visionary! She's even interviewed the Prime Minister of Australia LIVE on THE PROJECT on NETWORK 10! More about her here -
http://taku.com.au/talks/

We plan to cast from ZIMBABWE and AROUND THE WORLD (know a talented Aboriginal Australian? Email zimhighmovie@gmail.com) and get some very special people in this movie - As we get more AWESOME team members we will update you - but first......

WE NEED YOU!!!


  • The money you send in will cover the following:
  1.  Cast and Crew payments, Food and transportation (40%)
  2. Production Gear rental (Cameras, Lights, etc) (30%)
  3. Production Design, and Costume Design (7%)
  4. Perks (5%)
  5. Indiegogo; PayPal; National Registration Fees (10%)
  6. Digital Storage, Graphics, Still Photography & Electronic Press Kit (5%)
  7. Film Festival Entry Fees (3%)

-->"Great! TAKE MAH MUNNI! But what, do I get in return?"<--

You get PERKS!!!

Check out our aptly themed PATH TO PREFECT CAMPAIGN perks section with AWESOME PERKS! Which include

  • Snarky or sensible ZIM HIGH Social Media Shoutouts!
  • Portraits designed by the main character:
  • Invites to the ZIM HIGH Premiere and more!
We are supremely confident that you will understand the importance of our mission and help us achieve our goal. We will make this film whether we get 0 dollars or a billion- that is our commitment - but at least $70,000 will allow us to make the best and most entertaining, and most WORLD CLASS version of this film that can and will proudly be shown in African theaters and maybe even across the entire, friggin, universe. JOIN THE TEAM - WE CAN DO THIS!!
THANKS FOR READING THIS FAR!!!!

-->"Excellent! Just one more thing ---Will this really help African film? What's the bigger picture?"<--

You're good. Yes this film will definitely help more than just us! You are changing the history of Zimbabwean and African film. Yes this is Africa, and it doesn't snow - but we want to create an avalanche to get a world class industry started.

  • No matter where you are from - you have felt rejected at some point or other. (if you have never felt rejection please email me so I can learn from you). It can either break or build you - if you are lucky - it does both. This film is about showing the underdog story from an African teenage perspective. We are the little guy, the underdog, the loser, no-one cares about us. But not for long. You are saying yes to A - the Power of African Film - and yes to B seeing more Diversity on Screen; but not false tokenized diversity - this film pulls no punches in its satirical and raw approach to high school life and the world.
  • I think seeing ourselves on screen will help young people believe in themselves which goes a long way in a world that is not kind to young black people. Above all, my mission is to create empathy through entertainment. Perhaps a South African would be less likely to behead a fellow Zimbabwean if they had seen a movie like this growing up. Maybe.
  • Film and Television are America's number #2 export after Energy - It's HIGH time Africa started telling its own stories, and by doing so charting its own socio-economic future. Lets get started!
  •  The main reason to make this movie - is TO MAKE MORE MOVIES!! We shall not go gently into the night - we have so much to africanly say about being alive! The success of this project and others like it; will help get more high quality projects going, and not just by me - by other Zimbabwean Filmmakers; and other Africans too. SUPPORT!! SUPPORT!! MAXIMUM SUPPORT!!!
  • Let's all watch ourselves. We are all worthy.


-->"You got me. I'm in. However I can't give you money right now cause things be tight. What else can I do?" <--


If you cannot make it rain upon ZIM HIGH just yet - do not worry -

You can make some NOISE!! GET ANGRY ABOUT AFRICAN STORIES THAT NEED TO BE TOLD! SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!

  • This is a first step in supporting a Zimbabwean, and African Film industry that is sustainable, and that has appeal inside & outside Africa - if we are to be the dark continent - we will do so on our own terms - DAMMIT! -- MAKE SOME NOISE - GET PEOPLE TO SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN!!!
  • There is a ZIM HIGH Facebook page! Even a friggin ZIM HIGH Twatter (everybody has a twatter) Use #zimhigh to attract the institution's attention!
  • You can also use the handy Indiegogo share tools below!

It's high time for Africa! ZIM HIGH TIME.

MAXIMUM SUPPORT!!!!!


If you have any questions about the campaign, the movie or anything related to it - email zimhighmovie@gmail.com

Check back for awesome and amazing updates on the campaign!

story:
Who We Are

Skully Serves is dedicated to promoting volunteerism and encouraging teenagers and young adults to become actively involved in their community.


We provide engaging, informative, and meaningful outreach opportunities. Through local outreaches and service learning, our plan is to connect teens with their favorite musical artists by volunteering, service learning, and working together.


Equally, we will take action on outreach issues that are of significance to us and our community. It is our mission to become a driving force in enthusing young people to grow and remain responsibly involved while becoming pillars 
within their communities.

It's our responsibility!



Skully Serves-What We Need 

Funds will go directly to the Skully Serves Teen Community Outreaches! 

The community outreach event: Funds will go to: cleaning and set-up materials (trashbags, rakes, gloves, brooms, mops, etc), venue, marketing (promotional-banners, flyers etc.), merchandise (t-shirts, wristbands), entertainment (band will perform that day for teens), goody bags and raffle prizes for teens. This will be a fun event. It's all about the teens...getting them excited and motivated about volunteering!

The community outreach event for our teens will range from neighborhood clean up, school clean up, feeding the homeless, helping habitat for humanity etc.


What You Get

PERKS! Meet your favorite band! Tickets to the official launch party, an event thrown in your honor, we come to your town and throw an outreach event in your honor, and so much more! Moreover, if there's something that maybe you want to tweak...we'd love to work with you in order to make you happy :)


The Impact

Our mission at Skully Serves is to show that volunteering is exciting, gratifying, and advantageous. Unfortunately, volunteering isn't necessarily considered a "cool" activity to have. It usually has a bad connotation, mostly associated with bad behaviors resulting as punishment from the court system.

Our goal at Skully Serves is to completely reject any association with the prior statement. We want volunteerism to be synonymous with fun. Moreover, we want to show teens that volunteering IS enjoyable and more so important for our well being. Our wish is that the music scene will embrace this movement and that artists will do their part by helping to raise awareness as well as volunteering in the community outreaches.

We want the work of Skully Serves to strike an active chord within our young people. Rather than passively sympathize with a problem or cause, teenagers will find a solution and take action. We want to instill the importance of volunteerism into the forefront of teenagers' minds where they feel absolutely compelled, responsible, and eager to maintain an active role in their community.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate money, no worries. There are many ways you can help:
  • Direct your friends to our website www.SkullyServes.com
  • Find us on social media and follow us! We follow back! We're on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! Share our pages and you win free Cyber Hugs and LOVE all day :)
  • When you Tweet, Instagram or Facebook use the hashtag: #SkullyServes
  • Share this Indiegogo Campaign with your Friends, Parents, Investors, or anyone that may be interested in what we're doing! Word of Mouth goes a long way!
Finally, a sincere thank you from the bottom of our heart for any and all support by spreading the word, donating, sharing, reading etc. Thank you so much! Already very appreciative and grateful <3

-Martese
story_txt:
Who We AreSkully Serves is dedicated to promoting volunteerism and encouraging teenagers and young adults to become actively involved in their community.
We provide engaging, informative, and meaningful outreach opportunities. Through local outreaches and service learning, our plan is to connect teens with their favorite musical artists by volunteering, service learning, and working together.
Equally, we will take action on outreach issues that are of significance to us and our community. It is our mission to become a driving force in enthusing young people to grow and remain responsibly involved while becoming pillars within their communities.
It's our responsibility!
   
Skully Serves-What We Need Funds will go directly to the Skully Serves Teen Community Outreaches! The community outreach event: Funds will go to: cleaning and set-up materials (trashbags, rakes, gloves, brooms, mops, etc), venue, marketing (promotional-banners, flyers etc.), merchandise (t-shirts, wristbands), entertainment (band will perform that day for teens), goody bags and raffle prizes for teens. This will be a fun event. It's all about the teens...getting them excited and motivated about volunteering!The community outreach event for our teens will range from neighborhood clean up, school clean up, feeding the homeless, helping habitat for humanity etc.What You GetPERKS! Meet your favorite band! Tickets to the official launch party, an event thrown in your honor, we come to your town and throw an outreach event in your honor, and so much more! Moreover, if there's something that maybe you want to tweak...we'd love to work with you in order to make you happy :)
    

The ImpactOur mission at Skully Serves is to show that volunteering is exciting, gratifying, and advantageous. Unfortunately, volunteering isn't necessarily considered a "cool" activity to have. It usually has a bad connotation, mostly associated with bad behaviors resulting as punishment from the court system.Our goal at Skully Serves is to completely reject any association with the prior statement. We want volunteerism to be synonymous with fun. Moreover, we want to show teens that volunteering IS enjoyable and more so important for our well being. Our wish is that the music scene will embrace this movement and that artists will do their part by helping to raise awareness as well as volunteering in the community outreaches.
We want the work of Skully Serves to strike an active chord within our young people. Rather than passively sympathize with a problem or cause, teenagers will find a solution and take action. We want to instill the importance of volunteerism into the forefront of teenagers' minds where they feel absolutely compelled, responsible, and eager to maintain an active role in their community.


Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't afford to donate money, no worries. There are many ways you can help:Direct your friends to our website www.SkullyServes.com

Find us on social media and follow us! We follow back! We're on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter! Share our pages and you win free Cyber Hugs and LOVE all day :)
When you Tweet, Instagram or Facebook use the hashtag: #SkullyServes

Share this Indiegogo Campaign with your Friends, Parents, Investors, or anyone that may be interested in what we're doing! Word of Mouth goes a long way!
Finally, a sincere thank you from the bottom of our heart for any and all support by spreading the word, donating, sharing, reading etc. Thank you so much! Already very appreciative and grateful <3-Martese

story:
THE GOAL WAS: raise money to FIND JAMES FRANCO.

THE GOAL IS: raise money to SAVE ME, my x-girlfriend LEA's last remaining ovary from cysts and cryogenically freeze her eggs.

I wish I was kidding. I am not. THIS IS A TRUE REAL LIFE STORY. Happening right now, this very moment.

My, name is MARK WYNN SWEATMAN, I'm the featured performance artist & star of Document ME -  a selfie documentary - I have been filming for 5 years and along side ME has always been my girlfriend & producing partner, LEA KOVACH.

She she is truly who this story is now about... let me explain:

The PLAN WAS raise our road-trip budget by crowd sourcing a STAGE 1: ROAD TRIP to take the Doc-ME crew to film some key star interviews. Our intention was to FIND JAMES FRANCO.  We had agreed on a reduced budget that we require to complete the film.

Lea dropped me off to post this exact page your reading now, while she had to go the doctors for a long awaited appointment (8months).

As I was typing our campaign - she called me crying from the doctors office and said "they're back." She meant the cysts on her ovaries. Well, one remaining ovary, she already had the other one removed 5 years ago, I remember I was there then too.

Some many years later here we are, broken as a couple but together as best friends and owners of our independent film company, FINDING ME FILMS. 

So when she called me crying to say: "the doctor said normally I like to be sunny in my diagnosis but this, honey, doesn't look so sweet for you. I am sorry."

 This diagnosis is an urgent call for surgery to remove her last ovary and to save some of her eggs so that they can be cryogenically frozen (just like a James Bond movie - without a hero).


SO WE ARE ASKING ALL OF YOU & OUR MOVIE FANS TO HELP BE OUR HERO -

LEA NEEDS YOU TO BECOME THE HERO OF THE FILM.

LEA NEEDS YOU TO SAVE HER EGGS SO SOMEDAY SHE CAN HAVE A BABY.


Lea is a most talented producer and actor. She is strong and determined, passionate and professional a wonderful film-maker, artist and friend.

She has to return to the doctors to remove her last chance to have a child. Lea has always wanted a baby. However, in less than 8 weeks her chances will be gone.

We will save her ovary, remove the cysts, and freeze her eggs. 

Lea will then live. Love. Laugh. Give LIFE. and still be the leading lady hero in many more films.

I hope you can help us turn a real life tragedy into a real dramatic documentary triumph.


THIS IS THE REAL TRUE STORY HAPPENING AS YOU READ THIS.

This is.... DOCUMENT ME.


I ask for your support in sharing this story. 


If we reach our goals we will post the medical receipts on line as proof of payment received and rewarded to the right people.  We will,  ME will- still finish the film.

IF we are fortunate enough to shoot past our GOAL to the  STRETCH GOAL 

then we would follow through as shown below:

FIRST GOAL SAVE LEA: first $12,000 raised all goes towards the costly medical procedures that are not covered under insurance.

STRETCH GOAL:  $24,000     STAGE 1- FINDING FRANCO the road trip portion of the documentary to  finding James Franco and film interviews of "selfie-celebrities." 

STRETCH MARK'S GOAL: $50,000  STAGE 2 & 3  - THE BIG OPENING/ FINISH - Filmed scenes & sequences for a wild opening and ending credits - including an art-show & POST PRODUCTION & MARKETING. 

Total Budget of Film:  $50,000 


Total Budget first of funds used to SAVE DocME's leading lady LEA: $12,000

AT THIS POINT WE ARE FOCUSED OUR FUNDRAISING TO HELP LEA - WE NEED TO COVER $12,000 worth of medical procedures not covered by insurance to save Lea's last ovary & eggs and allow her to have children.  SHE IS WILL BE HAVING THIS SURGERY IN APRIL - THIS IS HER LAST CHANCE TO SAVE HER EGGS AND LAST CHANCE TO HAVE A CHILD.  IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO SEE LEA HAVE CHILDREN WE ASK YOU FOR YOUR HELP & THANK YOU FOR YOUR LOVE AND SUPPORT.  You can help Lea achieve her dream of having children and in doing that also influence an amazing story that is DOCUMENT ME.  The true, tragic and timely comedic real life movie.


Sincerely,

Mark Wynn Sweatman

Creative Director / Executive Producer 

Finding ME Films

www.findingmefilms.com

story:
The Macrae Report Goes on Air

Designed to allow a talking shop and news review service the for whole of Scotland, the service is broadcasting daily on youtube, the blogcast carries news, reviews, interviews as well as call in sessions, allowing all Scots a voice in this upcoming election battle.


This campaign will allow The Macrae Report to advertise its content on FB, and allow the purchase of additonal equipment as well as travel.


We need a good quality outside broadcast camera, mic and associated gear, as well as an allowance for travel as we interview people all over Scotland, our main recording studio is complete, but we lack a high quality outside recording rig, a donation of a couple of quid will help us get the equipment we need, so please support our ambition to have news that's important to all of us here in Scotland, you can follow our youtube series and news on FB below, as we ramp up coverage of the GE, you can be sure The Macrae Report will bring a new edge to political coverage within Scotland, and give a voice to the growing army of Scots who will not be silenced....


https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Macrae-Repor...

story:
Tragedy and Hope is a YouTube channel dedicated to creating inspiring and thought provoking videos. You might have seen a few yourself.

Isaac Blencowe is a one man team, creating these videos for the good of humanity, without pay or reward. He is having some difficulties and computer trouble which is not allowing him to post new amazing videos, and i think that is a shame. And he is too kind to ask for help. 

I think its time we give back to someone who has given us all so much. A new, powerful laptop which will be able to create bigger, better videos, and allow Isaac to do what he loves.

story: i have acquired a boat to be my home which is in manorca plans are in place for me to get there my passport forms are in so a bit of a wait there i need to raise some money for mooring fees whilst i work through the summer to fund my first sailing adventure towards new-zeland the mooring it is on at the moment costs 300 euros per month so the 1800 would cover the mooring for 6 months whilst i work

story:
What is Blue Shoes about?

A struggling author (Alvaro Conjura) discovers his unpopular conspiracy book serves as a guideline for a gang of misfits and their war against the incoming martial law, and must decide to either join the cause or coward before his own words.

Meet the Team

Javier Mosquera from http://www.solidtreefilms.com/ is an experienced cinematographer, comic artist, editor, and director as well as a childhood friend of Juan Rosas. When the two reunited in Miami after numerous years, they put their talents together to bring you Blue Shoes.

 Javier is the Executive Producer, Cinematographer, Editor, and Assitant Director of Blue Shoes.
 
Juan Rosas plays Alvaro Conjura. He's the lead actor, writer, and director of Blue Shoes. He's written numerous screenplays anbd teleplays, and finially decided to make his directorial debut with Blue Shoes. He's also versed in acting, and has been working hard on bringing a full fledged character to the screen.

Meet the Cast

The Shoemaker (Played by Jean Carlo Taveras)

Owner of a men's shoe store – the shoemaker prepares a group of men to survive the government collapse and incoming martial law with teachings from book titled Blue Shoes by A.C. They learned to fire guns, prepared emergency food supplies, and most importantly save citizens from the long arm of the law.


Alvaro Conjura aka A.C. (Played by Juan Rosas)

A struggling author with a failed book about the incoming Martial Law in America puts on the blue shoes and joins a gang of likeminded individual’s that treat his book as guidelines for the incoming Martial Law.  Together they vowed to protect their city from the corrupt Government Police. 


Blue Shoes Summary

Somewhere in Miami, Florida, conspiracy author Alvaro Conjura receives an opportunity to sit-down with the owner of a local publishing company, Linda Fulton, to discuss a potential publishing deal for his failed book “Blue Shoes.” When it’s Al’s turn to be evaluated, Linda waste no time in pleasantries and calls the book a poorly written government conspiracy. Al looks up towards the ceiling in desperation.

Al stares at the rotating ceiling fan in his room when his cellphone interrupts his train of thought. Finally, Al’s pent up frustration gets the best of him, and he throws the phone against the wall. The ringing abruptly stops, but after a few seconds it starts up again. Al answers the phone “Hey, it’s Wash. You down to play a quick two on two?” said the voice on the other line – Al’s high school buddy Felix Washington or Wash. Al hesitatingly agrees and makes his way to an empty shoe rack to pick up his old pairs of sneakers.

Stepping up to the three point line in beat up sneakers – Al shoots but Wash blocks the shot. “Come on, son! You’re not ready for the zombie apocalypse!” shouts Wash. Meanwhile his team mate Pablo imitates a zombie eating Al’s teammate Matt. This sparks a heated debate over government conspiracies. After a back and forth game both teams are tied, and Al rushes for a game winning lay-up when the soles of his shoe split and he falls flat on his face. Wash snatches the ball and passes it to Pablo. He shoots – He scores! Wash and Pablo high five, and then Wash helps Al get back on his feet and hands him a business card for a shoe store.

Al puts the card away and enters the shoe store. A voice comes from the back and says “Take a seat.” He sits on a bench when an odd young man comes out holding a box of shoes. Al’s offended by his frankness, but before he can leave the odd man quotes a line from his book. It turns out this man is known as ShoeMaker and he wants Al to join his band of freedom fighters that follow his book as a guidelines to combat the government. After much convincing Al grabs a blue shoe – the symbol of joining the cause and he slips it right in.

One year later – Al ties his blue shoes while News clips of the financial collapse, martial law and riots play on the television. A gunshot breaks the silence. Al grabs his gun and heads outside. He shoots. Takes cover, and finally jumps the fence to escape the gunfire.

Al runs into an alley with a dead end, but by the time he turns back there’s a menacing gang walking his way. Al aims his gun, but there’s too many of them. Lucky for him the gang ends up being the blue shoes army. The Shoemaker welcomes Al to the group, and reintroduces him to his friend Wash - also a member. When suddenly a flash of blue and red, light up the alley – it’s the militarized police. The Blue Shoes Army attacks with all their might in order to defend their city from Martial Law. 

Why Donate?

Filmmaking is an expensive endeavor, and in order to make the best short film possible we are going to need your help. The more money we raise, the better it will look, feel, and even sound. More funds for this campaign means more money for:

  • Equipment Rentals (Boom Mics, Lights, Cameras, Lenses, etc.)
  • Liability Insurance (for Public Locations including Cop Supervision)
  • Art Design (Props, Wardrobe, Set Design)
  • Transportation (Gas and Parking)
  • Makeup for Characters
  • Food (The Cast and Crew got to eat in order to perform)
  • Compensation for Cast and Crew (Sound Designer, CamGrip, PA, etc.)

Risks & Challenges

Naturally we will have to deal with many risks and challenges before, during, and after production, but our goal is to produce a great short film with Javier's past expertise and Juan's passion for film we will rise to the challenge and conquer anything that comes our way.

It's all about the Perks! 

We appreciate each and every penny we get to make our dream come true, but we also want to make it fun and rewarding for you to donate.  You can receive perks such as signed copies of the script, storyboard scans, an executive producer credit in our film, and of course a link to a private viewing of our film for your viewing pleasure, months before it's submitted to film festivals. Those of you who donate a certain amount will even receive your very own comic style drawings by Javier just like the drawing of Alvaro Conjura you see on our page, and even a custom made bio written by Juan that situates you in the world of Blue Shoes.  

Find the perfect perk tailored just for you, and become part of our community of supporters!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word. Even if you can't donate please share this campagin with everyone you know. Every share counts, and it can either make or break this campaign.
Thank you for supporting us. We will be updating this campaign day by day, and week by week.

story:
About

In a Week is a psychological drama that explores the boundaries between reality and our innermost thoughts and fears. It purposes the question that it is possible to  diminish even the most explicit voices in our heads by the use of medically prescribed drugs.
Main character, Darla Aimes, is convinced she is suffering from an incurable illness. Darla experiences vivid dreams that are eerily familiar.  She religiously consoles with her doctor, Dr. Stine, with hopes that he can cure her of these dreams with the different dosages of prescribed drugs.

Is Darla really sick? Is Dr. Stine truly trying to help her or use the unique case as an experiment? Will she ever get better?
In order to find out the answer to any of these questions we need your help to have the resources to allow this story to unfold.

Who We Are

Gabrielle Lunger- Writer/Editor 
Daniel Cimini- Director

We are two filmmakers that have worked together on projects ranging from short narratives to music videos. Daniel takes care of the directing progress and casting. Gabby takes care of the post production. Together, we create films that cause the viewers to question what they've seen and how they feel. Our content may be controversial but it addresses issues that the general public may be afraid still exists. We create characters who are faced with real and unimaginable choices with the uncertainty if they will make it out alive. 

The Process 


We are currently still in pre-production. We have casted the roles with promising actors and are beginning to lock down our locations. In order to continue we need the funding that will allows us to pull all of the pieces together. 

We will post updates along the process that will include behind the scenes and Q&A with our director and lead actors.

What We Need

1. This is a professional shoot which means we will be needing to rent top of the line lenses to ensure the best visual quality for our piece.

2. We will have to rent out locations in order for this world to come to life! 

3. Craft Services! A crew must be well feed and hydrated for the long hours we will be putting in. 

4. If we make more than our goal then we would like to continue the series. We have written what we call a series bible that entails all the following episodes in significant detail! 

-- This is a non-profit project. We are just trying to create a web-series for pure enjoyment for the viewers.


Other Ways You Can Help

1. SHARE! Even if you cannot contribute to the fund, simply sharing our post to your friends will potentially bring in new viewers. 

We appreciate all the help and are excited to bring you something new and worth watching.
